loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a single man living in a sector of Jordan called Irbid. He is studying to get his bachelor degree in Interior Design and he is now in his second year. The income that comes from his father’s pension is income for his family that consists of six members. Recently his father is facing some problems that lead Osama to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees.

Osama`s future plan is to work in his field of study.

loans.use: to pay his second year university fees in Interior Design

loans.name: Labebah

texts.en: Labebah is a 19 years old single lady living with her family in Ramtha. She is a university student majoring in English Language and she is in her first year. Her father is retired with low income. Labeebah is aiming to also find a job in her study field after graduating. She is now asking for your help to pay for her upcoming semester fees by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to help pay her first year university education fees in English Language

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza was born in 1990 year. She is married and has 2 children. Shahnoza is very industrious woman. She has been busy with sewing woman national dresses more than a year. Shahnoza has two children. Her children are little. Shahnoza works hard to offer her children with good living condition. She is ill for some year and she must to buy medicines for her treatment. Shahnoza is asking for a loan of 2000 somoni to buy medicines. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Alnour Group

texts.en:
Shaykha is the featured borrower of Al Nour group, she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been close neighbors and friends, and they work hard to develop their families living.

Shaykha is a hard working lady she is a 38-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a doctor's secretary since 2000, to support her husband in covering their family’s increasing living needs.

Shaykha’s limited monthly income combined with her husband’s low income, aren’t enough to cover any unexpected issue. Thus an acquired loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, will help Shaykha to pay for her children's increased school tuition fees.

Shaykha is the first lady from the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Rana is at the center, while Souha is at the far left side.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increased school tuition fees.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 29-year-old married mother of six children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a small business selling ladies clothes from home. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price and sells it for higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like her clothing collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased due to the upcoming Eid festival and people are demanding charming clothes. Her husband meets all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.

She has requested a loan so that she can buy more charming and delightful colored clothing to sell before Eid festival. Shazia wishes for a bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy charming and delightfully colored clothing to sell before Eid festival from her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy vegetables, meat, fruit, and more.

loans.name: Tahaa

texts.en:
Tahaa lives in Irbid. He's studying Mosaic Restoration and he would like to complete his degree and find good job where he can apply all the knowledge he learned in the university.
Tahaa is very hard worker and he is doing all he can to become a successful professional man and be useful to society He is working beside his educational in one of the shops in his city.
His father faced financial problems so he could not help Tahaa in his tuition fees, therefore he applied for an education loan to pay the fees of his degree and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay his university fees in Mosaic Restoration

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies to make food, such as vegetables, meat, condiments, green vegetables and other produce.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat, who is married to a barber, wants a loan to help her husband's barber shop redecoration. The loan would be used to buy items like scissors for cutting hair, water sprayer, seats, chairs and a mirror. Unable to make ends meet, the new setup would generate enough earnings to help Musarat come out of difficult financial times. Moreover, Musarat's husband plans to expand his barber shop by inserting more seats and hiring more personnel, who would help him in cutting hair.

Therefore, the loan is extremely important for the inflow of income into Musarat's home and for meeting the basic requirements of her household.

loans.use: to buy items like scissors for cutting hair, water sprayer, seats, chairs and a mirror for her husband's barber shop redecorating purpose.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a 42-years-old married woman. She has been making hand embroidery at home for many years to support her family. To cherish her children and to meet household expenses she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all the raw materials for making embroidery. She completes her tasks along with her daughters over wooden frames.

She wants to sell embroidery directly in the market, so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art and wants to buy raw material her own so that she can sell her hand made embroidery in her hometown.
Therefore, Safia has requested a Kiva loan to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can make more embroidered dresses to sell and could generate maximum income.
She is a mother of two daughters and two sons. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her embroidery sales.

loans.use: to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can make more embroidered dresses to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARISUN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Dominga sigue con el negocio de artesanía, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño  que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue vendiendo sus artesanías a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communnal bank KANCHARISUN, which is located in the district and department of Cusco.

Dominga is continuing in the business of artisan products. She has been doing this for a good amount of time and it going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She continues to sell her artisan products to the customers who ask for them. She hopes to be able to continue working and in this way, continue helping her family. She is grateful for the loan granted and she is committed to making the repayments.

She is asking for a loan to buy sweaters and other things.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and other things.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 45-year-old, married father of three children, and a Palestinian refugee.

Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, three years ago he started working as a blacksmith to cover the needs and expenses of his family, supported by his wife, who is running a small convenience store in their region.

Today, Mazen is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to expand his business by buying necessary iron pillars for a new project he is working on.

This is the second loan cycle Mazen has requested from Al Majmoua. His previous loan helped him to buy necessary iron products to facilitate his work and provide his customers with better and quick service.

He proved to be a good-standing borrower. Mazen is trying hard to increase his income, to improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy necessary iron pillars for a new project he is working on.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a small-holder farmer from Kitale area of Kenya. She is a mother of five. Like many farmers in the region, she has a dairy cow. Kitale has a thriving market for dairy products. Fridah has sustained herself through dairy farming for seven years now. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes so deep that she even names each of them. She has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now.

From Kiva lenders, Fridah is borrowing KES 45,000 to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production in the farm. As a result, she will have more quantity for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Fridah plans to settle the high farming cost of production. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase milk sales and production.

loans.name: Sarvarby

texts.en: Sarvarby was born in 1976. She is married and has four children. Sarvarby is a dressmaker who makes traditional women's dresses. Sarvarby has been busy at this work for more than four years. She sews very beautiful dresses, working hard for 10 hours a day. She is the main breadwinner for her family. Sarvarby is ill, and she needs financial support. She is applying for a loan of 2,000 TJS (Tajikistan Somoni) to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your mercy and really needs your support.

loans.use: to buy medicines to treat her illness.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARISUN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Maria Jesús sigue con el negocio de venta de artículos de regalos y la socia a la vez la socia continua trabajando en una empresa privada, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la ocia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de adornos, relojes entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the KANCHARISUN communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member Maria Jesús continues with her business selling gift ware and at the same time she continues to work for a private company. She has had her business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into her work each day. This is the way the member gets her family ahead.

Maria Jesús is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with her installments payments.

She is requesting the loan to buy decorations and watches amongst others.

loans.use: to buy decorations and watches amongst others.

loans.name: Odrine

texts.en:
Odrine is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 53 years old and lives with her husband in the Chuka area of Kenya. She is blessed with five children who are her greatest motivation in life. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Odrine was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

Odrine has always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in her blood. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her goats, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her dairy goats. Her goats produce between 1-2 liters a day; this helps her support her family. Odrine also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Odrine is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Odrine believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Odrine's way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to boost his clothing sales.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат уроженка Зафарободского района. Она простая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 57 лет, она замужем и мать троих детей. Около десяти лет Рохат занимается животноводством. Она очень любит свою работу и сама обеспечивает свою семью почти всеми молочными продуктами. К сожалению, её жизненные условия не очень хороши, так как они живут в старом доме. Рохат решила отремонтировать свой дом, накопив немного средств от своей деятельности, однако этого не достаточно. Рохат с огромной надеждой верит в Вашу поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Rohat is a resident of the Zafarobod region. She is a simple and hardworking woman of 57, married with three children. She has been working in animal husbandry for about 10 years. She loves her work very much and takes care of her family with her own dairy products. Unfortunately, her living conditions are not very good, since they live in an old house. Rohat has decided to renovate her house, having saved up some money from her business, although she doesn't have enough. She believes with great hope in your support and understanding.

loans.use: to renovate her home

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Thirty-five years old Rolinda is a fish vendor. She sells fresh fish to the locals where she lives. She has a three-year old child. This is the source of her income. Her husband also has a small business which will help her to meet their daily needs.

Morena is asking for a loan to buy additional fresh fish, weighing scale and cellophane. With the presence of the resources, Rolinda would able to improve her earnings and start to settle her obligation. Thus, she could provide her growing child with good food and better living condition.

In the future, she dreams to have a fishing boat to have supplemental income that could support the needs of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh fish, weighing scale and cellophane

loans.name: Gülçin

texts.en:
Gülçin is 22 years old and has one child. She started selling Amway cleaning products with advice from a friend. First she sold the products to her neighbours then she increased the number of her clients. With the help of the loan from Maya she bought products in bulk and increased her profit.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Gülçin Hanım 22 yaşında evli ve 1 çocuk annesi. Bir arkadaşının tavsiyesi ile amway (network işi) temizlik ürünleri satışına başlamış. Önce yakın çevresine satış yapmış daha sonra belirli bir müşteri çevresi oluşturmuş. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan ürün siparişi vererek kar oranını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy Amway products for re-selling.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleemah is 62 years old, lives in Salt and is the mother of three children.

She has been facing difficulties in her life; her husband is working for a low income and she is working hard to live. She is doing anything to help her husband and she never complains.

Now her daughter is 21 years old and she is studying sports. She wants to see her graduate and find good work. Perhaps she will remove some of the responsibility that she has carried all these years, and help her father with the household expenses.

Haleemah applied for an educational loan to pay the university fees for her daughter because she could not cover her fees.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en: Rona is a 32-year-old woman from the community of Badian, Cebu.  She is married with four children ages 1 to 10. Rona is engaged in raising hogs for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed to maintain the feed requirements to fatten her animals. She hopes that she can continue sending her children to school and make a success out of her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice would like to use the loan to buy more items like new saucepans, plates and glasses for her restaurant business.

She is a mother of four children and she deals in cooking and selling food in Bundibugyo, Uganda. The business has now been in existence for six years with high rates of growth as customers keep increasing day by day. She also has a side income from her cocoa garden through selling the cocoa. She has future hopes of building a house and being able to save money on rent expenses.

loans.use: to buy utensils like saucepans, plates, spoons and glasses for her restaurant.

loans.name: Adrian Othon

texts.en:
Adrian is a man in his late 20s. He is single and currently lives at his mother's place. He earns a living by working as a network engineer for an insurance company. With his income, he could rent a place to live on his own, but his mother has a medical condition and he has been taking care of her.

His biggest achievement is finishing his career and having a job that helps him to provide for his mother. Adrian's mother's condition requires her to take an injection once a year, but this medical treatment is very expensive, so Adrian is looking for a 9,200 MXN loan to pay for the treatment. This is not the first time he has taken a loan in order to pay for the injection. He has taken previous loans at other places and paid for them with no problems at all. Now he thinks the best option to take this loan is from Kubo in association with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a special injection for his mother.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mats to sell .

loans.name: Hacer

texts.en:
Hacer is single and lives alone. She makes jewellery and pipes from meerschaum stone. When she started this business she sold them on stands. With her savings and opened a store of her own. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy meerschaum stone. She is planning to make jewellery and pipes, sell them, make money and develop her business.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hacer hanım bekar ve yalnız yaşıyor. Lüle taşından takı ve pipo yapıyor. Bu işe başladığında yaptığı ürünleri tezgahta satmış para biriktirmiş ve dükkan açmış. Kullandığı mikro kredi ile lüle taşını ham olarak alacak. Aldığı malzemeden takı ve pipo yaparak üreterek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy meerschaum stone

loans.name: Reginia

texts.en:
Reginia is a fish vendor. She sold fresh fish to the local in her place. She hails in the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is forty-five years of age. A mother of three children. Her oldest child is 23 and the youngest is 19. One of her child is still attending school. It has been five years now that she has been engaged in fish vending business for five years now. She needs additional funds to support her current business.

She has requested a loan to buy additional stocks of fish, cooler for fish storage,ice and cellophane. These are vital in making her livelihood more productive. She could now sell more fish and be able to improve her earnings. Thus, she could able to expand and even invest any possible business ventures,that eventually lead to become successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish, cooler for fish storage, ice and cellophane.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is an aged man married with children and lives in Kito Mityana town. He has a piggery business besides which he has eucalyptus tree forest as a supplementing income. The client is 60 years old married with five children who attend school.

He is challenged by the need to pay their tuition fees, this being back to school season and because the children will not be able to sit for the end of year exams without completing the school fees. He needs the loan to pay tuition. The client works so hard but challenged with disease outbreak that reduced the number of his animals and income in the long run.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his children.

loans.name: Boafo Ye Nna Group

texts.en: Akua is 50 years old. She comes from Homaho in the Assin South District in the Central Region of Ghana. Akua is a group representative of Boafo Ye Na Group. She is married and has 4 children. The ages of the children are 9, 15, 18 and 26. One of her children is currently in school. Akua is a farmer and has been in palm plantation for 30 years. She started farming at the age of 20 years because her parents didn’t have money to further her education. Akua says her only source of fuel has been firewood. Trekking for miles in search of firewood has been a challenge she faces. She spends most of her working hours searching for firewood. Akua needs micro loan support to buy an Elsa Clean Cook stove to assist her in saving the time involved in trekking for firewood for use profitably on her farm. She says the loan will be used to purchase an Elsa stove to relieve her from the long distance of travel in search of firewood. Akua thanks all Kiva micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy an Elsa Clean Cook stove.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 51 years old and he lives with his family in the Chorkor area of the capital city of the country. Michael has been operating small Chemist shop where he has been selling assorted medicine to his customers for 15 years. Michael has two children who are both in school. Michael’s wife is also a trader, who also works hard so that, together, they can take care of their home and children.

Michael is asking for an amount of GHS 3,500 to buy assorted medicine including pills, syrups, injectables, and protectors which he will sell to customers. Apart from taking good care of his home he will also need to improve his business of fifteen years.

loans.use: to buy assorted medicine including pills, syrups, injectables and protectors which he will sell to customers.

loans.name: God Is The Greatest Group

texts.en:
Monica is 49 years old. She is from Homaho in the Assin South District of the Central Region of Ghana. Monica is the group representative of God is The Greatest Group. She is married with four children, ages 12, 18, 23 and 25. Two of her children are still in school. Monica is a palm plantation farmer with 25 years of experience. She sells palm oil at the local market to supplement her income. 

Monica participated in the community education program on the use of clean cook stoves and reducing deforestation. Monica said that the unavailability of other sources of fuel, apart from firewood and charcoal, has been her challenge. The introduction of the Elsa stove to her community will help her save costs from buying charcoal as fuel for cooking. It will also save her family from inhaling the smoke associated with other sources of fuel. She is very grateful to her Kiva lenders for their immense contribution to improving the lives of her family.

loans.use: to buy an Elsa clean cook stove

loans.name: Necla

texts.en:
Necla is married and a mother of two. She is making paternosters from meerschaum and selling them to stores. She heard about microcredit from one of her friends and applied. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulks of meerschaum stone, make paternosters and sell them, make money and improve her business.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Necla hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Lületaşından tesbih yapıyor ve dükkanlara toptan olarak veriyor. Mikro krediyi bir yakınından duyuyor ve imkanlarından faydalanmak istiyor. Müracaat ediyor ve mikro kredi kullanıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile lületaşını ham olarak alacak ve işleyerek üretip satarak para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy meerschaum stone

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, who is in her late 30s, is single with one child who is still in school. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jane’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stocks and she has successfully paid back all her loans. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees and the loan repayment, she bought a plot of land and a TV set, and she covered household expenses.

Jane will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store. She dreams of expanding her business.

Jane will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan's scheduled time.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is an individual client from Lwajja Kitigi with a business of alcohol distillation alongside coffee growing. The client is aged 47 years old married with five children. She’s looking forward to acquire a loan of five hundred thousand in order for her to buy molasses for alcohol fermentation so as to increase production. But her challenge is competition in the area of operation. She believes with the loan boost, her sales will increase and so will her finances. She is hard working and resilient.
Pictured is Lillian with the UGAFODE Credit staff.

loans.use: to buy molasses for making fermented local brew.

loans.name: Wishnoe

texts.en: Wishnoe thanks all his Kiva lenders who helped him with his rice cultivation. He repaid his loan fully and the profits, he could save for his house and for his family future. To continue with the rice production, wishnoe needs another loan of SRD 10.000.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Aidai

texts.en:
“I am an 18-year-old ambitious girl with big plans for future. Applying for Kiva loan I hope to realize those goals and count on lenders’ mercy. One of them is to become a Child Psychologist and help children to understand this world better, to make them get rid of bad feelings and grow a love in their family.

My parents divorced when I was 9 years old and I stayed with my father. Unfortunately my mother doesn’t keep in touch with us and we don’t know where she is. My father has serious health problems so he can’t work. We get assistance from our relatives, who support us morally and financially.

I finished Kyrgyz-Turkish Girls High school and mastered 4 languages: Kyrgyz, Russian, Turkish, English. The last one helped me to pass successfully AUCA entrance exams and I am on my way to my dreams. American University in central Asia is the best university in our region, which has modern and advanced methods of teaching, with qualified faculty and a variety of international students. I am a persistent student and I will do my best and study hard to achieve my goals here. As you know, nowadays good education costs good money, and according to my family’s financial problems, my father is not able to cover the whole tuition fee. My relatives believe in me and are ready to cover part of my tuition, but it’s not still enough. I know AUCA students who have a Kiva loan and, it helped them while they had hard times, so I also decided to follow their advice. Kiva changes lives and it’s true.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education costs

loans.name: German

texts.en:
“My name is German. People smile when they read it, as we write it as “German language”. But the letter “G” in my name is to be read as “G” in “Google”. I am a supporter of a healthy lifestyle. I had gone for taekwondo WTF for many years and I am a candidate of master of sport and have a first-degree black belt. Unfortunately, due to my health problems I just jog now and play tennis in summer.

This summer I finished school and enrolled at American University in Central Asia. This university is not just rich for qualified faculty and big library, but also gives a lot of opportunities for creativity and expanding horizons of students. I love AUCA spirit and value with the opportunity to meet many international students and staff here. The only problem is that my family is facing difficulties with payment of my tuition fee.

I have a very amicable and friendly family of four: father, mother, me and my 14-year-old sister. My father is not able to work due to his health problems. My mother is a teacher, I think, she is born to be a teacher. I love my family very much, whenever there is a difficult situation, my parents are the first people, whom I can rely on. Having financial problems is usual for my family as my mother is the only breadwinner. But my parents always strongly believe that education is the biggest wealth for human beings. That is why despite any financial difficulties, I joined AUCA community. I was told about financial aid and Kiva loan. I was so surprised to find such an interest-free loan, and for sure decided to apply for it. I hope that I will be one of the people whose future becomes brighter thanks to Kiva lenders.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education costs at AUCA

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha, who is in his late 30s, is married with three kids; one of them is still small and the other two are still in school. He has been running a genge business for eight years now. He works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Twaha’s 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his genge stock; he also started selling melons and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profits to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, repay loans, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in his genge business.

He is so grateful for the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He dreams of being an international business man.

Twaha will make sure he pays back his loan within the scheduled loan time.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in his genge business.

loans.name: Manuela Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARISUN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Manuela continua trabajando en una empresa privada, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar entre otros.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the Kancharisun communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco in Cusco province.

Manuela continues to work in a private business. She has been doing this job for a good while and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work every day. She is a responsible person who wants to continue working in this way in order to keep supporting her family.

She feels grateful for the loaned credit and promises to meet the agreed repayments.

Manuela is asking for this loan so that she can buy supplies for her home among other items.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her home amongst other items

loans.name: Waridi

texts.en:
Waridi is very thankful to all the Kiva lenders for their support. He has once again repaid his loan fully and on time.

The previous season was not so good for Waridi because the price of rice was too low, and he could not save enough. However, he hasn't lost hope, and continues with the rice cultivation.

He lacks finances, and needs a loan of 7,500 SRD to buy inputs for rice production.

loans.use: To buy inputs for his rice production

loans.name: Kongowe Kati Group

texts.en:
Rehema is in her early 40s and is married with four children. Two of them are still in school and two of them are grown up. She has been running a grocery store for two and a half years now. She works from 3pm to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her drinks stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, to repay loans, to buy a motorcycle and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy fast-moving drinks in her grocery store and to start selling spirits and wines. She dreams of owning a pub.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group, Kongowe Kati, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fast moving drinks in her grocery store to start selling spirits and wines.

loans.name: Claudia Elvia

texts.en:
Claudia is a 28-year-old married mother of three children, two in elementary school and the other a young baby.

She makes a living by working in a school as an assistant to the teacher. She earns extra income by renting out space for business.

Claudia's biggest achievements are raising her children and overcoming her academic limitations. She wants to finish remodeling the space she rents out by painting it and replacing broken glass.

Claudia is looking for a 16,000.00 MXN loan through Kubo and Kiva. Since she has worked with both organizations, she thinks this would be her best borrowing option. Kubo believes that Claudia will succeed because she repaid her one previous loan on time.

loans.use: to remodel a space that can be rented out.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
En una pequeña comunidad mexiquense se ubican las integrantes del grupo quienes se dedican plenamente al cuidado de sus familias. Las tradiciones son muy importantes en su municipio, en especial la celebración de la virgen de Guadalupe llevada a cabo los días doce de diciembre. Dicho festejo está acompañado de fuegos artificiales, bailes, misas y comidas en donde resaltan los platillos típicos de la zona.
   Doña Guadalupe es una mujer extremadamente trabajadora y responsable quien cuida de sus dos niños los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Lupita, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica  a la cría de pollos y pavos que cuida dentro de un corral ubicado en el exterior de su casa. En un inicio sólo se dedicaba a la cría de becerros, cerdos y ovejas, sin embargo al realizar un balance de gastos sobre ganancias cayó en cuenta de que el beneficio no era tan elevado como parecía. Posteriormente adquirió las aves de corral y su sorpresa fue grande al comparar los ingresos que obtenía; desde entonces ha decidido enfocar todos sus esfuerzos a estos animales ya que también producen huevos que le sirven para uso personal.
   Al tener tres años de experiencia en su actividad ha remodelado y ampliado los corrales para que las aves  puedan desarrollarse de manera óptima. Hoy en día vende 60, 80 e incluso 100 ejemplares al mes y realiza entregas todos los días dentro de su comunidad, asimismo hay clientes que acuden hasta su casa para solicitar producto fresco.
Por otro lado, tiene 14 años trabajando junto con VFMéxico para mejorar su negocio y comenta, "me han ayudado mucho, ahora tengo un negocio estable, antes vivíamos con mi suegra ahora tengo una casa propia y mis hijos siguen estudiando". Con el nuevo préstamo comprará pollos y alimento. Una de sus metas es aumentar su producción y construir cuatro galeras en donde pueda introducir 500 pollos.
      Las demás integrantes del grupo son Leticia  quien invierte en pavos; Perla Xochitl y Gloria, en borregos; Amelia y Josefina, en pollos y Ma. Guadalupe, en aves de corral.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, doña Lupita es quien viste el suéter gris.
texts.en:
In a small mexican community, the members of the groups are located, who are wholly dedicated to taking care of their families. Traditions are very important in her municipality, especially the celebration of the Virgin of Guadalupe, which is celebrated on the twelfth of December. This celebrations is done with fireworks, dances, masses, and meals where the typical dishes of the area stand out.

Guadalupe is an extremely hard-working and responsible woman who takes care of her two children, who attend school. Lupita, her nickname, works raising chickens and turkeys which she takes care of in a corral located outside of her home. In the beginning, she only worked raising calves, pigs, and sheep. However, when doing a balance of expenses over earnings, she realized that her profits were not as high as she had thought.

Later she bought the poultry animals, and to her surprise she found that the earnings were much better. Since then she has decided to completely focus and these animals, since they also produce eggs for her own personal use.

With three years of experience, she has remodeled and enlarged the pens the animals are in so they can develop in the best way. Now she sells 60, 80 or even up to 100 animals per month, and she does deliveries every day in her community. And there are some customers who come to her house to buy fresh products.

For fourteen years she has worked with VFMexico to improve her business, and comments, "they have helped me a lot, now I have a stable business, before we lived with my mother-in-law, now I have my own home and my children are still in school." Now with this new loan she will purchase chickens and feed. One of her goals is to increase production and build four chicken coops where she can raise 500 chickens.

The other members of the group are Leticia who raises turkeys; Perla Xochitl and Gloria, who raise calves; Amelia and Josefina, who raise chickens and Guadalupe, who raises poultry.
The photograph was taken in the town square, Lupita is wearing the gray sweater.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

location.town: Colonia Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Divine Name Group

texts.en:
Charlotte is 41 years old, married and has four children, all in school. She lives in Apam in the Gomoa West District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is the group representative of Divine Name. Charlotte's husband is a seaman who has been supporting her.

Charlotte is a petty trader who deals in ladies' shoes, bags, clothes, jewelry, and wedding materials in the local market. She has been trading for 20 years.

Charlotte has been with the field partner for three years and this is her sixth loan. Charlotte and her group members always pay on time and have good records.

She wants to buy more ladies' bags, shoes, clothes, and wedding materials for her shop which will enhance sales. The profit will be used to pay her children’s school fees.

Charlotte said the loan will help her a lot because it will increase her stock. Since her husband is a seaman and absent most of the time, the money she earns helps her to manage the family. Charlotte thanks all Kiva lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy ladies' bags, jewelry, and wedding materials for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Widows like Victoria may be considered exceptional because they perform the tasks and carry the responsibilities of both father and mother. She’s 48 years old, and provides for the needs of her children through her variety store business.

She buys usual commodities like toiletries, snack items, canned goods and beverages at wholesale prices, and then she sells them per piece to her neighbors in Talisay City, Cebu. A big portion of her income is utilized for their everyday needs, such as food and small school allowances for her youngest child, who is studying in college.

Her eldest child stopped studying for a while to help her earn a living. He is now working, and offers help through paying their monthly utilities, and also contributes toward their food expenses.

Victoria's aim is still that both of her children finish their college education, but it’s difficult for her to provide for their tuition and school fees if both of them study simultaneously.

Their financial insufficiency fuels her determination to improve her business and increase her profit. She seeks your kindness to lend her PHP 25,000 that she will use to buy more stock for her variety store.

If her business prospers in due time, it will ease her financial burden of college expenses of her children. She wants them to enjoy better living conditions someday.

She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her variety store.

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 51 year old married man with adult children who have started their own families.

He has been making a living working for a television network as a head of cameras. He started that job 15 years ago.

He is never certain about the daily schedule so his job may call on him at any time of the day which is why he really needs his car. But the car needed repairs and he took it to the car mechanic.

The bill was much higher than he expected or could afford so it is still in the shop. Antonio has been struggling to get to work on time without a car.

With a 8,422.00 MXN loan, he would be able to pay the bill, get his car back and and resume his normal life.

According to people that know him, he is a very honest person who always pays his debts.

loans.use: to fix his car.

loans.name: Divine Love Group

texts.en:
Peter is 69 years old and the group leader of Divine Love. He comes from Apam in the Gomoa West District of the Central Region of Ghana. He is a married father of three children who have all completed school.

Peter is a medicine seller who deals in treatments for malaria and all kinds of fever and other ailments. He also sells cotton, gauze etc. His medicine is in high demand due to the high incidence of malaria and other forms of fever caused by mosquitoes within his locality.

Peter has been in the business for 24 years. He has been with the field partner for three years and this is his seventh loan. He has an excellent repayment record.

Peter plans to have a wholesale shop to be able to supply his community and its surroundings with medicine. He will use the current loan to buy more medicine, cotton, and gauze to restock the shop.

Peter will invest his profit in the business which will help him increase sales and add to his savings. The extra income will also help support his family. Peter thanks all Kiva micro lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy medicine for malaria and other fever/ailment medicines, cotton and gauze for resale.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is from Talisay City, Cebu and creates reusable bags to replace plastic bags. From different colors of sacks, she creates different sizes of shopping bags or tote bags, which is an efficient way of making usable items from small things. She supplies several vendors in the city. If the demand for her products increases, she pays two seamstresses to help her.

Michelle is 23 years old and married to Charlie, a driver. They are hoping for a child and Michelle is also hoping to finish her studies. For now, she’s giving extra attention to her business. She wants to buy additional materials such as sacks, zippers, and thread. She will also set aside some money as a down payment for another sewing machine. She is anticipating mass production and she needs a loan of PHP 20,000.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as sacks, zippers, and thread for her bag-making business.

loans.name: Dogole Group

texts.fr: Mama Ogoyère est la dame qui tient la corne du bélier sur la photo. Elle est une Malienne non alphabétise, Agée de quarante (40) ans, mariée et mère de huit enfants, dont 04 sont scolarisés.  Mama Ogoyère fait l’élevage ovine  depuis vingt (20) ans. Elle sollicite un prêt au R.M.C.R dans le but d’acheter plus de moutons, les élevés puis les revendre Elle  fait ses achats dans les foires de sa localité et  les ventes en ville et souvent dans un pays frontalier (côte d’ivoire), ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge certaines dépenses(les frais de scolarisation de ses enfants, d’habillement, de santé et de condiment) au sein  de sa famille. Elle est souvent confronté à des difficultés de transport de ses bétails, lors des ventes, mais sollicite de l’aide  des convoyeurs de sa localité pour  relève les défis.  Ses ambitions dans l’exercice de cette activité est  d’avoir plus de Prêt pour faire accroitre son chiffre d’affaires afin d’acheté un troupeau de bœuf ; et entretenir convenablement ses enfants avec son mari.
texts.en:
Mama Ogoyère is the one holding the lamb’s horn in the photo. She is from Mali, illiterate, 40 years old, married and the mother of eight children, four of whom are in school. Mama Ogoyère has been raising a sheep for 20 years. 

She is seeking a loan from RMCR in order to buy more sheep, fatten them and later resell. She stocks up at the regular market of her village and resells in town and sometimes in the neighboring country   Côte d'Ivoire. Her revenues will allow her to take care of certain household expenses, such as school fees for her children, clothing, healthcare and food). 

Mama Ogoyère often has difficulties transporting her livestock for sale, but turns for help to neighbors providing such services. Her goal is to keep taking out more loans in order to expand her sales volume and buy cattle, as well as to be able to provide for her children, jointly with her husband.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijas de 6 meses, 2 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de pescado. 
Ella es buena madre, autosuficiente y muy amigable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘el tejar’ donde antiguamente se fabricaban las tejas para los techos de las casas de la ciudad.
Paulina es de piel morena, usa el cabello trenzado y viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijas; la mayor estudia en la escuela y las menores aún no están en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de pescado, ella compra pescado por mayor para venderlo al menudeo, inicio su negocio hace 12 años vendiendo ambulantemente para luego comprarse un puesto de venta al aire libre, “la zona es muy comercial por eso las ventas son diarias…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra en un lugar estratégico de gran afluencia de personas, la desventaja son los días lluviosos y los días que escasea el pescado. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta bajo techo, ella desea comprar un guinche y pescado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paulina solicita un préstamo para la compra de una herramienta de trabajo y pescado.
texts.en:
Paulina is a 32-year old woman. She lives with her partner and has 3 daughters, ages 6 months, 2 and 12 years. Her business is selling fish. She is a good mother, self-sufficient and very friendly. Her business is located in the "El tejar" zone where, formerly, they made tilings for the roofs of the houses in the city.

Paulina is dark-skinned, wears her hair in a braid and dresses in traditional clothing (hat, poncho, skirt). She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction, and with her daughters. The oldest one goes to school and the younger two are not yet school-age. They live in their own place built of brick and which has all of the basic services.

Her business is selling fish. She buys fish at wholesale to sell as retail. She started her business 12 years ago selling on the street, but later she bought herself an outdoor stall. "The area is very commercial, so there are daily sales..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she is in a strategic place with a great influence of people. The disadvantages are the rainy days and days when there is a lack of fish.

Her dream is to have a covered stall. She wants to buy a winch and fish. This is the 1st loan with the institution in the 10 years that she has been doing this work. For those reasons, Paulina is asking for a loan to buy a work tool and fish.

loans.use: to buy a work tool and fish.

loans.name: Grace Traders Group

texts.en:
Abiba is 45 years old. She is from Praso in the Twifo Atti-Mokwa District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is the group representative and leader of Grace Traders.

Abiba is divorced with 2 children. The children are both in school. The ages of the children are 15 and 20 years.

Abiba is a Petty Trader. She sells bags of maize and cosmetics in the local market. She has been in the business for 15 years, hence has gained much experience. She started selling cosmetics on a small table, but with the assistance of the field partner she now has her own stall. Abiba has been with the field partner for 4 years and this is her 8th loan cycle. Her major challenges are storage room to keep the maize, and the size of her stall to take more stock for supply.

Abiba believes when given the loan she will be able to increase the number of bags of maize she buys for supply, and to restock her cosmetics shop. Abiba hopes to use part of the profits to gradually start to build a bigger store to boost her business. She says income from sales will help improve the family’s standard of living. Abiba will save for a secured future for her children. She thanks all Kiva micro-lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy maize, as well as cosmetics such as skin pomade, perfumes, and hair pomade to restock her store.

loans.name: Sigue Adelante Group

texts.es:
Algunas comunidades del estado de Veracruz son consideradas de difícil acceso debido a la falta de transporte público que existe; esto, a su vez, es consecuencia del sistema de caminos. Sin embargo, lo que esta región pierde en accesibilidad lo gana en riquezas naturales ya que está rodeada de campos llenos de caña y árboles de frutos frescos.
   En dicha comunidad se consolidó el grupo llamado Sigue Adelante integrado por mujeres trabajadoras que día con día luchan por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Ellas son: Sandra, Emilia y Bartola quienes venden abarrotes; Faustina, refrescos y comida; María A. y Marina, cosméticos; María B., zapatos; Isabel, pollo; Antonia, ovejas; Maribel y Pánfila, refrescos; Claudia, comida; Irma, ropa; mientras que Minerva y Josefina se dedican a la cría de cerdos.
   Doña Emilia es un ejemplo de esfuerzo y trabajo ya que actualmente cuida a dos de sus nietos quienes la motivaron a vender refrescos y botanas dentro de su casa para obtener ingresos. Para ella, sus nietos son como sus hijos y desea que tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional. Inició como todo negocio, sólo con una pequeña cantidad de producto, en este caso, dos rejas de refresco; no obstante, actualmente dos grandes marcas le otorgaron sendos refrigeradores debido al éxito obtenido. Posteriormente implementó la venta de abarrotes y ahora piensa ofrecer pollo fresco para complementar sus actividades, “todos los días me levanto y doy gracias a Dios por todo lo que me ha dado y le pido fortaleza para continuar de pie por y para mi familia” comentó contenta.
   Este es el primer préstamo que recibe y lo invertirá en la compra de refresco de diferentes sabores y tamaños para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Las ganancias le han permitido pagar la inscripción de sus hijos y comprar útiles escolares. 
    “Confiaron en nosotros como grupo y nos dieron esta oportunidad, tengan por seguro que no los defraudaremos” son las palabras de las integrantes quienes se muestran muy entusiasmadas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Claudia, Doña Emilia es quien viste blusa color verde y un pantalón gris.
texts.en:
Some communities in Veracruz are considered difficult to access because of the lack of public transportation. This in turn is a product of the poor road network. However what the region loses in accessibility it gains in natural resources as it is surrounded by fields full of sweet sugar cane and trees that produce fresh fruit and pure air.

In this community the group called "Sigue Adelante" was formed made up of hard-working women who day by day strive to provide the best for their families. They are: Sandra, Emilia and Bartola who sell groceries; Faustina, soft drinks and food; María A. and Marina, cosmetics; María B., shoes; Isabel, chicken; Antonia, sheep; Maribel and Pánfila, soft drinks; Claudia, food; Irma, clothing; while Minerva and Josefina work raising pigs.

Emiliana is an example of effort and work as she currently takes care of two of her grandchildren who are her motivation to sell soft drinks and snacks in order to have income. For her, her grandchildren are like her children and she wants them to have the opportunity to study to be professionals. She started as with any business with a small quantity of product. In this case two cases of soft drinks. However currently two big brands have given her refrigerators due to the success she has achieved. Later she started the sales of groceries and she is now thinking of adding fresh chicken to compliment her activities. "Every day I get up and thank God for all he has given me and I ask him for the strength to still be standing to help my family,' she commented contently.

This is the first loan she has received and she will invest it in buying soft drinks of different sizes and flavors to satisfy the needs of her customers. The profits will allow her to pay for the registration of her grandchildren and buy school supplies.

“Have confidence in us as a group and give us this opportunity. You can be assured that we will not let you down” are the words of the members who show great enthusiasm.

*The photograph was taken in Claudia's house. Emiliana is wearing a green blouse and grey pants.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks in different sizes and flavors.

location.town: Ejido Joya De La Pita. Tierra Blanca Veracruz

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона очень благодарна Вам за Вашу поддержку и понимание. Благодаря Вам она смогла помочь своему младшему брату продолжать учебу в Университете. Фарзона уделяет внимание своему брату и помогает ему делать уроки. Благодаря ней её брат очень хорошо учится. Её родители очень довольны тем, что их дети заботятся друг о друге. В этом году Фарзона накопила средства за счет швейной деятельности, однако этого недостаточно, чтобы оплатить годовой контракт брата. Она снова запрашивает кредит и верит, что благодаря программе Кива и его кредиторам она и на сей раз решает проблему брата. Фарзона заранее благодарить Вас за Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Farzona is very thankful for your support and understanding.  Thanks to you, she was able to help her younger brother and made sure that he continued his studies at the university.  Farzona looks after her brother and helps him with his lessons.  Thanks to her, he is a very good student.  Farzona's parents  are very happy that their children care so much for each other.

This year, Farzona has saved some money from her sewing business.  However, it is not enough to pay for her brother's annual tuition fees.  She is taking a loan again and is confident that Kiva and its lenders will help her and her brother.  She thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's university tuition.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARISUN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Gloria alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a trabajar  en una empresa privada, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable, a la vez la socia es costurera ella realiza diferentes tipos de pedidos que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank, Kancharisun, which is located in the Cusco district and department of Cusco. 

The member Gloria alternates her daily activities making a living working at a private company. Gloria enjoys her job, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day as she is a responsible person.

As a seamstress, she works on the various types of requests that she receives. She hopes to be able to continue working in this form of work to support her family. 

She is grateful for the loan granted and promises to meet the established payment quotas. Gloria is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread and other items.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Jaime Saúl

texts.es:
Jaime, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su conyugue se dedica a los oficios domésticos, junto a ella tiene una hija de 3 años de edad.

Jaime, ha sido empleado de una empresa distribuidora de gas propano durante 4 años, pero por el momento ha decidido dedicarse a la agricultura, porque ya no tiene un empleo formal.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar herbicidas y fertilizantes para aplicarlos a sus cultivos y obtener una buena cosecha y dar el sustento a su familia. 

A futuro desea obtener un empleo formal, para tener prestaciones y darles mejores condiciones de vida a su hija y a su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime is 24 years old and went to school until high school. He lives with his common law wife, who works taking care of the home. Together they have a three year old daughter. Jaime was employed by a propane gas distributing business for 4 years, but he has now decided to make a living in agriculture, because he no longer has formal employment.

The loan he is seeking is to buy herbicides and fertilizers to apply to his crops to obtain a better harvest and meet the needs of his family. In the future he hopes to obtain formal employment, in order to have benefits and provide better living conditions to his daughter and his life companion.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizers to apply to his crops.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARISUN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Angel  alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a ejercer el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio  es una persona responsable, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas.
texts.en:
This associate is part of the KANCHARISUN communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

Angel's daily activities include being a taxi driver. He's had this job for some time now and it's going well for him, thanks to the effort he puts in every day. The associate is a responsible person. The associate would like to continue working as he is in order to continue supporting his family.

Angel is grateful for the loan and promises to fulfill his payments.

This member is requesting a loan to buy tires.

loans.use: buy tires.

loans.name: Jesus Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Jesus Carlos se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos de computadora y tambien tiene un trabajo como tecnico de computadoras,el socio es una persona emprendedora y trabajador,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos decomputadora.El socio solicita el crecito para compras repuestos de computadoras como mouses,teclado y computadora.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jesus Carlos continues to work selling computer parts. He also has a business as a computer technician. He is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking person. His dream is to expand his business selling computer parts.

He seeks a loan to buy computer parts, such as mouse devices, keyboards and computers. He is pleased with the loan and promises to comply with the required payments.

loans.use: to buy computer parts such as mouse devices, keyboards and computers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona muy trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz,aceite, azucar, leche y galletas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Francisca continues working in her grocery store business. She is a very hard-working person who, through this business, supports her family. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, milk, and cookies. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of her quota.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Illary De Quellouno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ ILLARY DE QUELLOUNO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno , perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aquilina, la socia tiene 61 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es soltero, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores .la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the loan group "Illary de Quellouno". This group is located in the district of Quellouno, which belongs to the province of La Convención and department of Cuzco.

Aquilina is 61-years old, has 3 children and is single. She alternates her daily activities, dedicating herself to agriculture. She is a responsible and persevering person. She has been doing this work for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business every day. She also works raising small animals.

She wants to be able to keep working to continue to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy compost, fertilizers and other things.

All of the members thank those who form part of this dream and they promise to pay their dues on time.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers and other things.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel se siue dedicando al negocio en una empresa privada,la socia por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es mejorar cada vez mas en su trabajo y ser mejor.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Maribel continues working in a private company. Through this work, she is able to support her family. Her dream is to improve her work and be better. She is asking for a loan to buy a television for her home. She is happy for the loan and promises to pay her dues.

loans.use: to buy a television for her home.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora continúa con su negocio de confección de mantas de alpaca. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la refacción de su taller de tejido y compró lana por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su producción. Actualmente su negocio mejoró, conoció nuevos clientes y crecieron las ventas, “trato de aumentar el volumen de producción para cubrir la demanda de mis nuevos clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes en espera, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor. Su sueño es tener un negocio rentable que sus hijas puedan administrar, ella desea comprar lana de alpaca por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nora solicita un préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca para cumplir con los pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Nora still has her business making alapaca wool blankets. The last loan she received was invested in making repairs to her weaving workshop and in purchasing wholesale wool. She was able to punctually repay her loan because she sold everything she made.

Currently, her business has improved, she gained new customers and her sales increased. Nora says, “I try to increase my production volume to meet the demand from my new customers." Her business's advantage is that she has a wait-list of customers; the difficulty is her lack of capital to purchase wholesale alpaca wool. Nora's dream is to have a profitable business that her daughters can one day take over.

Nora wants to buy wholesale alpaca wool. This is her second lending cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been in business.

Nora is requesting a loan so she can purchase alpaca wool and complete the orders she has pending.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool so she can complete her pending orders.

loans.name: Condormocco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CONDORMOCCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca, la socia sigue dedicándose al  negocio de venta de frutas, la socia continua vendiendo plátanos, mandarinas, papayas y naranjas a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de café, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associates are part of the “CONDORMOCCO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Echarate district, which is part of the province of La Convencion and the department of Cusco.

Francisca, the associate, continues to run her business of selling fruit. She sells bananas, mandarins, papayas and oranges to her clients. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She has been running her business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She would like to be able to continue working so she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy manure, fertilizer and others.

The other associates run other businesses, like coffee sales, fruit and vegetable sales, a store owner and food sales.

The associates are grateful to those who take part in their dream and promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizers and other.

loans.name: Contessa

texts.en:
Contessa, 35 years old, is a fish vendor from Toril, Davao City. Because it’s now the rainy season in the Philippines, she is experiencing some challenges in her business due to the increasing price of fish and other seafoods. But she’s not discouraged; instead she wants to prepare for any situation. She desires to have additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy volume quantities and different varieties of fish while it’s not that expensive. She will also set aside some amount for emergency situations like typhoons when there’s no chance to catch any fish. She plans to have an alternative enterprise like selling cooked viands and snacks. This way, she can still earn some money even during rainy days and she can still sustain their usual everyday needs. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Contessa is married to Ralph, a driver, and they have two children who are studying. She works persistently in order to see her children get a college diploma and stable jobs someday. She is a zealous member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume quantities and different varieties of fish.

loans.name: Abejitas De Pilcopata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ABEJITAS DE PILCOPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Kosñipata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maritza Antonia, la socia continua con su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua cultivando platanos, paltas, mandarinas y naranjas para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The associates are part of the “ABEJITAS DE PILCOPATA” (Little Bees of Pilcopata) Communal Bank. This bank is located in the Kosñipata district, which is part of the Paucartambo province and department of Cusco.

Maritza Antonia, the associate, continues to run her with fruit crop business. She's been running this business for years and it's been going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She cultivates bananas, avocados, mandarins and oranges for her clients. She would like to continue working this way in order to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and manure.

The associate who is in the small photo in the lefthand corner asked permission to come late due to work issues.

The associates are grateful for the loan and promise to fulfill their payments.

loans.use: buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Gladys Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Gladys Ruth se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora de niños,la socia tambien ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de realizar tejidos como chompas,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su famiia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar hilos de colores y palitos de tejer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys Ruth is an associate who continues to dedicate herself to the job of teaching children. She is also running a knitting business. She knits sweaters. She is a hard-working woman, who through this business, wants to move forward with her family.

This associate is requesting a loan to buy colored yarn and knitting needles.

This associate is happy for the loan and promises to repay it.

loans.use: buy colored yarn and knitting needles.

loans.name: Salvador Adolfo

texts.es:
Salvador, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando y tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus hermanos menores; está casado y tienen dos hijos, de los cuales solo uno está en la escuela. 

Salvador, se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado bovino y ganado porcino desde hace más de 5 años, el trabajo lo aprendió por cuenta propia, pero además de la crianza de ganado, también trabaja como albañil y este tipo de trabajo lo realiza cuando encuentra oportunidades de hacerlo. Salvador ha dedicado toda su vida a trabajar en la agricultura, la ganadería y la albañilería.- La pequeña granja está cerca de la casa y en el cuido de los animales se involucra su esposa. 

Salvador, necesita el préstamo para comprar concentrado y harina de maíz para alimento del ganado porcino, con la compra de estos insumos, podrá tener suficiente alimento para poder engordar los cerdos y sacarlos al mercado para la venta.

Salvador, tiene un proyecto a futuro el cual consta de criar ganado bovino de repasto en grandes cantidades; pero también quiere que sus hijos estudien y aprendan a trabajar con honradez.
texts.en:
Salvador is 40 years old. He went to school until the sixth grade. Due to a lack of financial resources he was unable to continue studying and had to work to help his younger siblings. He is married and has two children, only one of whom is in school.

For more than 5 years, Salvador has worked raising sheep and pigs. He learned the work on his own. In addition to raising livestock, he also works as a mason, a job he does when the opportunity arises. Salvador has spent his whole life working in agriculture, raising livestock, and masonry. His small farm is close to his house, and his wife helps care for the animals.

Salvador needs this loan to buy concentrated feed and cornmeal. With the purchase of these supplies, he will be able to have sufficient feed to fatten his pigs and take them to the market to sell. Salvador has a plan for the future to raise pasture sheep in large quantities, but he would also like his children to study and learn to work with honesty.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and cornmeal to feed his pigs.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.en:
Jose is a 46-year-old entrepreneur who has been blessed with two sons and a loving wife. He earns a living by running a beauty salon which he owns. His salon has a very good location because is in the main street of the neighbourhood. This is why the clients know him really well and it is easy to recommend him and arrive at his place. He is proud of his family and his business. His family, especially his wife, has played a fundamental role in the salon's success; this same success has provided economical support for his family for all of these years.

He has been thinking about renewing his merchandise and his working tools to increase his income and be able to get a better lifestyle for his family. A 21,053 MXN loan will allow him to achieve his short term goals and buy the things he is looking for; things like dyes, peroxide, straighteners, and hairdryers, for his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Barry's Group

texts.en: Barry is 45 years old and a father of six children. Barry runs a local palm oil mill in his village. This mill has been a source of support for him and his family and other members of the village who are mostly farmers. At the moment the mill lacks a fiber separator; equipment that is used to separate kernels from fiber. This is very challenging because it takes lots of hours to separate them using the manual process. To reduce his frustration and that of his clients and to also make life easier for the manual workers who make their daily living at this mill, Barry is requesting this loan from Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society. This loan will enable him to purchase this equipment and other equipment he needs at the mill. If this mill is upgraded, Barry hopes that he will be able to earn more income to support his family, especially his son currently studying at the university. He appreciates all lenders for supporting this loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil processing equipment.

loans.name: Chika

texts.en:
Chika is 35 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. Her source of survival is palm oil processing and marketing. She has been in this trade for over six years now. She likes this business because it is one of the means of survival in the rural area and is also sustainable. This trade gives her enough time to take care of her little children. The income she gets from this business is used for her daily expenses and also used to support her husband who is a motorcycle rider. Her hope and desire is to earn more savings in order to support her husband to start a better business, considering the high risk involved in commercial motorcycle business.

This is her second loan with the cooperative. Because of her good performance from the first loan, the cooperative is giving her the opportunity to receive twice the amount of her first loan. A portion of this loan will help her to buy storage drums, and part of it will be used to process palm products during the peak season. She thanks all Kiva lenders that support her loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil storage containers.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla works hard to support her family. Myla is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc.

Myla has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Myla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc

loans.name: Ma. Margarita

texts.en:
