Ma. Margarita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase nipa roofing for the repair of her pig pen and buy feeds.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming rice.

Ma. Margarita dreams that one day will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase nipa roofing for the repair of her pig pen and buy feeds.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. Maricel is married and has a business buying and selling ready to wear in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children who are in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fishing.

Mary Jean dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Melanny

texts.en:
Melanny is married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melanny is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Melanny requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new bundle of fishing net.

Melanny has been in this business for three years. In the future, Melanny would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school. Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for five years.

In the future Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of La Dorada. Since he was a little kid he has always dreamed of having his own business in which he could work hard and make it recognized and successful. Unfortunately some issues in his life haven’t allowed him to make that dream come true.

Recently he approached Interactuar, and through Kiva he found a way to make this real. He wants to start a business selling products, clothes, fragrances and other personal stuff. He’s asking for a loan so he can start his business and buy inputs like clothes and lotions.

He expects that his business will have a good amount of clients and sales, so he can start in the right way and start letting everybody know about his new business. He also would like to improve the conditions of his house. You can help Juan with his dreams. Let him show you his hard work--loan now.

loans.use: start his business and to buy inputs like clothes and lotions

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 22 years old, married, and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Myra requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Myra has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Richard Jesus

texts.es:
Richard es un hombre de 29 años de edad, casado, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Él es independiente, constante y muy decidido. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de tembladerani, caracterizado por encontrarse la cancha de un equipo de futbol muy popular. 
Richard es moreno de cabello corto y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio viven en casa de sus suegros que es propia y está construida de ladrillo, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de comida para llevar al horno como lechón, pollo y otros, “cocinamos para vender por las noches y también atendemos eventos como matrimonios o cumpleaños…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede realizar varias comidas al día, la desventaja es que no cuenta con un lugar apropiado donde vender comida. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, el desea comprar un horno industrial e utensilios de cocina como ollas y cubiertos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Richard solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial e utensilios de cocina para cocinar por las noches.
texts.en:
Richard is a 29 year old man, married, with no children, and his business is the selling of food. He is independent, steadfast and very determined. His business is located in the ​Tembladerani area, characterized by the stadium of a very popular football (soccer) team. Richard is dark-skinned, with short hair and a medium physique. His mother tongue is Aymara and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his wife, who makes a living in the same business. They live in the home of their in-laws, which is made of brick and has all the basic services.

Their business is the sale of take-away (carry-out) food, such as baked pork, chicken and more. Richard says, "We cook to sell at night and also we serve events like weddings or birthdays ...". The advantage of his business is that he can make several meals a day, the disadvantage is that he does not have an appropriate place to sell his food.

His dream is to open a restaurant, and he wants to buy an industrial oven and cooking utensils including pots and cutlery. This is his first loan sequence with Emprender in the first year that he has had this business. It is for these reasons that Richard is requesting a loan for the purchase of an industrial oven and cooking utensils in order to cook at night.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and cooking utensils to cook at night.

loans.name: Diego Andres

texts.en:
Diego is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pedro de los Milagros. He has two children, a boy and a girl, whom he loves very much, and are the main reason for his hard work. Seven years ago he decided to start his own business raising cattle, something he learned thanks to his father.

The costs of the inputs for this kind of business are really high, so he knows that if he wants to increase the profits and make his business successful he has to invest in it. Unfortunately he doesn’t have the money to do this, so he’s asking for a loan that will allow him to buy cows and steers to grow and to sell later.

Like a responsible father that he is, he dreams of giving his children a good education that will let them be good professionals in the future. He also wants to buy a house so his family will have a good quality of life. Help Diego now; he just need a little trust in his work and in him. Loan and let him have a good future.

loans.use: buy cows and steers to grow and to sell later

loans.name: Johana Andrea

texts.en:
Johana is a young woman with big expectations, not only for her, but for her little beautiful son who only is one year old. She’s 19 years old and lives with her boyfriend and son in the municipality of el Carmen de Viboral. When she knew she was pregnant, she immediately looked for a way to provide for her family, so she started a business raising cattle.

Her father was her guide in the whole process and now she runs it by herself. She has found some troubles like the high costs of the inputs and animals, and she wants to increase her sales. So she’s asking for a loan in order to buy two milking cows to increase her inputs and grow her business.

Johana is very young and has a family now, and she’s willing to work hard so she can give her son and family a good quality of life. She wants to pay for her son's education and may want to buy a house for her family as well. You can help this woman to build not only her business, but her family. A loan will do a lot for her.

loans.use: buy two milking cows to increase her inputs and grow her business.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.en:
The Colombian Atlantic coast is one of the poorest zones of the country, but it also has the most brave and enterprising people, as in the case of Angelica, a 36-year-old-single mother who has four children. She lives in the municipality of Sampues, a place where since 2006 she has been running a business raising birds.

She has some big responsibilities, especially with her children because she has to provide for them, and she knows that her business is the best way to do that. She wants to increase her sales and make her business sustainable. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some chickens which lay eggs.

Angelica has a big dream, and it’s to see her children succeed. She works hard just to give them a good quality of life. She would like to give them a good education, and you can be part of this dream; a loan will help her a lot.

loans.use: buy some chickens which lay eggs.

loans.name: Joyda

texts.en:
The lack of stable jobs in the Philippines forces many Filipinos to leave the country to try their luck abroad. They leave behind their families in search of decent wages and greener pastures. Joyda, 28, from Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte endures the situation of being away from her husband, Jimbo, who is working in another country. Their three small children are left in her care and guidance. It’s difficult for a young new family like theirs to be separated from each other. But they keep on, holding the inspiration to uplift their lives, ensure the education and future of their children, and gain the capacity to help other people someday.

Instead of feeling lonesome due to the absence of her husband, Joyda focuses her attention on her business. She operates a Piso Net, a coin-operated internet PC with typical rental fee of PHP 1 every four minutes. It is a budget-friendly internet café suitable for short-time internet users. She also ventures into direct selling of beauty products. Her income supports their usual household needs such as food, utilities, and transportation allowances.

Joyda aspires to enhance her internet café by acquiring additional computer units, while the old computers need to undergo their regular check ups and maintenance. She humbly requests a PHP 50,000 loan for this purpose. She hopes you could be God’s instrument to grant her request. She is praying that more blessings will come your way.

Joyda draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their lives and businesses and reflect on the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional computer units and pay for the maintenance of old computers

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LA NUEVA UNION DE SAN LORENZO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ocobamba  y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Lucio tiene 48 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al cultivo de frutas, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio  es una persona responsable, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the LA NUEVA UNION DE SAN LORENZO communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Ocobamba, department of Cuzco.

Lucio is 48 years old. He has 3 children and is in a common law marriage. Among his daily activities are growing fruit. He has done this work for a long time, and it is going well for him, thanks to the hard work he puts into his work every day. He is a responsible person who wants to be able to keep working so that he can continue supporting his family in this way.

This borrower is thankful for the loan he has been given and committed to to making his payments on time.

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, among other things.

loans.use: to buy seeds, among other things.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 58 years old and married with eight children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Editha has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa works hard to support her family. Ninfa is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of fish to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 45 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Edna has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Diomedesia

texts.en:
Diomedesia is 60 years old and married with four children. Diomedesia works very hard to provide for them.

Diomedesia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Diomedesia has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Diomedesia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 35 years old and married with nine children. With seven children in school, Genalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Genalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Genalyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Genalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 51 years old and widowed with four children.

Jeana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like school supplies, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries.

Jeana has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from peanut butter making.

Jeana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like school supplies, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joanne is 26 years old.

Joanne has a business buying and selling beverages in the Philippines. Joanne requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

Joanne has been in this business for three years. In the future, Joanne would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anyidaso Ne Nyame Group

texts.en: Gertrude is a 45-year-old woman. She comes from Twifo Praso in the Twifo Atti-Mokwa District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is a married woman with two children. The ages of her children are 6 and 15 years old. Both her children are attending school. Gertrude is a food vender who sells local dishes. She has been in this business for ten years now with three employees. Gertrude has no other businesses. Her husband is a commercial driver. According to her, she started this business through the advice of her mother and with the help of her husband.  She wants to expand her business which will increase her customer base, but her major challenge is inadequate funds to buy the needed items in large quantities. Gertrude has been with the field partner for six years with good repayment records. She now seeks additional funds to support her business which will help her increase her profit to enable her to care for her children. Gertrude is very grateful to all Kiva micro lenders for the loan facility.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, bush meat, goat meat, cassava and tomatoes for her local restaurant business.

loans.name: Sanjay

texts.en: Sanjay is 31 years old and lives with his wife and parents. Sanjay’s father cultivated rice before and is now pensioned off, so Sanjay took over his business with the support of Seva MFI and now he has an extra income. If Seva MFI had not supported him, he would have had to rent his father’s fields. Sanjay started with rice cultivation on a plot of two hectares and in the coming season he plans to sow 10 hectares. For this, he needs SRD 7,500 to buy fertilizers and pesticides. In the future, Sanjay wants to expand his areas so that he can make more profits and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda runs this variety store located in front of her house in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. It has somehow progressed in her 12 years of operation. She started by selling basic commodities like sachets of shampoo and biscuits, and now she offers a variety of choices. Aside from this, she was able to acquire a vehicle for rent. She’s trying her best to support the needs of her children who are studying in college. Rhoda doesn’t stop dreaming of improving her business to boost her income and savings. She doesn’t want to be obstructed by creditors who sometimes deplete her capital.

To continue with her business, she is requesting additional capital worth PHP 27,000. She plans to buy additional supplies for her store and necessary spare parts for her vehicle for rent. This will further strengthen her business and uphold her family’s sustenance.

Rhoda is married to Jimmy who is always supportive of her and her business. Both of them wish that their children will complete their education and obtain stable jobs someday.

Rhoda is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pays microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her store

loans.name: Mijgonahon

texts.ru: Ей 25 лет, и она проживает в городе Исфаре. Мичгонахон дома занимается шитьем национальной  женской одежды на заказ. Ей удобно шить на дому, потому что  ее дети маленькие она ухаживает за детьми. Мичгонахон добрая и шустрая женщина, которое хорошо исправляется со своей работе. Много лет назад она научилась шить и кроить женскую одежду. Мичгонахон замужем и имеет детей. Её муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, и каждый месяц отправляет им деньги. Она проживает с детьми. Мичгонахон в этой деятельности нравится ежедневный доход. Она принимает кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную (вышивочную) машинку, чтобы улучшить и приобрести много клиентов. У нее мечта в будущем открыть себе новую торговую точку шитья национальной женской одежды.
texts.en:
Mijgonahon is 25 years old, and she lives in the city of Isfar. She sews traditional women's clothing to order from her home. It's convenient for her to sew at home, because her children are small and she takes care of them. Mijgonahon is a kind and bright woman whose work is shaping up very well. She learned to cut out and sew women's clothing many years ago.

Mijgonahon is married and has children. Mijgonahon's husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, and he sends them money every month. Mijgonahon lives with their children. She likes the daily income from her business.

Mijgonahon is taking out a loan to buy a new sewing machine (that can do embroidery), so that she can improve and get more clients. She dreams of someday opening her own place of business for sewing traditional women's clothing.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery sewing machine.

loans.name: Tillo

texts.ru: Тилло успешно погасил свой кредит. Он очень благодарен Вам за поддержку. Теперь он спокойно учится. Тилло добрый и мудрый человек. Он помогает всем своим близким. На этот раз Тилло обратился за кредитом, чтобы оплатит трехлетнее обучение сына своего брата, так как у его брата нет достаточных средств. Тилло считает сына брата и своим сыном. Он желает, чтобы его племянник тоже получил образование и стал образованным человеком. Его племянник учится в Таджикском Государственном Университете факультет "Налог и налогообложение". Тилло очень надеется на Вашу доброту. Он обещает, что и на этот раз тоже будет погашать свой займ во время.
texts.en: Tillo successfully repaid his loan. He is very grateful to you for the support. Now his son is studying calmly. Tillo is a kind and wise person. He helps all those close to him. This time Tillo has applied for a loan to pay for his nephew's three-year tuition since his brother does not have sufficient funds. Tillo considers his brother's son to be his own son. He wishes for his nephew also to receive an education and become an educated person. His nephew is studying at the Tajik State University in the faculty of "Taxes and Taxation". Tillo very much hopes for your kindness. He promises to repay his loan on time this time too.

loans.use: to pay his nephew's three-year university tuition fees.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
For 25 years, Norma, age 59, has been raising hogs at the back of her house located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. It’s been a helpful source of additional income that supported her children who are already working as of now. Her 65-year-old husband, Antonio, is a regular mechanic who has been working really hard for his family. Now both of them are in their retirement age and they want to give more attention to improving their hog raising or fattening business.

Hog raising is a promising enterprise but the return of investment takes after several months. Norma plans to enhance her business with the aid of additional capital worth PHP 20,000 that she can use to buy more piglets, feeds, medicines and vitamins. As soon as her husband retires, he will join her in nurturing the pigs.

Norma is not worried about the repayment because one fattened hog is soon ready for selling and she can recover her capital. As she continues to develop her business, she tries to save for her dream of acquiring an improved house and lot. She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, feed, medicine and vitamins.

loans.name: Shiringul

texts.ru: Ширингул уроженка района Рудаки. Она 36 летняя жена и мать. У нее трое детей. Детям 6, 3 и 1 лет. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. И он каждый месяц отправляет денег жене. Ширингул тоже имеет работу. Она занимается торговлей деятельности. Ширингул на рынке продает сладкое. В составе ее товара входят печенье, булочки и другие сладкие печенье. Ширингул тоже старается, чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Она трудолюбивая и заботливая мать. Ширингул хочет расширить деятельность. Она просит кредит для перевоза десерт. Ширингул была вынуждена, обратится к Вам за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас!
texts.en:
Shiringul is a native of the Rudaki region. She is a 36-year-old wife and mother, and she has 3 children. Her children are 1, 3, and 6 years old. Shiringul's husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, and he sends his wife money every month.

Shiringul works, too. She works in trade, selling sweets at the market. Her merchandise includes cookies, rolls, and other sweet pastries. Shiringul is trying to help her husband provide for their family. She is a hard-working and responsible mother.

Shiringul wants to expand her business. She has requested a loan to transport desserts. Shiringul is compelled to turn to you for a loan. You can support her now!

loans.use: to transport desserts and expand her business.

loans.name: Durdiniz

texts.ru: Дурдиниз очень довольна и счастлива, потому что теперь она со своей семьей живет в уютном доме и имеет хороший бизнес в сфере шитья. За все это она благодарить Кива кредиторов, которые всегда оказывали ей финансовую помощь и благодаря им её мечты сбились. У Дурдиниз осталось маленькая проблема.  Комната, где она шьёт и принимает клиенток очень узкая и она хочет расширить её. Она отложила деньги, но этого не достаточно. Единственное решение она видит только в получение кредита. Дурдиниз очень верит в Вас. На сумму кредита она еще намеренна, купить материалы для шитья.
texts.en:
Durdiniz is very contented and happy, because she lives with her family in a cozy house and has a good sewing business. For this, she is thankful to the people at Kiva who funded her loan, who provided her with financial help and thanks to whom her dreams came true.

Durdiniz still has a small problem. The room where she sews and takes clients is very narrow, and she wants to expand it. She has set aside money, but it is not enough. The only solution sees is to take out a loan. Durdiniz really believes in you. With the money from her loan, Durdiniz also wants to buy materials for sewing.

loans.use: to enlarge the room where she sews, and to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 43 years old with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jovita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies. Jovita has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is a married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Kristine is 32 years old.

Kristine has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Kristine requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as meat, spices, and fish.

Kristine has been in this business for three years. In the future, Kristine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as meat, spices, and fish

loans.name: Radjinderpersad

texts.en: Radjinderpersad thanks all Kiva lenders for helping him. He is very glad for the help he gets and wants to borrow more. With the profits from last season, he could plant one more plot (on rent) of rice and could save more to buy a new plot. Radjinderpersad needs another loan of SRD 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides so he can continue with his rice production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Martha Vanessa

texts.es:
Martha, de 18 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja es motorista de un auto bus del transporte colectivo, tiene una niña de 1 año de edad y en su casa vive su suegra.

Martha, atiende una tienda desde hace más de 2 años, su suegra era quien administraba anteriormente la misma tienda, pero decidió darle el cargo a ella.- Martha, anteriormente se dedicaba a la elaboración de tortillas en la ciudad lo cual realizaba junto a la madre y en la tienda se involucra solo la suegra.

Martha, necesita el préstamo para comprar bebidas gaseosas, jugos de frutas, etc porque en la zona es lo que más se vende, además se invertirá en nuevos productos como: boquitas e insumos para el hogar, para que los clientes encuentren lo que buscan sin tener que ir a la ciudad.

Los sueños de Martha, son ver crecer el negocio para poder tener ingresos suficientes y darle una mejor condición de vida al pequeño bebe, quien apenas comienza el camino de la vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 18-years old. She went to school until high school. She is married and her husband drives a public transport bus. She has a 1-year old daughter and lives in her mother-in-law's house. Martha has had her store for more than 2 years. Her mother-in-law used to manage the same store, but decided to make her in charge of it.

Previously, Martha used to work making tortillas in the city with her mother. In her store, only her mother-in-law is involved. Martha needs the loan to buy soft drinks, fruit juices, etc., because that is what is most sold in the area. She will also invest in new products such as snacks and supplies for the home, so that the customers can find what they need without having to go into the city.

Martha's dreams are to see her business grow to have a sufficient income and to give the best living conditions to her baby, who is just starting her life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fruit juices, etc.

loans.name: Solo

texts.fr:
Solo est une femme dynamique et débrouillarde de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est mécanicien-tôlier (salarié). Ils ont ensemble trois enfants de 7, 12 et 14 ans dont tous scolarisés.
Solo est une épicière il y a maintenant 15 ans. Puis, il y a 4 ans, elle vend aussi des sandales en complément.
Ses parents sont de villageois, et durant son enfance jusqu'à ce qu'elle se marie, elle vivait avec eux à la campagne. L'activité pratiquée était de l'agriculture (élevage et culture). Elle se débrouillait seule avec son commerce et trouve que la collaboration avec CEFOR est très intéressant. Son désire est de bâtir une grande maison en dur pour servir de magasin et de lieu d'habitation car actuellement, elle loue encore sa maison et la boutique est un stand démontable sans mur.
texts.en:
Solo is an energetic and resourceful 35-year old woman. Her husband  is a sheet-metal worker (a salaried employee). They have three children who are 7, 12, and 14 years of age. All children are in school.

Solo has been keeping a grocery store for 15 years. In addition, since four years ago, she also started selling sandals. Her parents are from the countryside; she grew up in their village and lived there until she got married. They were doing agricultural work (raising livestock and growing crops). 

Solo manages her business by herself and finds the collaboration with CEFOR very promising. Her goal is to build a large concrete house in order to use it as both a store and her living quarters. At present, she is still renting the house she lives in, and her store is just a provisional stand without walls.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as candy, cookies, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Diana Paola

texts.es: Diana es una joven microempresaria que inició su negocio al afrontar una situación familiar difícil, después de la separación con su cónyuge, las circunstancias le exigieron buscar un medio de sustento para su familia. Encontró en el comercio de comidas una posibilidad y empezó con la venta de hayacas, helados y galletas, hoy en día también vende comida rápida en la terraza de su vivienda; ella fue apoyada por su madre quien le compró lo necesario para la etapa inicial de su proyecto. Diana es muy comprometida con su labor, todos los días apertura su venta de comidas en la que maneja una carta muy amplia entre ellas hamburguesas, perros calientes, salchipapas, asados de carne de pollo, cerdo y res.  Los vecinos del sector son sus principales clientes y le cancelan de contado lo que consuman, ellos están deleitados con las recetas de su negocio y se mantienen fieles a su comida.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en materias primas; carnes frías, salsas, pollo, papas, carne de res y cerdo, con esta inversión Diana continuará ofertando sus productos sin contratiempos y podrá continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su pequeña niña de tan solo dos años de edad. Su meta a  futuro es incrementar las ventas y compra su casa.
texts.en:
Diana is a young small-businesswoman who started her business after dealing with a difficult family situation. After separating from her partner, the circumstances forced her to look for a way to support her family. She found the food business a possibility and started selling tamales, ice creams and cookies. Now, she also sells fast food in the patio of her house. She was supported by her mother who bought her everything she needed for the beginning stage of her project.

She is very committed to her job. She opens her food sales every day and has a very wide menu, including: hamburgers, hot dogs, sausages, and grilled chicken, beef and pork. The neighbors of the area are her main customers and they are faithful to her food.

Currently, she is applying for her first Credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy ingredients: cold meats, sauces, chicken, potatoes, beef, and pork. With this investment, Diana will continue to offer her products without setbacks and she will be able to continue offering wellbeing to her little daughter who is only 2-years old. Her future goal is to increase sales and buy a house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients: cold meats, sauces, chicken, potatoes, beef, and pork.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 51 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Liliosa works very hard to provide for them.

Liliosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk food, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. Liliosa has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Liliosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk food, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Loreliza

texts.en:
Loreliza is 28 years old and married. Loreliza works very hard to provide for her family.

Loreliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk food, eggs, sugar, home care products, and other groceries. Loreliza has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Loreliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk food, eggs, sugar, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Axel

texts.en:
Axel is a 26-year-old lad. He is single and lives with his parents. He is an entreprenuer because he has been devoloping an enterprise along with a friend. This enterprise is dedicated to water purifiers.

Axel is also studying. He studies psychology and would love to become a known psychoanalist. His biggest success is being able to help with the economic support of his house and his academic results. His biggest challenge is to expand his enterprise to all the country.

Now, in order to keep growing, he is asking for a 6,271 MXN loan that will allow him to service his machines. This loan is not only going to help him and the purifier, but his credit history, since he has not taken any serious loans before. He only has had comunication and service loans before.

loans.use: to invest in his purifier.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Antonieta se sigue dedicando al negocio de  fotocopiadora, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papeles  para la fotocopiadora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonieta continues to work at her photocopy business, which is how she supports her family. She is requesting a loan to buy paper for the photocopy machine.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy paper for her photocopy business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LA NUEVA UNION DE SAN LORENZO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ocobamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luisa alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de madera, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "La Nueva Union de San Lorenzo" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Ocobamba and department of Cuzco.

Luisa alternates her daily activities, dedicating herself to her business selling wood. She has been doing this work for a while, which is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her work every day. She is a responsible person.

She wants to be able to continue working to keep supporting her family. She feels thankful for the given loan and promises to comply with her dues. She is asking for a loan to buy wood and other things.

loans.use: to buy wood and other things.

loans.name: Jiezel

texts.en:
At a young age of 23, Jiezel is already working hard and trying to be a good entrepreneur. She runs a vegetable stall business in a public market in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. She wants to supplement the income of her husband, Abdul, who is also operating another buy-and-sell business. They work hard to support the needs of their two small children and prepare early for their education.

Jiezel chose vegetable vending because it’s a healthy food and many people are now conscious about their health. It’s also an encouragement for her to eat healthy food in order to avoid serious illnesses in the future.

Jiezel dreams of improving her business so as to enjoy a more comfortable life someday. As an additional step in realizing her dream, she applied for a PHP 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices that she can supply to her customers. May God knock at your compassionate heart and may you be a blessing to her, because it will surely bring higher earnings and savings for her family.

Jiezel is an inspiration to her co-fellowship members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect on God’s Word and share stories about their lives and their businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia once again is very happy with all the help she gets from all the Kiva lenders. She thanks you all for helping her with her rice cultivation. With the profits of the last loan, she renovated (painted) her house. Patricia also could save some money for purchasing a rice plot. But that is not enough, so she again wants a loan of SRD 10,000 for buying fertilizers and pesticides for her rice production so she can make more profits and save more.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 54 years old and has three children who are in school.

Luzviminda has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: 18 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
Ramona es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 8, 10, 12 y 14 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de hamacas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy activa. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ área muy conocida por su manufactura artesanal.
Ramona es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español (sentada al centro, viste blusa blanca y la distingue un aro en la oreja). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que solo cuenta con energía eléctrica. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevo a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, artesanía en cuero, elaboración de sombreros de sao, venta de fruta, taller de cerrajería, venta de carne de pollo y venta de refrescos. Su negocio es la fabricación de hamacas, estas son hechas de material plástico, se las fabrica trenzando a mano una por una hasta finalizarla, “fabricamos hamacas que generalmente se enredan entre 2 árboles para descansar al aire libre, nuestras hamacas duran para toda la vida…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la época fría donde las ventas bajan. Su sueño es abrir un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea comprar material plástico por mayor para fabricar hamacas para la época de verano. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ramona solicita un préstamo para la compra de material para la fabricación de hamacas para la época de verano.
texts.en:
Ramona is a 35-year old woman. She lives with her partner and has 4 children, ages 8, 10, 12, and 14. Her business is making hammocks. She is a good mother, entrepreneurial and very active. Her business is located in the "Cotoca" area, which is very well-known for its handcrafted manufacturing.

Ramona is dark-skinned, with a short stature and robust physique. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. (She is seated in the center, dressed in a white blouse and distinguished by a hoop in her ear.) She shares her life with her parter, who works in the same business, and with her children who are in school. They live in their own home built of bricks and it only has electricity.

The need to improve her business brought her to form a bank of people with businesses such as: selling food, leather crafts, making straw hats, selling fruit, locksmith shop, selling meat and chicken, and selling soft drinks.

Her business is making hammocks. These are made from plastic and are braided by hand one-by-one until completed. "We make hammocks that are generally tied between 2 trees to rest in open air. Our hammocks last forever..." she says. The advantage of her business is that her sales are constant. The disadvantage is the cold season where the sales drop.

Her dream is to open a permanent stall. She wants to buy plastic material at wholesale to make hammocks during the summertime. This is the 1st loan with the institution in the 4 years that she has done this job. For these reasons, Ramona is asking for a loan to buy the material to make hammocks for the summertime.

loans.use: to buy material to make hammocks for summertime.

loans.name: Dionicia Gerarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LA NUEVA UNION DE SAN LORENZO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ocobamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Dionicia, tiene 59 años de edad es casada y tiene 06 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de cultivo de frutas la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "La Nueva Union de San Lorenzo". This bank is located in the district of Ocobamba and department of Cuzco.

Dionicia is 59-years old. She is married and has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities, dedicating herself to her business selling fruit that she grows. She has been doing this job for a while, and it is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her job every day. She is a responsible person.

She wants to be able to keep working to continue to support her family. She feels thankful for the given loan and promises to comply with her dues. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 31 years old with four children. With three of her children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like peanuts, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marilou has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like peanuts, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 48 years old and three of her children are in school.

Marilou has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, and other supplies for her business.

Marilou has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Noemi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noemi, de 43 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar y también salía a vender para ayudar en los ingresos de su familia.- Se acompañó y procreó cuatro hijos junto a su pareja, su esposo trabaja de cuidador de una finca de café y de vendedor de medicina.

Noemi, se dedica al comercio de medicinas y vitaminas, de esa manera ella aporta ingresos a la economía de su familia y para que sus hijos estudien y tengan una mejor estabilidad y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida con mejores oportunidades de superación.

Ella, necesita el préstamo para comprar más medicina y para comprar fertilizantes para la milpa que tiene sembrada, para obtener una mejor cosecha.

Noemi, sueña con construir una mejor vivienda de ladrillo, porque la casa donde vive es de lámina y también sueña con darles el estudio a sus hijos, hasta que se gradúen de una carrera técnica.
texts.en:
Noemi, 43, did not have the opportunity to go to school. As a young girl she began helping her mother with the household chores and she also sold items to help with her family income. She entered into a relationship and she and her partner have four children. Her husband works as a caretaker at a coffee farm and he also sells medicine.

Noemi works selling medicine and vitamins, which is how she contributes to the family income so that her children can go to school and have better stability, quality of life, and opportunities to succeed.

She needs the loan in order to buy more medicine and to buy fertilizers for the cornfield she planted, to improve the harvest.

Noemi's dream is to build a better brick house, because the house where she lives now is made of sheet metal. She also dreams of giving her children the chance to go to school and complete a technical program.

loans.use: to buy more medicine and to buy fertilizers for her cornfield.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
La socia es la señora Sabina, la socia continua  dedicándose a la actividad de lavado de vehículos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros.
 La socia Sabina está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “KANCHARY” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

The member is Sabina. She continues to work at her business which is washing vehicles. She is a responsible and persevering person. She has been operating her business for a long time, this being the way she gets her family ahead.

Sabina is requesting a loan to buy food like rice, sugar and milk amongst others.

The member Sabina is very grateful for the support from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy food like rice, sugar and milk amongst others.

loans.name: Mery Anselma

texts.es:
La socia Mery Anselma se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de de golosinas,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chupetes,chicles, caramelos y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Mery Anselma continues working in her business selling sweets. Her dream is to increase the business selling sweets. Through this business, she wants to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy lollipops, gum, candy and cookies. She is happy for the loan and promises to pay her fees.

loans.use: to buy lollipops, gum, candy and cookies.

loans.name: Karen Estrella

texts.es:
Karen es una joven reconocida en la zona por sus actividades económicas de pupusería y venta de ropa y calzado, es madre soltera de una niña de 8 años de edad, vive únicamente con su madre e hija, junto a su madre salen a vender todos los días sus productos y por las tardes se dedican a elaborar la venta de pupusas.
Comprará variedad de calzado y ropa, para ambos sexos, podrá fortalecer su negocio de gran manera, puesto que sus productos  cubrirán las demandas existentes y atenderá a nuevos clientes, así podrá seguir trabajando.
Su visión es obtener el mayor beneficio de la inversión e incrementar sus ganancias con las que cubrirá las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Karen is a young girl known in the area for her work in her stall selling stuffed tortillas and also selling clothing and shoes. She is a single mother of an 8-year old girl. She lives with her mother and daughter. With her mother, she goes out every day to sell her products and in the afternoons they sell the pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

She will buy a variety of shoes and clothing for both sexes. She will be able to strengthen her business in a big way, inasmuch as her products cover the existing demands and bring in new customers so she can keep working. Her vision is to get the best benefit out of the investment and increase her earnings to cover her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes and clothing for both sexes. She will be able to strengthen her business in a big way, inasmuch as her products cover the existing demands.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Rossana, pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
La socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Rossana está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
The member is Rossana who belongs to the “KANCHARY” communal bank of the city of Cusco, Perú.

The member continues working at her business which is a grocery store. She has had her business for quite some time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day. She continues to sell her merchandise to her clients when they request them. She wants to be able to continue to work so she can continue to support her family.

Rossana is very grateful for the support from Kiva to strengthen her economic activity. She is requesting the loan to buy sugar and milk amongst others.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk amongst others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, metal sheets, and brick to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Ana Maria se dedica al negocio de venta de ferreteria,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es abrir otra ferreteria.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ana Maria works selling hardware. Through this business, she wants to support her family. Her dream is to open another hardware shop. She is asking for a loan to buy nails, paint and wires. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with her payments.

loans.use: to buy nails, paint and wire.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nora works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nora is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish net for her fishing business.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 49 years old and married with four children. Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, junk foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Mercedita has been in this business for five years and she sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, junk foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Pergenia

texts.en:
Pergenia is 48 years old and married; she works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

Pergenia has been in this business for two years.

In the future Pergenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 63 years old and is married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Rosa has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Michelle is 26 years old now.

Michelle has a sound system rental business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a 9,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her business.

Michelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, Michelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve works hard to support her family. Salve is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a 26,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell.

Salve has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Salve would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Victoria has been in this business for five years. 

In the future Victoria would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 58 years old and married.

Mila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Mila has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 61 years old and married with four children. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

Adelaida has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Yolanda has been in this business for five years. 

In the future Yolanda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rowena has a buy and sell dressed chicken business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a 29,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more dressed chicken to sell in the market.

Rowena has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chicken to sell in the market

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 33 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es: Claribel es una emprendedora mujer de 60 años de edad que decidió seguir los pasos de su hermano quien laboraba en un restaurante de comidas típicas, ella empezó a trabajar en su compañía y aprendió todo lo relacionado con el arte de la culinaria.  En el año de 1995 tomó la decisión de ser una empresaria independiente y tener su propio negocio, así que no tuvo dudas e inició esta actividad con un pequeño capital en un local ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Hoy en día su restaurante es muy reconocido en este sector, el cual es muy concurrido por trabajadores de almacenes, bancos, oficinas y visitantes, ella ofrece almuerzos típicos de la Región Caribe los cuales empieza a preparar a partir de las 6 a.m. y labora en horario extendido hasta las 4 p.m., así en  el transcurso del día, sus comensales llegan hasta su local a degustar de las exquisiteces que prepara y una vez recibe el producido del día, realiza las compras de víveres para el día siguiente en el mercado. Cada vez más se incrementa la afluencia de clientes a razón de su exquisita sazón, en la actualidad está aplicando su primer credikiva, con el cual invertirá en víveres al por mayor entre ellos arroz, carne de diferentes clases, verduras y condimentos.  Con esta inversión pretende disminuir sus costos y tener mayores utilidades.  Su meta a futuro es realizarle adecuaciones al local y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Claribel is a 60-year old entrepreneur who decided to follow the steps of her brother who worked in a traditional food restaurant. She started to work in his company and learned everything related to the culinary arts. In 1995, she made the decision to be an independent businesswoman and have her own business. She didn't have any doubts and started to work with little money in a place located in the center of the city of Barranquilla.

Now her restaurant is very well-known in this area, and is crowded with workers from stores, banks, offices and visitors. She offers traditional lunches from the Carribean, which she starts to prepare at 6 AM, and works an extended schedule until 4 PM. During the day, her guests arrive to taste the delicacies that she has prepared. Once she has received the proceeds for the day, she shops for supplies for the next day in the market.

More and more, her customer influx increases due to her exquisite flavor. Now, she is applying for her first Credikiva, to invest in supplies at wholesale, such as rice, different types of meats, vegetables, and condiments. With this investment she aims to lower her costs and have more utilities. Her future goal is to make adaptations to her restaurant and buy a house.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale, such as rice, different types of meats, vegetables, and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: sand, cement, chairs and to pay labor costs to improve the shop and make it more attractive to customers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 63 years old and widowed with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell, like eggs, junk food, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Elena has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, junk food, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Charin

texts.en:
Ma. Charin works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF to invest in a water filter. This is because she wants to access clean water away from any diseases. She is aware that, by using the water filter, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing the health risks of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a 63-year-old widow with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who owns a tailoring business in the Philippines. Nerissa requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Nerissa has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nerissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
Anie is 60 years old and married with one child. She is in agriculture, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Anie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anie has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Anie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Gertrudes

texts.en:
Ma. Gertrudes is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Ma. Gertrudes runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Ma. Gertrudes has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Daisy

texts.en:
Ma. Daisy is 31 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as sugar, milk, soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Ma. Daisy has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Ma. Daisy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as sugar, milk, soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 45 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Geraldine requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Geraldine has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Geraldine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is married and for the past ten years has sold fish in the Philippines to earn an income. She works hard not only to support her family but save money to develop her business.

Bernadith has applied for a 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more varieties of fish to sell in her stall.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Meet Rose is 25 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. This is an area of limited resources, where scarcity of employment opportunities and resources with which to survive causes people to practice farming. Her primary sources of income are crops, poultry and animal farming.

Rose is contented with the farming way of life. She is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

Being a woman from Africa and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Rose feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her.

Rose is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in college. Please help Rose so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her children.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 47-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, which is a small agricultural center near Mount Elgon. She owns a small piece of land together with her husband, and they have been blessed with children. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown maize for 5 years.

From Kiva lenders, Pauline is seeking a loan worth KES 30,000 to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with KIVA to afford Pauline access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.
She counts on help from Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is an ambitious woman and looks to a future when she is the leading supplier of horticulture products. Mary is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.

Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Mary access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector.

With your loan, Mary’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is married and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. Cherryl's husband is an OFW. With his income, she was able to start a retail store in their village. She has successfully repaid her previous loan.

Cherryl plans to add more inventory to her store to offer to her customers. She took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional groceries for her retail store. In the future, Cherryl wants to improve her business as well as to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries for her store.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is married and a mother. For the past ten years she has bought and sold charcoal to earn an income in the Philippines.

Charito took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF. With the goal of further building her business, she has now applied for an additional loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Charito works continuously to save enough money to eventually send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annabelle is 31 years old now.

Annabelle has a food vending business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as spices, etc..

Annabelle has been in this business for six years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as spices, etc.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 54 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Estrella has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a 21,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle transport.

Estrella has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle transport

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is 55 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Flaviana works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Flaviana has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries. In the future, Flaviana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 42-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and ingredients for her business.

Marites has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Merlene

texts.en:
Merlene is 58 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Merlene has been farming sugarcane for 20 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Merlene has requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur with nine children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilou is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer and farm supplies. She supplements this income by selling vegetables.

Marilou dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish. She has been in this business for two years.

Teresita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Mrs. Dewi has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs. Dewi heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava Water Filters held safe water training in her vicinity.

Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling and without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Dewi, who is also a health worker in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became a sales representative for Nazava in her area.
