Mrs. Dewi will use this loan to buy about 20 filters and sell them to her neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: to buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, 50, is a proud mother of a lovely family that she really values and treasures. She will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.
During the past ten years Christine has farmed crops, raised chickens and kept cows for their milk. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is very determined and dedicated and has never regretted venturing into farming.
Christine sells her vegetables, eggs, and milk at a distant market.

Her challenges are to deliver her products while fresh and meet the demand that exists as much as she can. But she must walk a great distance to reach the market and this really affects her. So Christine is seeking a 60,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a motorbike. With it she will be able to deliver her perishable products quickly.
Christine’s dream is to climb out of poverty and she is sure that through this loan she will be able to realize her dream. She would like to empower others economically, so she plans to employ someone to drive the motorbike and help on her farm. She will repay the loan with her savings, increase her farm’s productivity and so improve her living standards.
Christine hopes that you will help her accomplish her goals. Go for it! Support her today.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to take her goods to market.

loans.name: Joanita

texts.en:
Joanita is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Rift Valley. Joanita and her husband are blessed with 4 children. Joanita has been a farmer for more than 10 years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Joanita is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya.

Joanita is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Joanita seeks to continue growing a variety of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kitale and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: to expand her farm business by purchasing good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 37 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jonalyn has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items. These include canned goods, rice, personal care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business. She would also like to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eliseba

texts.en:
Eliseba, 45, is a mother who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for ten years. Her primary income sources are maize, vegetables, and profits from a small-time personal business. Eliseba is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The farm work women in the area are currently doing was previously done by males. Women have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labor in urban areas. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields and reducing time and physical effort. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Eliseba replied, "I will be able to educate my children."
With this contribution this mother could continue to achieve her dreams. Act now, make a loan so that you can keep her big smile.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: St. Joseph's Model School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fr. Felix. He is an administrator at St. Joseph's Model School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Rubindi in Mbarara with 400 students. St. Joseph's Model School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Joseph's Model School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fr.Felix ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita Agnes resides in Aloran with her six children and her husband. She has operated a piggery for a year now and it is doing well.

She took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC micro-credit to purchase feeds for the pigs for her piggery. She wants an improvement to her piggery in order to earn more and save little by little a portion of her income for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en: Cherryl is married, 29 years old and has 5 children living in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Cherryl's husband is an construction worker and she wants to help her husband in providing the needs of her children.She engaged in selling grocery goods to their local community. She plans to add more inventory goods to her store to offer to her customers.She gain access and joined in GDMPC,and recently she took a loan from GDMPC  to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store. In the future, Cherryl wants to improve her business as well as improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store

loans.name: Rislyn

texts.en:
Rislyn is 32 years old and married with one child in school; Rislyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, etc.

Rislyn has been in this business for four years.

In the future Rislyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old and has twelve children. Victoria is married and has five children who are still in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina, 57, is married and has two children. For the past ten years she has raised livestock in the Philippines to earn an income.

Cristina has taken out and successfully repaid seventeen previous loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 11,000 PHP loan to buy feed and other supplies for her animals. She strives to build her business so as to give her family a stable future.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her animals.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 51 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Thelma has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nida is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nida has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, and other supplies needed in her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nida has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Ma. Precious Colleen

texts.en:
Ma. Precious Colleen is a single woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Precious Colleen is 21 years old.

Ma. Precious Colleen has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Ma. Precious Colleen requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cosmetics to sell such as lotion, soap, etc..

Ma. Precious Colleen has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ma. Precious Colleen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell such as lotion, soap, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 63 years old, with four children. Dolores works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, noodles, shampoo, diaper, eggs, tomato paste, salt, condiments and other groceries. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: tobuy items to sell like eggs, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 57 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, etc., for her food production business.

Consuelo has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 38 years old.

She has a selling lumber business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more lumber to sell.

Elvira has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more lumber to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell frozen products. Delia is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and other equipment for her repair shop business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and other equipment for her repair shop

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marites has been in pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 49 years old, married, and has six children, two of who are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosita has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall for her meat vending business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from frozen foods vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 56 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Betty works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Betty has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Christina is in her late 30's and is married with three children. One of them is grown up and the other two are still in school. She has been a food vendor for six years now. She works from 6am to 7pm daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Christina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her food stock and serve more people. She dreams of building her own house.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group Parachichi, which consists of four members. These members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her food stock and serve more people.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Yesenia, la socia pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARY,la socia  sigue dedicándose a la actividad de cosmetóloga en su salón de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue ofreciendo sus servicios a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de  secadoras entre otros.
La socia  está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica.
texts.en:
This associate is Yesenia. The associate belongs to the communal bank, Kanchary. The associate continues working in the business of cosmetology at her beauty salon. The associate has been in business for a while. It is going well thanks to the effort she puts in to her business everyday. 
The associate continues offering her services to the customers who request them. The associate wishes to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. 
The associate is requesting the loan to buy hair dryers, among other things. The associate is very thankful for the support from Kiva to strengthen her business

loans.use: to buy hair dryers, among other things.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 51 years old, married, and has seven children. Two of her children are enrolled in school.

Georgina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Georgina has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Genely

texts.en:
Ma. Genely is 43 years old and married with four children currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like candies, biscuits, cereals, coffee, sanitary pads, noodles, etc., to sell.

Ma. Genely has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, cereals, coffee, sanitary pads, noodles, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ma. Genely would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like candies, biscuits, cereals, coffee, sanitary pads, noodles, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Voahirana Florine

texts.fr:
Voahirana Florine est une femme travailleuse et courageuse de 46 ans. Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont deux sont déjà grands et deux encore à sa charge et scolarisés. Elle est marié et les deux époux exercent ensemble l'activité principale, source de revenu de la famille, c'est à dire la "Quincaillerie". Auparavant, elle était démarcheur seulement, mais depuis 2005, elle ouvrait un lieu de vente fixe et ceci se développe petit à petit surtout à partir sa collaboration avec CEFOR. A part le lieu de vente fixe, son mari pratique la vente ambulante, il rejoigne les grands marchés des  différents grands villages et districts.
L'objectif de la famille est de construire sa propre maison car actuellement, elle loue encore le domicile où elle habite. Elle s'efforce maintenant de faire des économies pour pouvoir réaliser cet objectif.
texts.en:
Voahirana Florine is a hard-working and determined 46-year old woman. She has four children, two of who are already grown, and two others still in her care and attending school. She is married and runs a business together with her spouse. Their hardware store is the family's main source of income. 
In the past  Voahirana Florine sold her goods door-to0-oor, but in 2005 she has opened a permanent sales stand and kept growing her business gradually, to a large extent thanks to her collaboration with CEFOR. In addition to sales from their stand, her husband also sells as an itinerant vendor and travels to big markets of various large villages and regions. 

The spouses have a goal of building a house for their family since at present they are renting their place of residence. Voahine Florine tries to put some money aside in order to be able to reach this goal.

loans.use: to buy circuit breakers, socket, power switches, meters, cables, terminal blocks etc.

loans.name: Lungujja Progressive School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Gerald. He is an Administrator at Lungujja Progressive School. This is a mixed school in the urban area of Lungujja in Kampala with 500 students. Lungujja Progressive School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for his students. The school does not currently have consistent access to clean drinking water. Instead, they have to spend a considerable portion of their budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term as the cost for firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Lungujja Progressive School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Gerald ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance. Clean water will help reduce the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students attending school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for his students.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Francisco Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “MUJERES LUCHADORAS DE SAN FRANCISCO” conformada por 05 socias con deseos de trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella es NOEMI una de las socias de 35 años de edad casada con 3 hijos dependientes. Ella tiene su negocio de venta de tejidos artesanales el cual ella mismo los confecciona. Su mayor deseo es de poder implementar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de lana e hilos. El grupo “mujeres luchadoras de san francisco” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir creciendo. Noemí es la PRIMERA DEL LADO DERECHO TIENE EN BRAZOS A SU PEQUEÑA HIJA.
texts.en:
This is the group "Mujeres Luchadoras de San Francisco" ["The Feisty Women of San Francisco"], formed by 5 members with the desire to work and improve their quality of life.

One of the members is Noemí, who is 35 years old and married with 3 dependent children. She has a business selling artisanal woven goods which she makes herself. Her greatest wish is to be able to implement her business. She requested the loan to buy wool and thread.

The group "Mujeres Luchadores de San Francisco" are grateful to the Kiva lenders who made this loan possible since it allows them to continue growing. Noemi is the first woman on the right side, she has her small daughter in her arms.

loans.use: to buy wool and thread.

loans.name: Delaila

texts.en:
Delaila is a 43-year-old woman.

Delaila has a food vending business in the Philippines. Delaila requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, spices, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Delaila has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Delaila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, spices, etc

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli works hard to support her family. Araceli is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Araceli has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Araceli would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elda Basilia

texts.en:
Elda Basilia is 41 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Elda Basilia works very hard to provide for them.

Elda Basilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, junk foods, and other groceries.

Elda Basilia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Elda Basilia would like to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Mercedita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 61 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emerita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, juice, candies, cereals, etc. to sell.

Emerita has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, juice, candies, cereals, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emerita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, juice, candies, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a general store in her village. She used her previous loans to improve her business and has been paying her previous loan. Supervising the business personally is not easy but with love and the help of her family, she has been able to continually improve it. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC  to purchase beverages and more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she would like to sustain and improve the business to ensure a better source of income.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 61 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Consuelo runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like canned goods, bread, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

Consuelo has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, etc.

Consuelo would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, bread, cooking oil, noodles, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is 36 years old and married with four children. All of them are enrolled in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Argie has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Argie has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries.

In the future, Argie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She earns a living from her oyster culture business in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

She supplements this income with earnings from fishing.

Mercedita dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

In the future Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Baylon

texts.en: Baylon is 66 years old and married. For one year already, he has operated a general store in his village. Baylon needs to add inventory capital to increase his sales because his business is the main source of income that absolutely supports his family. Baylon joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. He hopes that in the future his business will prosper. He wants to settle down, having a complete and happy family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
This is Loida from Prosperidad, Agusan Del Sur. She is 48 years old, single, and carries many responsibilities for her parents, siblings, nephews and nieces. She extends financial assistance to them regularly. They are the reason for her perseverance as she doesn’t want to work for herself alone. She runs a stall of ready to wear apparel located in their town’s public market. She sells shorts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, underwear, slippers, shoes, sandals, and much more. Her income provides for her everyday needs and financial assistance for her relatives. She knows that the competition is stiff and profits are irregular, hence Loida dreams of expanding her business. She needs additional capital worth PHP 30,000 that she can use to buy stock of new clothes and hot items to attract more customers. She knocks at your kind hearts to grant her request. She is a trusted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock of new clothes

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aiza is 27 years old and has one child who is in school.

Aiza has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Aiza has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her sugarcane farming and food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Alma dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ester requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Ester has been in this business for two years now.

Ester would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marissa has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

Marissa has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Audita

texts.en:
Audita is 51 years old and has nine children. She is married and has five children who are still in school.

Audita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Audita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Audita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 59 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leonora has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, soft drinks, cereals, coffee, sugar, etc.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia Mariluz se sigue dedicando al negocio de cafetin,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el ngeocio de cafetin.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tortas,pasteles y gelatinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mariluz continues to work in a café. She is enterprising and through this business she wants to move forward. Mariluz' dream is to expand her café. She is applying for a loan in order to buy cakes, pastries and jelly.

Mariluz is happy to receive this loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy cakes, pastries and jelly.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA VIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es Juli Karina, la socia continúa con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo chompas, casacas, a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen  el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Nueva Vida" communal bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

One member is Juli Karina, who continues working at her business selling clothes. Juli is responsible and dedicated. She continues to sell sweaters and coats to customers looking for these items. Juli has had this business for some time and it gives her personal satisfaction as it allows her to help her family to move forward.

Juli is applying for this loan in order to buy sweaters and other items.

The group's members are grateful for this loan and promise to make their repayments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and other items.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 35 years old, married with three children.

Edlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Edlyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 35 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a gasoline retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gasoline to sell.

Ailyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items and services, such as a vulcanizing shop.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline to sell

loans.name: Jennifer Isabel

texts.es:
Jennifer, vive con su compañero de vida y un hijo de pocos meses de nacido, como una forma de apoyar con los gastos de su familia hace un año empezó a vender ropa, atiende su negocio sola, trabaja de ocho de la mañana a seis de la tarde, su hermana le ha apoyado para que pueda aprender el oficio.
Invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir para caballeros, damas y niños/as, con lo que podrá ofrecer a sus clientes ropa de moda, espera tener un negocio más diversificado y clientes satisfechos.
Los sueños de Jennifer son darle a su familia lo necesario para que tenga una vida más confortable y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jennifer lives with her partner and her son, who is a few months old. In order to help with family expenses, one year ago Jennifer began selling clothes. She works alone at her business from 8am to 6pm. Her sisters has helped her to learn this trade.

Jennifer will use this loan to buy men's, women's and children's clothing and sell her customers fashionable clothes. She hopes to diversify her business, and to have satisfied customers.

Jennifer's dreams are to give her family everything that they need so that they can have a comfortable life, and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's and children's clothing and sell her customers fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, es una señora reconocida en su comunidad por trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos y criando aves de corral, vive con dos de sus hijos y algunos nietos, sus hijos le apoyan en sus actividades, de esa manera pueden llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
El financiamiento le será de utilidad para comprar abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, para sembrar granos básicos en la segunda temporada del año, tendrá a su alcance los materiales necesarios para que sus cultivos den una mayor producción de granos.
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando para dar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Teresa is well-known in her community for working in the fields growing basic grains and raising poultry. She lives with her children and grandchildren. Teresa's children support her with her work, allowing her to bring home an income every day.

This loan will be used to buy manure, weed-killer and insecticides in order to sow basic grains during the second season of the year. With this loan , Teresa will have the necessary materials to produce more grains.

Teresa's dream is to continue working to feed her family better, and provide clothing, healthcare, and an education.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed-killer and insecticides in order to sow basic grains during the second season of the year.

loans.name: Jlg-003(A)-Veerambur Group

texts.en:
Revathi, from Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu, has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. She is 30 years old, having a family size of two.

Revathi's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

Joining hands with three others, whose families all face similar problems, due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Revathi has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives, they now seek a loan of INR 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to fund the installation of a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Aniya-Lobbo Group

texts.fr: Binta est une femme malienne, présidente du groupe elle est âgée de 55ans et fait le commerce de tissus. Elle réside au Mali, elle vit avec son mari qui fait le commerce aussi et un petit fils. Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 4 ans ; c’est celle qui à sa main sur les tissus. Binta a contracté  le prêt au RMCR  pour acheter plus de tissus afin de  développer son entreprise et  de soutenir ses dépenses. Le prêt sera utilisé dans l’achat des couvres lit  pour les revendre. Elle gagne plus de 17 500fcfa par mois, mais souvent l’accès à certains marchés lui semble difficile pendant la période de pluie. Dans son activité ce qui lui plait est que beaucoup de personnes achètent les tissus.
texts.en:
Binta is 55 years old and from Mali. She is the president of the group and works selling fabrics. She [currently] lives in Mali with her husband, who also works in commerce, and her grandson.

Binta has been selling fabrics for four years. She is seeking this loan from RMCR to buy more fabric as a way to develop her business and support her expenses. Specifically, this loan will go towards buying bed covers to resell.

Binta earns more than 17,500 francs CFA each month, but often some markets are difficult to access during the rainy season.

Binta enjoys having many customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric to resell.

loans.name: Twiyubake Group

texts.fr:
Annociate fait partie du groupe  Twiyubake et  habite à  Gitega. Elle   a 35 ans et est marie à Therence, un aide maçon.   

Elle fait le commerce de la bière de banane  et de la farine depuis  depuis  19 ans. 

Elle  est à son dix-neuvième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes   à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Annociate is a member of the Twiyubake group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and married to Therence, a mason's assistant.

Annociate has been selling banana beer and flour for 19 years. She is on her 19th loan with Turame.

With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large amount of bananas to [make into beer] and resell, as a way to earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of bananas to [making into beer and] resell.

loans.name: Muzeturihe Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine  fait partie du groupe  Muzeturihe et  habite à  Gitega. Elle   a 43 ans et est marié  à Léonidas, un commerçant.  Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 13 à 17 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de tôles  depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est a son neuvième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de tôles  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jeanine is a member of the Muzeturihe group and lives in Gitega. She is 43 years old and married to Léonidas, a merchant. Together they have two children, who are 13 and 17 years old.

Jeanine has been selling sheet metal for six years. She is on her 19th loan with Turame.

With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of sheet metal to resell, as a way to earn more.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal to resell.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Akossiwa est une veuve femme âgée de 45 ans résidant à Adidogomè. Akossiwa est une coiffeuse qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché des produits de beauté et les expose dans son salon de coiffure  pour vendre à ses clients. Akossiwa nécessite ce crédit pour commander des unités de mèches, de tissages et des parfums en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à subvenir aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
A mother of two children, Akossiwa is 45 years old, a widow, and lives in Adidogomè.

She works as a hair stylist, and she procures stock twice a month from beauty product markets. She then displays this stock in her hair salon to resell to her customers.

Akossiwa needs this loan to order hair extensions, weaves, and perfume. Profits will go towards helping her children in their education and supporting the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 100 units of hair extensions, 80 weaves, and 14 units of perfume.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Avec deux enfants à sa charge, Jeannette est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidodomé pour exercer ses activités. Agée de 44 ans, Jeannette est une marchande de toutes catégories de sacs de friperies. Jeannette s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Jeannette demande ce crédit pour commander des unités de sacs à main au dos afin de gagner  une marge bénéficiaire assez élevée pour pouvoir couvrir les charges quotidiennes dont elle éprouve et veiller à ce que les enfants soient dans de bonnes conditions de vie.
texts.en:
With two dependent children, Jeannette is a married woman who lives and works in Adidodomé. She is 44 years old and sells all kinds of used bags.

She procures her stock twice a month from a market. She resells the bags from a display in front of her house.

Jeannette is seeking this loan to order more handbags and backpacks as a way to earn more profits that will be able to cover the daily expenses and ensure that her children have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 30 handbags and 20 backpacks.

loans.name: Tonshi

texts.fr: Tonshi est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Mère de quatre enfants, Tonshi est une revendeuse d’eau de javel qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Tonshi désire ce prêt pour commander des bidons de javel poudre, de soda wash et des sacs de soda. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Tonshi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et gagner des bénéfices afin d’aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Tonshi is 38 years old, married, and lives in Adidogomé. A mother of four children, Tonshi works selling detergent which she procures twice a month from a market. She makes her resales from her home and by traveling around to surrounding neighborhoods.

Tonshi is seeking a loan to order Javel detergent, baking soda, and washing soda.

With the profits she earns, Tonshi hopes to improve her point of sale and also help her family to develop and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy two drums of Javel detergent and 3 bags of baking soda and 6 bags of washing soda.

loans.name: Kékéli Abra

texts.fr: Kékéli est une femme divorcée qui vit à Adidogomè  avec son enfant à charge. Kékéli est âgée de 25 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Kékéli est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Kékéli sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider son enfant dans son éducation scolaire et à son épanouissement.
texts.en:
Kékéli is a divorced woman who lives in Adidogomè with her one child. She is 25 years old and works hard to have good finances.

Kékéli sells pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] which she procures twice a month from a market.

As a way to reach her goals, she is seeking this loan to order lengths of pagnes. In this way, she can respond to customer demand and achieve financial independence, which will help to support her child's education and development.

loans.use: to buy 12 lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric].

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 41 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge. Yawa est une revendeuse de condiments résidant à Adidogomé. Yawa achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Yawa sollicite l’octroi de ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches et de gombo en vue d’avoir un bénéfice pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa is 41 years old, married, and lives in Adidogomé with her two children. She works selling condiments, which she buys twice a month from a market and resells from her home and in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Yawa is seeking this loan to make an order of trays of fresh tomatoes and okra. Profits will help Yawa support her husband to provide for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy 15 trays of fresh tomatoes and 10 trays of okra.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Résident à Adidogomé, Ami est âgée de 40 ans. Ami est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Ami sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de draps de friperies afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients puis de gagner des bénéfices et aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ami is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Adidogomé and works selling second-hand sheets, which she procures twice a month from a market. She makes her resales in the surrounding neighborhoods.

As a way to increase her stock and maximize her profit, Ami is seeking this loan to order second-hand sheets so as to respond to her customers' many requests.

She will use her earnings to help her husband cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 25 units of sheets.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 50 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Ayant deux enfants à charge, Yawa  s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant   de la farine de manioc appelé « Gari ». Pour s’approvisionner, Yawa se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Yawa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de farines de manioc, Yawa nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Yawa va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa is 50 years old, married, and lives in Adidogomé. She has two dependent children.

Yawa earns a living by selling cassava flour called "Gari." She procures her stock twice a month from a market.

Yawa is seeking this loan to finance an order of sacs of cassava flour.

With her profits, Yawa is going to help her husband cover the family's daily expenses and their children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacs of cassava flour.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is an ambitious woman and looks to a future when she is the leading supplier of poultry products. She's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill her dream. Dinah, a wife and mother of two children, is a mixed small-scale farmer based in the remote village of Seum, Kitale.

She has been practicing agribusiness for the past nine years and has never looked back. For a living, Dinah sells milk and food products from her farm into the local market. She makes extra money doing a side hustle business. She enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of her products and she really feels satisfied.

Although Dinah has been making profits through farming, she has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge she has encountered is a lack of funds to get her business off the ground. Dinah is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry.

Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kitale and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Dinah does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint.

With this loan, Dinah is confident that her income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in her life. She plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. She also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on her farm.

Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Dinah will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for her farm. Through this loan, she will assure her large family of a secure future and improved living conditions. With your loan, Dinah’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Support her dream by giving Dinah a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Joan, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill, has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are critical to her family’s well-being, this is considered a mere duty in Kenya, a job with little appreciation.

Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and some personal business that she engages in. Joan has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states, “I have to do something for my family."

Joan joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Joan is from a remote village that has poor roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Joan to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Joan feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Joan will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase.

Joan is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Joan will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren a secure future. Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman.

Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Joan!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge à Adidogomé. Ami est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne et le revend trois fois par mois au marché .Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Ami demande ce crédit pour commander des balles de friperies en vue de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en:
Ami is married and lives with her two children in Adidogomé. She works selling used clothing. She procures and resells her stock three time a month at the market.

As a way to increase her stock and maximize her profits in order to respond to her customer's numerous requests, Ami is seeking this loan to order bales of used clothing.

Earnings will go towards helping her husband cover the family's various daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy two bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 39-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is blessed with a lovely family that is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them a better future.

Stellah was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living, and she has space there to use for dairy farming.

She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Kitale is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Stellah, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business.

Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk. She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Peris, 26 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kipkeikei, a remote village in Kitale, Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the high demand.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman and accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, change her living conditions, and secure the future of her children.

With your help, this woman will be able to achieve her goals. Be inspired, make a loan!

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 7 años y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, conservadora y de muy buena actitud. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad caracterizada por el comercio manufacturero en todas las áreas. 
Lupe es de tez trigueña, baja estatura y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de comida, ella cocina sopa de maní, comida tradicional de media mañana a base de maní, “la preparación de e4sta comida es morosa, por eso se sirve a media mañana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias. La desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a los clientes. Su sueño es tener un puesto de comida conocido, ella desea mejorar su puesto de venta de comida comprando muebles de comedor como mesas y sillas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Lupe solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles de comedor para atender a los clientes.
texts.en:
Lupe is a 42-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has one 7-year-old child. Her business is selling food. She is a good mother, conservative, and of a very good attitude. She carries out her business in the southern region of the city characterized by the manufacturing trade in all areas.

Lupe is of dark complexion, short stature, and sturdy physique. Her mother tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who is in construction, and with her son, who is studying in school. They live in a house of their own, built of brick, that has all the basic services. Her business is selling food. She cooks peanut soup, a traditional, peanut-based, mid-morning meal. "The preparation of this food is slow; it's why it's served mid-morning...", she says. Her business's advantage is that the sales are daily; the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of tables and chairs to tend to the customers.

Her dream is to have a well-known food stall. She wishes to improve her food sales stall buying dining furniture like tables and chairs. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in six years engaged in this occupation. It is for those reasons that Lupe is requesting a loan for the purchase of dining furniture to tend to the customers.

loans.use: to buy dining furniture to tend to customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Three-quarters of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in this world because they lack employment and money. This was true for Mary, 29, who is based in the Kitale area of Kenya.

But now she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Mary has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said.

Mary mobilized another woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike.

Mary is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Through this loan, Mary is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Mary feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Mary will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market.

She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her children and of a secure future.

The difficult times this woman is going through and her drive to overcome them makes her worthy of the support she is requesting. Be inspired make a loan!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, screws, and labor costs to begin to repair the kitchen area of her house.

loans.name: Sonia Consuelo

texts.es: Sonia de 46 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de sus 2 hijas de 4 y 18 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida preparando tamales para venderlos entre la semana en los alrededores de la comunidad donde vive, es así como genera sus ingresos económicos que le han permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindado los insumos básicos a su hogar. Sonia desea realizar reparación del piso del corredor de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, mano de obra., para realizar la reparación del piso del corredor.
texts.en: Sonia, 46 years old, lives in her own house with her 2 daughters, ages 4 and 18. She is a hard-working woman who earns her living making tamales to sell during the week in the nearby areas to where she lives. In this way, she generates her income which has allowed her to get her children ahead and bring the basic supplies to the household. Sonia wants to do repairs to the floor of the outdoor walkway of her house, which is deteriorated. For this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and pay labor costs to make the repairs to the floor of the outdoor walkway.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor costs to repair the floor of the outdoor walkway.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
As a mother of three children, the great desire to see them all grow up to be professionals is what fills Janice with enthusiasm and inspiration.

Janice is 53 years old and works tirelessly to raise animals. Through these humble tasks, she aspires to offer all of her children a university education.

Janice learned to do farm work at a young age, thanks to her parents. She has a tiny plot of land to live off – just under half an acre – and has always struggled to support her family. For over 18 years her income source has been from selling milk and crops. She supplement the meager income by doing other business.

Janice passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family, and she wants to have more dairy cows and requests a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow.

She has already identified the breed of cow that she will buy. The cow will be producing between 15 and 20 liters of milk daily. This breed of cow will be producing milk referred to as the ideal drinking milk, because it will contain adequate amount of fat and the desirable quantities of protein. This cow will certainly boost milk production in her farm, which will translate to more sales volume and better income for her and her family. Because of this high milk production potential, she will save more money to fully repay the loan.

She believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a superior breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Smallholder female farmers dominate the agricultural landscape in most production environments in Kenya, yet most of them live in abject poverty. Speaking with Marion, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing.

She lives in a humble home in the town of Chuka, along with a handsome husband and three angelic-looking children. She has always tried to give them a decent life and a good education.

Marion started farming five years ago on a small inherited piece of land. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. Marion also does some side hustle business. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and buy a chaff cutter. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Through the loan, she will also be able to buy a chaff cutter, which is a mechanical device used in cutting hay into small pieces before it is mixed with other forage for better feeding of the cow. The chaff cutter also prevents the animals from rejecting any part of the food.

Marion believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Marion waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit and buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Dinora Eugenia

texts.es: Dinora de 45 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijas de 10, 15 y 20 años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que brinda sus servicios como empleada doméstica en los alrededores de su comunidad, siendo así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijas así como también ha brindado los insumos básicos para su hogar además recibe un apoyo extra de parte del esposo con las necesidades del hogar. Dinora desea continuar realizando mejoras en su vivienda ya con el crédito brindado anteriormente reparo el techo de su vivienda, en esta ocasión desea en cementar el piso de su casa para bríndarles mayor comodidad a su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: en cemento, arena, grava, pago de mano de obra., para poder en cementar el piso de su vivienda y brindarles mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Dinora, 45 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their 3 daughters, ages 10, 15, and 20. She is a hard-working woman who works as a domestic employee in the nearby areas to her community. This is the way she generates her income with which she has gotten her daughters ahead, and also has offered the basic supplies for her household. In addition, she gets extra support from her husband with the household necessities. Dinora wants to continue making improvements to her house since with the previously offered loan, she repaired the roof on her house. This time, she wants to cement the floor of her house to offer her family more comfort. For this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and pay labor costs to be able to cement the floor of her house and offer her family more comfort.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and pay labor costs to be able to cement the floor of her house and offer her family more comfort.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es: José de 33 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar junto a sus padres, compañera de vida, hermanos, hermanas, compañeros de vida de los hermanos(as) y 2 hijas de 7 y 10 de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios como vigilante en una empresa es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que provee los insumos básicos para su hogar. José desea en cementar el piso de su casa para brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, mano de obra., para llevar a cabo en cementación del piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: José, 33 years old, lives in the family house with his parents, his life partner, his brothers, sisters, the life partners of his siblings and 2 daughters, ages 7 and 10. He is a hard-working man who earns his living working as a security guard in a business and this is how he generates his income with which he provides the basic supplies for his household. José wants to cement the floor of his house to offer his family more comfort, and so he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor costs to carry out the cementing of the floor of his house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor costs to carry out the cementing of the floor of his house.

loans.name: Yanci Yanira

texts.es: Yanci de 32 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar junto a sus padres y su hija de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida gracias a que posee un negocio de venta de libros de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana vende típicos de esa manera genera sus ingresos económicos con los que brinda los insumos necesarios que necesita su hija además provee las necesidades básicas para su familia. Yanci desea instalar el techo en la vivienda que ha venido construyendo para poder irse a vivir con su hija y poderle brindar una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, tornillos, hierro, mano de obra., para realizar la construcción del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Yanci, 32 years old, lives in the family home with her parents and her 2-year-old daughter. She is an enterprising woman who earns her living thanks to having a business selling books from Monday to Friday and on the weekends, she sells traditional items, and in this way she generates her income with which she offers the necessary supplies that he daughter needs and in addition provides the basic necessities for her family. Yanci wants to install a roof on the house that she has been building to be able to go and live with her daughter and be able to offer her a better quality of life. For this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in metal sheeting, beams, screws, iron, and pay labor costs to build the roof of her house.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, beams, screws, iron, and pay labor costs to build the roof of her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a 42-year-old farmer from Cherangani, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her family as a primary caregiver.

Her primary source of income is milk and also she plants maize on her farm. She also engages in personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture.

Maria practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the many agricultural training sessions she has been attending to broaden her skills. Although she earns handsome profits from farming, she faces one big challenge and that is high prices of fertilizers, seedlings and inputs, and this is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agro vet shop in her area.

She is requesting a loan to start an agro vet shop. Cherangani area has only one agro dealer, who is catering to thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them extra amounts since he is the only agro dealer and enjoys a monopoly.

Maria wants to change this and seize the business opportunity, and through your loan she will start an agro vet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market.

Maria will also help the smallholder farmers in her area who for a long time have been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. Through your loan, Maria will change from the peasant farmer she is right now to a certified agro dealer who will be depended on by nearly all smallholder farmers in her area both for input, knowledge and information about improved inputs.

Through increased income from the loan she will improve her living conditions and her future plans are to purchase a truck which will be used to engage farmers in output marketing activities.

Maria believes that if female farmers had the same access to resources as men, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced by half.

loans.use: to start an agro vet shop.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Fridah. She is a mother of two with a deeply engraved passion for dairy farming. After all, that is what she has been doing for over 10 years.

She owns a small farm in Kiraghithi village, which is situated in the Central Province of Kenya. The income she makes from farming is not sufficient to comfortably sustain her family. As a result, Fridah has ventured into a couple of small side businesses to make extra shillings. With the aid of her husband, Fridah also rears poultry and grows maize, among other crops.

Fridah is seeking a loan of KES 80,000 for constructing a cowshed. She plans to put up a well-designed barn that will provide a clean, comfortable home for her herd and a pleasant, efficient workplace for her. In a bid to increase milk production, the cowshed will provide a favourable environment for the cows. With your loan, Fridah’ has carefully planned for the storage and handling of milk, feed, bedding and manure, as these account for most of the labour in any dairy farm.
