The housing will have a plentiful, dependable supply of good water, made available 24 hours a day.

The income she will make from this investment will put her in a position to comfortably afford increasing farming costs. Her family also stands to benefit from the growth of their agri-business.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, micro-finance institutions (M.F.I.'s) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet Leah, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 42 years of age. She hails from the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of two lovely children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. 

Leah’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Nandihills area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals to resell and thus improve her income. 

Leah’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Leah has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Leah is quite visionary and, with her accumulated profits, hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Yajayra Nohely

texts.es: Yajayra es una joven de 25 años de edad egresada de la carrera profesional de enfermeria.Actualmente se encuentra realizando su diplomado en dicha carrera. Yajayra se siente feliz ya que gracias a sus estudios puede ayudar a mucha gente y ayudar a sus padres. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para el pago de sus estudios y materiales de estudio. El deseo de yajayra es de terminar satisfactoriamente su diplomado y ser más competitiva y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a estudiantes como ella.
texts.en: Yajayra is a 25-year-old young woman, enrolled in the professional program of nursing. Currently, she is working on her certification in this program. Yajayra is happy since, thanks to her studies, she can help many people, and help her parents. For this, she asked for the loan to pay for her education and school supplies. Yajayra's desire is to satisfactorily complete her degree and to be more competitive and in this way improve her income. She is grateful to the Kiva investors for supporting students like her.

loans.use: to pay for her education and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, and iron to build a perimeter wall to provide security to her home.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende chompas,pantalones y polos,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas,blusas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Margarita, continues working at her business selling clothing, the borrower sells sweaters, pants and shirts. The borrower, though this business, wants to get ahead. The borrower asks for the loan to purchase sweaters, blouses, and pants.

The borrower is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos y productos de belleza,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora quer por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comptar zapatos,lapiz labiales y cremas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Ernestina, continues working at her business selling shoes and beauty products. The borrower is an enterprising and hard-working woman who wants, by means of this business, to get her family ahead. The borrower is asking for the loan to purchase shoes, lipstick, and creams.

The borrower is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments on her load.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, lipstick and creams.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio, de 20 años de edad, es una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsable, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, porque desde que tenía 12 años de edad, creció solo con su mamá porque su papá los abandonó.- Hoy en día vive junto a su madre y se dedica la agricultura para poder ganar dinero para su alimentación diaria y la de su madre.

Julio, se ha dedicado desde los 12 años a cultivar la tierra, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a un amigo y ahora es de ahí de donde obtiene ingresos para comprar lo que se necesita día a día.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes, porque sus cultivos ya están creciendo y necesita fertilizarlos para su desarrollo.

Julio, sueña con tener su propia familia y ayudar a su mamá siempre.
texts.en: Julio is 20 years old. He is an honest, hardworking and responsible person. He did not have the opportunity to attend school, because he grew up only with his mother since he was 12 years old, because his father abandoned them. Nowadays, he lives with his mother and works in agriculture to earn money for their daily subsistence. Julio has worked, since he was 12 years cultivating the land. He learned this job through a friend, and now it is with it that she gets the income to buy what he needs day by day. He needs the loan money to buy fertilizers, because his crops are already growing and he needs fertilizers for their development. Julio dreams of having his own family and helping his mother always.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, de 33 años de edad, es una persona honesta, respetable y trabajadora, estudio hasta noveno grado, se dedica a la agricultura, está casado y junto a su esposa a procreado dos hijos de 6, 3 y 1 año de edad.

Orlando, desde muy pequeño cultiva la tierra junto a su padre, pues fue él quien le enseño a trabajar; ahora tiene 6 años de trabajar de manera propia y actualmente tiene sembrado 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, de esa manera lleva el sustento a su familia.
 
Orlando, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para los cultivos de verano de maíz y frijol y necesita estos insumos para tener más abundancia en sus cosechas.

Orlando, desea seguir cultivando la tierra, para llevar el sustento a su familia y tener los ingresos necesarios para darle el estudio a sus hijos y en un futuro sueña con construir su propia vivienda para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Orlando, 33 years old, is an honest, respectable and hard-working person. He went to school up to the ninth grade, works in agriculture, is married, and along with his wife has three children, ages 6, 3, and 1.

Orlando, from the time he was very young, has cultivated the land with his father since it was he who taught him to work. Now he has been working on his own for 6 years and currently has planted 14,000 square meters of corn. In this way, he brings sustenance to his family.

Orlando needs the loan to purchase manure and fertilizers for his summer crops of corn and beans and needs these supplies to have more abundance in his harvests.

Orlando wants to continue cultivating the land, to bring sustenance to his family and have the necessary income to provide his children with an education and, in the future, he dreams of building his own house to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers for his summer crops of corn and beans.

loans.name: Maria Dinora

texts.es:
María comparte su vida con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, no tiene parientes en el extranjero, trabaja de lunes a sábado de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde vendiendo variedad de frutas y verduras frescas, es una actividad que le permite tener en su hogar mejores ingresos, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre.
Con el financiamiento comprara agua, sodas, jugos, frutas y verduras, para ofrecer a sus clientes nuevos productos y generar ingresos extras, espera saber administrar el crédito para obtener los mejores beneficios.
Sus sueños son que su negocia se mantenga y sea más rentable.
texts.en:
María shares her life with her life partner and their two children. She doesn't have relatives abroad. She works Monday to Saturday from six in the morning to two in the afternoon selling a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables. It is work that allows her to have in better income in her hose. She learned the job from her mother.

With the financing, she will purchase water, sodas, juices, fruits, and vegetables, to offer her customers new products and generate extra income. She expects to know how to manage the loan to get the best benefit.

Her dreams are that her business keeps going and is more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase water, sodas, juices, fruits, and vegetables to offer her customers new products and generate extra income.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Yaovi est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Yaovi vit à Adidogomè  et est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est une marchande des chaussures et des sacs de sorties. Pour gagner son revenu, Yaovi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce crédit pour commander des paquets de  chaussures en vue d’augmenter ses recettes ; ce qui permettra à Yaovi de mieux préparer la rentrée scolaire de ses enfants et assurer les dépenses régulières de la famille.
texts.en: Yaovi is married with two children. Yaovi is 41 and lives in Adidogomè . She sells shoes and handbags for social occasions. To earn a living, Yaovi buys her stock three times each month at the market and requests this loan to order packets of shoes hoping to increase her income; which would enable her to prepare the beginning of the school term for her children better, and to provide for the regular family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 08 packets of shoes.

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en:
Mr Wahyu sells water filter systems in his hometown in Central Java. There is a real need for water filters because you cannot drink the tap water in Indonesia and most people do not even have a tap, relying on well water instead. Nazava Water Filters make dirty well, tap and rain water safe to drink water without the need for boiling, without using electricity. 
This is Wahyu’s fourth loan, he repaid the previous ones on time. In the coming months Wahyu will focus on building a network of sales agents and selling water filters on credit which will allow poorer households to buy them as well. This loan will enable Mr Wahyu to buy around 200 water filters that can deliver truly safe drinking water to 1000 people.

loans.use: to purchase 200 to resell and provide safe drinking water to 1000 people

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne est une dynamique femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses trois enfants à charge. Jeanne est âgée de 62 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir un bon revenu. Jeanne est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Jeanne sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Jeanne is a dynamic woman who is married, and lives with her three dependent children in Adidogomè . Jeanne is 62 and does everything necessary to ensure a good income. Jeanne sells pagnes, she buys her stock twice a month at the market. To achieve her objectives, Jeanne requests this loan to order pagne dresses to satisfy her customers' needs and maintain a remarkable financial autonomy to help her children in their schooling.

loans.use: to buy nine pagnes.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Inviolata is in her late 50s and is a divorcee with three grown up children. She has been running a grocery store for seven years now. She works from 04pm to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the grocery drinks and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to repay loan, to take care of her family, reinvest in business, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving drinks in the grocery store. She dreams of building her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group Lindi which has five members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving drinks in the grocery store.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 37 year-old Lebanese married woman mother for four children, living with her husband who is the income provider. She states that living costs are becoming very expensive. This is the reason why she is in real need today of taking a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, which funds will be paid at once to cover her children study fees. Her first goal is to insure a good educational level to them.

loans.use: to cover her children's study fees.

loans.name: It's Life - N10Tsơn1Psơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mai is 38 years old and she is married.
She has been operating a food stall selling noodles for more than 10 years.
Mai lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Mai faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tables, chairs and ingredients for cooking and selling breakfast.
In 2012, Mai joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mai has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of "It's life - N10TSơn1PSơn", which consists of 4 members.
In the future, Mai hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and ingredients for cooking and selling breakfast.

loans.name: Jehiel

texts.en: Jehiel is a 58-year-old woman from the province of Bohol, Philippines. She is a mother of eight adult children and a 13-year-old child. She has been doing various businesses such as raising pigs, do farming business and a “buri” (largest palm of the Philippines) fiber weaving. Jeheil become proficient in raising pigs for almost 39 years of doing this. She is asking a loan to continue running this business for sustainability. Thus, she buys feed for her pigs, fertilizer and pay laborers for their farm. She wants in the future to uplift her livelihood to give better lives to her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer and pay laborers

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elvie dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 42 years old and has three children. Betty is married and has three children who are in school.

Betty is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Betty requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Betty has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Betty would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 34 years old and has three children. Jennifer is married and has three children who are in school.

Jennifer is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennifer has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Mère  de quatre enfants, Kossiwa est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomè. Agée de 44 ans, Kossiwa fabrique des gâteaux faite à base de la farine du blé et s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Kossiwa vend ses marchandises en gros et en détail  à la devanture de son domicile. Kossiwa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de farine de blé, de l’huile et su sucre en vue d’en fabriquer plus de gâteaux et répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients puis soutenir son mari à prendre en charges les frais scolaire de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Kossiwa has four children. She is married, and lives in Adidogomè. Kossiwa is 44 and makes cakes from a wheat flour base, she stocks up once a month at the market. Kossiwa sells her goods wholesale and retail from the front of her home. Kossiwa requests this loan to order sacks of wheat flour, oil, and sugar with the objective of making more cakes to satisfy the  demand of her customers and to help her husband to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy 08 sacks of wheat flour, 01 can of oil,  and 01 sack of sugar.

loans.name: Omimah

texts.en:
Umaymah is a 23 years old married woman, living in Ajloun.
Because of Umaymah`s marriage, she delayed university and she decided to complete her education and was accepted at university, majoring in Archaeology.

Her husband cannot cover her education fees, but that does not prevent her for completing her education in her desired field. Therefore she applied for an education loan to cover her university fees and to achieve her dreams, to become a productive woman and find a good job to help her husband in their household expense.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees in Archaeology.

loans.name: Ananieta

texts.en:
Ananieta is 57 years old, married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Ananieta has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 33 years and also earns an income from food vending and pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cecile works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure (service). Cecile is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Cecile has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Thelma is 36 years old.

Thelma has a business selling crabs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more crabs to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to sell.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est âgée de 38 ans et est une femme mariée. Kossiwa vit avec ses trois enfants à charge et son mari à Adidogomé où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs et du mil accompagner des gâteaux pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Kossiwa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et désire commander des bols de maïs, du mil et le sac de farine de blé afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Kossiwa is 38. She is married, and lives with her three dependent children and her husband in Adidogomè, where she prepares a gruel made with corn and millet accompanied by cakes for her customers who are content with her business.  Kossiwa stocks up four times a month at the market and would like to order bowls of corn, millet, and a sack of wheat flour in order to make a good profit margin to promote her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 37 bowls of corn, 30 bowls of millet and 01 sack of wheat flour.

loans.name: Chhunlim

texts.en:
Chhunlim, 48, who is a mother of one child and married, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. In the last four years, by owning of a small coffee store at her house, she has been involving in small business which can earn net profit of USD 6 per day.
Because of she thinks that her income is not enough to support the expenditure for her family, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL, to buy more spices for selling with coffee to expand her business to get more income. She would thank to all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to add spices to her store, for selling with coffee.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
She is Carmelita, aged 54, from Toril, Davao City. She’s a wholesaler of charcoal in their community and nearby areas. Her husband, Ricardo, is a businessman who helps in her business through purchasing, marketing and delivery of their products. They are doing this business for ten years already.

Charcoal making and selling is common in Davao because it is used in grilling pork, chicken, and other street foods. It is also used in household cooking as alternative to LPG and electric stove.

Aside from charcoal wholesaling, Carmelita also raises hogs in her backyard. She tries to earn higher income to sustain their everyday needs and college education of her two children. Someday she hopes that her small hog raising business will develop into a big piggery. For now she wants to avail herself of a loan worth PHP 50,000 to buy additional sacks of charcoal, stock of feeds and vitamins for her piglets.

Carmelita dreams that her children will pursue their studies until completion. She prays for good health for the whole family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 55 years old and has eight children. Antonia is married and has two children who are in school.

Antonia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Antonia requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Antonia has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Antonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Lavella

texts.en:
Lavella is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lavella is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lavella has a broom making business in the Philippines. Lavella requested a PHP 21000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed such as bamboo stick, etc..

Lavella has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lavella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed such as bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 64 years old, a widow and has six children.

Julia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Julia requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Julia has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rebecca dreams that one day She will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 56 years old and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosario has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, etc.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Diosdada requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Diosdada has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Onèse

texts.fr: Avec son crédit précédent, Onèse a doublé son stock de riz. Ainsi elle a pu augmenter son chiffre d'affaires de cinquante mille gourdes supplémentaires par semaine. Cela l'a aidé à couvrir les dépenses pour la réouverture des classes pour envoyer ses enfants à l'école. Elle demande un nouveau crédit pour acheter des boites de beurre, des caisses d'huile et des sacs de riz. Elle souhaite continuer à faire progresser son commerce et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: With her previous loan, Onèse doubled her stock of rice. Consequently, she was able to increase her turnover by fifty thousand flasks each week. This enabled her to cover the expenses incurred by the beginning of the new school term to send her children to class. She requests a new loan to buy boxes of butter, cans of oil, and sacks of rice. She wishes to continue to expand her business and to increase her income.

loans.use: to double her stockholding of rice.

loans.name: Maysoon Group

texts.en:
Nadia is the featured borrower for Maysoon Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Nadia is a 36-year-old married mother of two children. Three years ago, she started selling clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She has a good reputation in her area.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes to satisfy her customers' needs as she wants to prepare for the upcoming cold winter season. Nadia is the first lady on the left of the photo.
With respect to the other group members, Amal is the lady sitting in the middle, and Haneen is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes and to prepare for the upcoming cold winter season.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Con 45 años de edad Berta con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación mantiene un negocio de venta de gallinas indias. Con esta actividad que ha venido realizando, Berta ha logrado sacar a su hijo quien a estas alturas es un hombre de 22 años de edad y quien la apoya. Berta habita desde hace 10 años en su humilde vivienda, la cual a estas alturas y por los cambios climáticos necesita de algunas reparaciones, principalmente el cambio de techo. Es por ello que Berta ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: polines, láminas, tornillos y mano de obra para el cambio de techo de su vivienda. Ya que con el crédito anterior Berta invirtió en su granja de pollos de engorde comprando más pollos, concentrado, tela metálica, plástico y vitaminas. Berta se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda que recibió, ya que vio una gran mejoría y aumento en los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
At 45 years old, with great effort and dedication, Berta runs a business selling free-range hens. By working in this occupation, Berta has managed to take care of and support her son, who at this stage is a 22-year-old man.

Berta has lived in her humble home for 10 years. Currently, due to the climate changes, her home is in need of some repairs, mainly a new roof. This is the reason that Berta has requested a loan with FUSAI to invest in beams, sheet metal, fasteners, and to pay for the labor costs to change the roof of her home.

With the previous loan, Berta invested in her broiler chicken farm by buying more chickens, feed concentrate, metallic fabric, plastic, and vitamins. Berta is very thankful for the help that she received, since it provided a great improvement and she saw her income grow.

loans.use: to invest in beams, sheet metal, fasteners, and to pay for the labor costs of changing the roof of her home.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica who is in her late 30s is married with three children one of them is still small and others are still in school. She has been a food vendor for seven years now. She works from 06am to 05:30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Veronica’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the popular items in her food stall to meet her customers’ requirement. She dreams of owning a household appliance business.

Veronica will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to restock the popular items in her food stock.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is an 18 year old married woman, living with her husband and one child who is still attending school. She works as a beautician and her husband is the main source of income for the family. Due to the hard financial situation, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her technical study fees. Her purpose is to help achieve high educational levels to be competitive with others.

loans.use: to pay her technical study fees.

loans.name: Nicha Daine

texts.en: Nicha Daine is a 25-year-old woman from the town of Tubigon in Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has nine year old son. Her partner is a company employee while Nicha Daine buys and sells frozen foods. She has been doing this for two years to help her husband in their daily expenses. She is asking a loan to buy frozen foods such as hotdogs, ham, and “tocino” sweetened pork. She dreams in the future to improve her business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy hotdogs, ham, and “tocino” sweetened pork

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en: Esutaquia effectively working  in the bus terminal by selling food and snacks  of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She earns very well and was able to  provide for her needs. Eustaquia has successfully repaid her previous loans. Eustaquia is requesting a loan to buy additional snacks to offer to travelers. She plans to save money to have for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale.

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en:
Antonieto is a 46-year-old man from Ormoc City, Leyte.  He is married with three children ages 13, 17 and 19. As a father he works hard so that he can provide for his children. He has a tailoring business where he accepts repair and orders for uniform and other types of clothing. In addition to this, he also farms rice for a living.
Antonieto is asking a loan to buy cloth, fertilizer for the farm and food for his family like one sack of rice. He plans to expand his business so he can save for old age while supporting the needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy cloth, fertilizer for the farm and one sack of rice

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is 57 years old and married with three children. Fedelina works very hard to provide for them.

Fedelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like home product care, personal product care, and other groceries.

Fedelina has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, sofdrinks, etc.. 

In the future, Fedelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like home product care, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 46 years old, married with two children. One of whom is in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Riza has a general store business in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like personal products, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Riza has been in this business for four years. In the future, Riza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like personal products, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en:
Yasemin is married and has one child. Yasemin is knitting babywear and making souvenirs from felt. She makes them at home by getting orders and sells them. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy threads and felt materials in bulk, to produce more and sell more.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Yasemin hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Yasemin hanım örgüden bebek ürünleri ve keçe işinden hediyelik eşya yapıyor. Yaptığı ürünleri evden sipariş alarak satıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile bir kısmı ile örgü ipi bir kısmı ile de keçe malzemesini toptan alarak ve üreterek satmayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy threads and felt materials

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de celulares,la socia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with the business of selling cell phones. She is a hard-working and enterprising person. Through this business she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy cell phones. She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Florenia

texts.en:
Florenia is 49 years old, married and has six children. Four of her children are enrolled in school.

Florenia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Florenia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Florenia has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne lives in Kaptich village, situated in the Kitale area of Kenya. Most families in Kaptich practice agriculture. Carolyne, and her husband, own a small piece of land in this region. They live together with their lovely children. They have been doing dairy farming for the last six years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk and crop farming.

Carolyne is seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale. As her children grow older, their upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Carolyne needs to boost her cereal selling business. With your loan, she will be able to sell her cereals to both her neighbours and the local market. She will use the additional income from cereal sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees.
With her positive attitude and desire to get ahead, it is evident that Carolyne has an immense will to succeed, and that all she waits for is your kindness to grant her a loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 26 years old and has one child.  Lilibeth is married and has one child who is in school.

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilibeth has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lilibeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
With 6 children to raise, water to fetch, ploughing her farm and food to cook, Helena has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. With the little time Helena has, she sells crops from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. From Kiva lenders, Helena is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES to grow her horticulture business. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Helena access to a loan facility that will aid her to expand her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Helena’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture business.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine, 23 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kiminini, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with one child. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her child, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going child.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her 6 children. Kiva lenders! Linah is 44 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Sinon, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Linah has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past ten years.

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Linah is contented with the farming way of life. Linah is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being an elderly woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Linah feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Linah is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in school. Please help Linah so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her 6 children

loans.name: Arelis Isabel

texts.es: Arelis es una emprendedora de 55 años de edad que  hace 4 años  decidió aceptar el reto que le plantearon sus familiares y se animó a iniciar su propio negocio de postres en donde aprovecha los conocimientos y las fortalezas personales que ha logrado desarrollar durante su vida y generar un ingreso para aportar a los gastos de la familia. Desde la comodidad de su hogar se dedica  a la producción y comercialización de postres  elaborados a partir de productos lácteos y frutas que dan como resultado productos como postre de tres leches,  Napoleón, tentación de café etc. Sus clientes son vecinos y familiares que resaltan la calidad, variedad y economía de sus productos. Actualmente Arelis está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual planea invertir en insumos que le permitan atender la demanda que se genera para la temporada de fin de año que inicia con la celebración del día del amor y la amistad; ella afirma que su actividad de comercial le permite mantenerse activa y sueña con organizar su propio local de repostería.
texts.en:
Arelis is a 55-year-old entrepreneur that decided 4 years ago to accept the challenge that her relatives put forth. She dared to start her own dessert business in which she takes advantage of the knowledge and personal strengths that she has managed to acquire throughout her life in order to earn income to contribute to her household expenses.

From the comfort of her own home, she makes a living making and selling desserts. Her desserts are made from dairy products and fruit which result in desserts such as tres leches, Napoleón, tentación de café, etc. Her customers are neighbors and relatives who appreciate the quality, variety, and affordability of her products.

Currently, Arelis is applying for her first credikiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use the loan to buy supplies that will enable her to meet customer demand for the end of year season which begins with the celebration of the day of love and friendship. She says that her occupation enables her to keep active, and she dreams of starting her own pastry shop.

loans.use: buy supplies that will enable her to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Jaime Ernesto

texts.es:
Jaime, de 27 años de edad, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron la agricultura y la ganadería; estudio hasta bachillerato, su familia se conforma por su esposa y un hijo de 3 años de edad; él se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas.

Jaime, trabaja en las parcelas que alquila durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde ordeña las vacas para que su esposa venda la leche en los alrededores de su comunidad.

Jaime, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras, que le ayudaran a iniciar su negocio de elaboración de lácteos como queso, crema, quesillo, etc. 

Jaime, sueña con poder comprar un vehículo, para ofrecer los productos que elabora junto a su esposa en otros lugares aledaños y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 27, grew up with his parents. They taught him about agriculture and livestock. He went to school through high school. His family is comprised of his wife and a three year old son.

He gets up at 4:30 a.m. together with his wife, who supports him with the agriculture activities and with milking the cows. Jaime works in the morning on land that he rents, and his wife devotes herself to the household chores. In the afternoon he milks the cows in order for his wife to sell the milk in the areas surrounding his community.

Jaime needs the loan to buy two dairy cows. They will help him to start his business of making dairy products like cheese, cream, and soft cheese, etc.

Jaime dreams of being able to buy a vehicle in order to sell the products that he makes with his wife in other outlying areas. This way he will increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, nails, sheet metal, lumber and to pay for the labor costs to repair the sanitation system in her home.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es:
Mario, solicita un nuevo crédito por el buen servicio que recibe y por la necesidad de mantener su negocio, comprara mayor cantidad de cilindros de gas propano de esta manera podrá atender las demandas de sus clientes.
Con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior su negocio ha crecido, su condición económica ha mejorado y su estilo de vida es más confortable.
texts.en:
Mario is asking for a new loan because of the good service he receives and because of the need of maintaining his business. He will buy a larger quantity of propane gas cylinders so that in this way, he can meet the demands of his customers.

With the help of the previous loan, his financial condition has improved, his business has grown, and his lifestyle is more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of propane gas cylinders so that he can meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Cinia Elizabett

texts.es:
Cinia, de 25 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pollos, estudio hasta noveno grado, ella creció con su madre, quien fue la que le enseño esta actividad, su familia está conformada  por su esposo que trabaja en construcción y un hijo de 6 años de edad que va a la escuela.  

Cinia, se dedica a la crianza y comercio de pollos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza en el mercado de la ciudad y en los alrededores de su vivienda. 

Cinia, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, para empezar a producir leche, porque desea venderla entre sus vecinos y en los alrededores de donde vive.

Cinia, sueña con comprar más animales y empezar una producción de lácteos para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cinia, age 25, sells chickens. She went to school through the ninth grade. She grew up with her mother, who taught her this business activity. Her family is comprised of her husband, who works in construction, and a six year old son, who goes to school.

Cinia raises and fattens chickens, and she sells them. She conducts this business in the city market and in the areas surrounding her house. Cinia needs the loan to buy a cow in order to start producing milk. She wishes to sell the milk to her neighbors and in the areas surrounding her house.


Cinia dreams of buying more animals and of starting the production of dairy products in order to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Con 53 años de edad, Elena es una persona muy trabajadora, posee un negocio de pupusas instalado en su vivienda el cual con mucha esfuerzo y dedicación administra para cubrir las necesidades básicas de ella y su esposo. Elena desea mejorar su vivienda lo cual en este caso es específicamente el baño de su casa para lo cual solicita a FUSAI  un crédito para invertirlo en: lámina, hierro, ladrillo, cemento y arena  para elaborar el baño para tener un ambiente más saludable en su vivienda. Elena también muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado con anterioridad el cual utilizó para la compra de mercadería y productos para la elaboración de pupusas, lo cual le ayudó a incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
At fifty-three years old, Elena is a very hardworking person. She owns a pupusa (stuffed tortilla) business that’s set up in her home. She puts in a lot of effort and dedication in order to cover her and her spouse’s basic necessities.

Elena wants to improve her home, in this case specifically the bathroom. She’s requesting a loan from FUSIA to invest in metal sheeting, rebar, brick, cement, and sand to build a bathroom to have a healthier environment in her home.

Elena is also very grateful for her previous loan which she used to buy supplies and products to make pupusas. It helped her increase her income.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting,rebar,brick,cement,and sand to build a bathroom in order to have a healthier environment in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, peppers, carrots, and onions among other vegetables to grow her business and make more profit.

loans.name: Adela Liliana

texts.es: Adela de 24 años de edad, impulsada por el deseo de tener una mejor forma de vida y así de poder sacar adelante a sus dos hijos de 8 y 3 años junto a su acompañante quienes se esfuerzan a diario por ser unos padres ejemplares, administra un negocio de venta de tamales de pollo, frijol y gallina, lo cual le permite tener un ingreso de dinero para sus necesidades básicas. Y es por eso que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, especias, y demás ingredientes que incluye en la elaboración de tamales. Con esto Adela podrá vender más y podrá obtener más ganancia.
texts.en: Adela is 24 years old. She is driven by the desire to have a better standard of living and get her 8 and 3 year old children ahead. She and her spouse strive every day to be exemplary parents. She runs a chicken and bean tamales business. This allows her to have income for her basic needs. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, spices, and other ingredients used to make tamales. With this, Adela will be able to sell more and make more profits.

loans.use: to invest in corn, spices, and other ingredients used to make tamales.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is 32 years old and married.

Ma. Linda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Linda requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Linda has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Linda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children, four of whom are in school.She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from farming sugarcane.

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a rice retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merly dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Yulis Paola

texts.es: Yulis es una  joven emprendedora de 22 años que reside con su cónyuge en un barrio del Soledad y de su unión nació su hijo, un niño de 2 años de edad quien es su motor y motivador para alcanzar los propósitos y metas, uno de ellos fue generar ingresos para su hogar, así que se inclinó por su proyecto de negocio y consideró que el comercio de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños sería una excelente oportunidad; ella estuvo aconsejada por una amiga que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en esta actividad e invirtió sus ahorros en este sueño de prosperidad.  Hoy en día cuenta con 3 años y ha logrado mantenerse con buenos resultados, pues ha encontrado   muchísimas opciones de adquirir ropa al por mayor a precios de oportunidad, que le permite obtener un  buen margen de ganancia. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que piensa invertir en la compra al por mayor de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños, para incrementar su oferta y aprovechar la temporada de fin de año. Su visión para el futuro es organizar su propia tienda de ropa y generar los ingresos suficientes para tener un buen nivel de vida y brindarle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en: Yulis is a 22 year old entrepreneur who lives with her spouse in the neighborhood of Soledad. From her marriage she bore her son, a 2 year old boy who is her motor and her motivator to reach her goals and objectives. One of them was to generate income for her home. So she went toward her business project and decided that the sale of women's, men's and children's clothes was an excellent opportunity. She was advised by a friend who has a lot of experience in this activity and she invested her savings in her dream of prosperity. Today, she has been doing it for 3 years and she has been able to maintain good results. She has found a lot of opportunities of acquiring clothes wholesale at low prices. This allows her to obtain a good profit margin. Right now, she is taking out her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, a loan she is planning on investing in buying women's men's and children's clothes wholesale. This will increase her supply and take advantage of the end of the year season. Her vision for the future is to organize her own clothing store and generate enough income to have a good standard of living and offer her son a good education.

loans.use: to invest in buying women's, men's and children's clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Helen has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of spices to sell.

Helen has been in this business for five years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell.

loans.name: Orbesa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Orbesa works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Orbesa is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her business for her dried fish vending business.

Orbesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn, 62, who is a lovely mother of three children, one married, lives in Phnum Sruoch District, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. So far, for more than ten years she has been involved in a small business which can earn a net profit of USD 5 per day.

During this time, Vorn has been faced with a financial issue in her family but she can’t afford it. She decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy more spices to expand her business to get more income.

Vorn would thank to all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy more spices to expand her business.

loans.name: Eveshell

texts.en:
Eveshell is 48 years old and has eight children. She is married and her eight children are in school.

Eveshell is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Eveshell has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eveshell would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, coffee, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

Marietta dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, coffee, noodles, eggs, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus hijos y su compañero de vida, ella se dedica criar y a vender cerdos y pollos, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta  actividad, por lo que ya cuenta con popularidad y la fidelidad de sus clientes.
Requiere de un financiamiento para comprar cerdos y pollos, fortalecerá el inventario de su negocio para atender las demandas de sus clientes, se siente positiva en que sus ventas y ganancias mejoraran para disminuir las carencias de su hogar.
Sus sueños son mantenerse colaborando para que su familia tenga mejores circunstancias de vida y ser un ejemplo de superación para que sus hijos se conduzcan por los caminos del bien.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her children and partner. She raises pigs and chickens, and has been doing this work for many years, so she has many loyal, satisfied customers.

She needs a loan to buy pigs and chickens, to improve her business's inventory and better serve her customers' needs. She is sure her sales and earnings will improve, helping meet the needs of her household. Her dreams are to keep on working so that her family's circumstances will improve, and be a good example of success for her children so they will stay on the right path.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens, which will improve her business's inventory to meet customer demand

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad es madre soltera y cuenta con muchos años de residir en vivienda propia, vive con su hija de 15 años de edad, a la que siempre está buscando la manera de sacarla adelante. Ana es una persona que busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella hace todo lo posible por lograr satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia y así sacar adelante a su querida hija. Es por ello que Ana solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, blusas, pantalones, calcetines, faldas, y todo tipo de ropa y así obtener mejores ganancias, ya que ese es su medio para sobrevivir y para darle el estudio a su querida hija.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and is a single mother. She has lived in her own house for many years. She lives with her daughter who is fifteen years old and she is always looking for a way to get her ahead.

Ana is a person who looks for a way to improve her quality of living and so she works selling clothing. She does everything she can to satisfy the basic needs of her family and doing this help her beloved daughter. So Ana is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in shirts, blouses, pants, socks, skirts and all types of clothing to obtain greater profit. This is her medium for surviving and providing education for her dear daughter.

loans.use: to invest in shirts, blouses, pants, socks, skirts and all types of clothing to obtain greater profit.

loans.name: Dominga Izabel

texts.es: Dominga de 40 años de edad es madre soltera quien vive al lado de su familia la cual está conformada por dos hijas, una de 18 años y la otra de 8 años de edad, y su padre de 77 años de edad a quienes logra sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su negocio de ventas de tortillas, pupusas y platillos típicos. Y es gracias a este pequeño negocio que Dominga logra satisfacer las necesidades básicas de ella y de su familia, es por ello que Dominga solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, especias, frijol, queso, chicharrón, tomates, repollo y todo lo necesario para mantener su negocio de  venta de pupusas y poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
40-year old Dominga is a single mother who lives with her two daughters aged 18 and 8 and her 77-year old father. She works hard to support them all through her business selling tortillas, pupusas, and other local dishes. It is thanks to this business that Dominga manages to satisfy her own and her family's basic needs.

Dominga is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy maize, spices, beans, cheese, pork crackling, tomatoes, cabbage--all that is necessary to run her food business and slowly improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy maize, spices, beans, cheese, pork crackling, tomatoes, cabbage etc. for her food stall

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 32-year-old, married mother of two children, who has been running her clothes selling business for three years from her house, to help her husband in covering their family's living needs and expenses.

Today, Hiba is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of autumn and winter clothes for the upcoming season.

She is working hard to expand her business in the future, to increase her income, and to improve her family's living conditions.
She hopes to open her own separate clothes selling shop.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of autumn and winter clothes.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 63 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su hijo de 22 años y un nieto de 5 años de edad a los que siempre busca apoyar. María logra satisfacer sus necesidades básicas con la venta de ropa, y es por lo que María decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, faldas, blusas, pantalones y de todo tipo de ropa para su negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad y estilo en sus productos, y así maximizar sus ingresos económicos y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 63 years old. She is a single mother who lives with her 22 year old son and a 5 year old granddaughter whom she is always trying to support. María manages to satisfy her basic needs by selling clothing. It is for this reason that María decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in shirts, skirts, blouses, pants and all types of clothing for her business to offer greater variety and styles in her products. Doing this she can maximize her economic income and in this way improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of shirts, skirts, blouses, pants and all types of clothing for her business to offer greater variety.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Emmy is an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 43 years of age. She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Emmy’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming.

She faces financial challenges, but the Kapsowar area has proven a ready market for sheep farming, so she is requesting a loan to buy a sheep. Through the loan she plans to buy a merino sheep. Merinos are regarded as having some of the finest and softest wool of any sheep. Through the loan she will increase her income from wool and meat selling. She will also benefit from the manure, which will increase the fertility level of her farm.
She counts on help from Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of sheep.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, es soltera y no tiene hijos bajo su responsabilidad, vive en casa de un familiar, no cuenta con más ingresos para subsistir que los que ella misma genera vendiendo perfumería y cosméticos, trabaja de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Con el crédito tendrá las posibilidades de invertir en el negocio, comprara lociones, cremas corporales, cosméticos, etc., tendrá suficiente producto para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, pretende incrementar sus ventas e ingresos.
Sus objetivos son resarcir su deuda y tener el sustento diario.
texts.en:
María is single and doesn't have any children. She lives with her family and has no income apart from what she earns selling perfume and cosmetics. She works from 7 am to 5 pm.

With the loan money she will have the opportunity to invest in her business by buying lotions, creams, cosmetics etc. Then she will have enough products to satisfy the needs of her customers and be able to increase sales and income.

Her goal is to pay off her loan and have money for daily living expenses.

loans.use: buy lotions, creams, cosmetics etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 43-year-old married woman with thirteen children, four of whom are in school.

She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Myrna has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Myrna requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a 49-year-old married woman with six children, one who is currently in school.

Celia is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Celia has been in this business for 7 years. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Celia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with three children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES(Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.
You can help this mother with a loan and let her be closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Eleminah

texts.en:
“When smallholder farmers come together, they are powerful,” says Eleminah, a 36-year-old farmer who has three children and lives in the village of Mwaita in the Kitale area of Kenya. For the past three years she has been actively involved in mixed farming.

She has been practicing crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Eleminah is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Emerciana

texts.en:
Emerciana is 66 years old and married with six children. Emerciana works very hard to provide for them.

Emerciana has run a general store in the Philippines for one year. She has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for the store, such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, beer, candies, and biscuits.

Emerciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store, such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, beer, candies, and biscuits.

loans.name: Irma Argelia

texts.es: A sus 48 años de edad Irma muestra cada día sus deseos de superación ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito con el cual reconstruyo la parte delantera de su vivienda, en la que vive junto a sus dos hijas de 12 y 17 años de edad. Irma se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias para dama en su vivienda, además los fines de semana vende pupusas, lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Irma desea continuar mejorando su vivienda, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para continuar las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
At 48 years old Irma demonstrates her desire to improve every day. Previously she requested a loan which she used to reconstruct the back part of her house where she lives with her two daughters aged 12 and 17 years old.

Irma works selling clothing and sandals for women from her house and on weekends she sells pupusas which allows her to make greater economic income. Irma wants to continue to improve her house. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel and pay for labor to continue the improvements on her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and pay for labor to continue the improvements on her house.

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es:
Martha, de 71 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, está soltera y vive con 3 nietos y solo ellos viven en casa.

Martha, siembra maíz y tiene 2 vaquitas, ella se ha dedicado desde que tenía 15 años de edad a la agricultura, ella aprendió a cultivar porque sus padres eran agricultores, antes ella trabajaba como empleada doméstica, hoy por su edad y porque tiene que cuidar a sus nietos, solo cultiva maíz y tiene sus 2 vaquitas; la parcela donde siembra está 1 kilómetro de su vivienda y ella paga para que le cultiven el maíz, sus nietos también le colaboran.
 
Martha, necesita el préstamo para comprar un novilla que le están vendiendo en buen precio.

El sueño de Martha, es poder mejorar su pequeña vivienda porque es de barro y ella quisiera construirla de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Martha, 71 years old, did not go to school. She is single and lives with 3 grandchildren; only they live in the house

Martha plants corn and has two small cows. She has worked since the age of 15 in agriculture; she learned to farm because her parents were farmers. Before that, she worked as a housekeeper. Today because of her age and because she has to care for her grandchildren, she only farms corn and has her two small cows. The plot where she plants is 1 kilometer from her home and she pays others to farm the corn. Her grandchildren also contribute [to this.]

Martha needs the loan to buy a heifer that is being sold at a good price.

Martha's dream is to be able to improve her small home because it is made of clay and she wants to construct it of bricks.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Meet Gladys, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 52 years of age!

She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is a proud mother. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Gladys' primary sources of income have come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming.

This humble mum has been making profits, but not everything has been a bed of roses. She still faces financial challenges.

Because the Kapsowar area has proven a ready market for sheep farming, she is requesting a loan to buy a sheep. Through the loan she plans to buy a merino sheep. Merinos are regarded as having some of the finest and softest wool of any sheep. Through the loan she will increase her income from wool and meat selling. She will also benefit from the manure, which will increase the fertility level of her farm.

She has many dreams, but her main one is to improve her economic situation to provide her family with basic commodities.

She counts on help from Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of sheep

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 31 год, замужем, 4 детей. У Венеры среднее образование, на протяжении 6 лет активно занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Венеры есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, 5 коз. Она очень трудолюбивая, ответственная и целеустремленная. Также занимается торговлей в арендованном павильоне. Ежемесячный доход около 29,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Venera is 31 years old, married, and has 4 children. Venera has a secondary education, and over the past 6 years has worked actively in animal husbandry. Today, Venera has 2 cows, 10 sheep and 5 goats on her farm. She is very hard-working, responsible and goal-orientated.
She also runs a market stall. Her monthly income is around 29,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, she turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow in order to sell organic milk. With income from the loan, Venera plans to invest in the further development of her business and in the construction of a shed for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow for selling organic milk

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Rose, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Kericho area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley.

The adversity that has followed her hasn't kept her from wanting to get ahead and reach her goals. She achieves what she sets out to do.

Rose has been farming for the past seven years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, tea farming and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet.

Rose is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although Rose makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

Kenya's Kericho area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that she could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.
