Accessing funds has been a challenge for Rose, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Rose believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Rose to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

With your support this woman will be able to make her dreams a reality. Get motivated and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereal for resale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam de 61 años es residente en Malambo un municipio del departamento del Atlántico y ha sido comerciante durante toda su vida; anteriormente administraba una tienda escolar y desde  hace 15 años se dedica a la comercialización de productos lácteos como leche, suero, yogurt, avenas entre otros productos de la misma categoría. Estos productos generalmente se encuentran dentro de la dieta de cualquier persona y están acorde a su nivel adquisitivo, sus clientes son vecinos, amigos y familiares a quienes atiende en su casa en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. Ella está dichosa de realizar esta actividad comercial con la que puede trabajar desde su vivienda y tener un flujo económico aceptable con la posibilidad de dedicar más tiempo a los quehaceres domésticos. Actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en un mayor inventario de leche, yogurt, suero, avenas y demás productos que le permitan incrementar sus ventas y por lo tanto sus utilidades. Miriam es viuda y su negocio es su medio de supervivencia por ello su meta es mejorar la imagen de su negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam, 61 years old, is a resident of Malambo, a town of the Atlántico department, and has been a businesswoman for all of her life. Previously, she administrated a school store and for the last 15 years she has worked in the market of dairy products like milk, cream cheese, yogurt, and oats, among other products in the same category. These products are generally found in the diet of any person and are commensurate with their purchasing power. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, and acquaintances, who she attends in her house from 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. She is happy to have accomplished this commercial business with which she can work from her home and have an acceptable flow of money with the possibility of dedicating more time to household chores.

Currently she is processing her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, resources that she plans to invest in a larger inventory of milk, yogurt, cream cheese, oats, and other product that allow her to increase her sales and therefore her profits.

Miriam is a widow and her business is her means of survival, so her goal is to improve the image of her business and her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a larger inventory of milk, yogurt, cream cheese, oats, and other products.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Hello world, meet an amazing woman by the name of Lydia. She is a smallholder farmer based in Tot village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is married to Robert, whom she has been together with for almost a decade. She has three children who commute to school from home every school day.

Lydia has been practicing livestock farming for seven years to help her husband cover family expenses. She has managed to raise cows and poultry on the farm. She also makes extra money doing a side hustle business.

Lydia is seeking a loan to restock her cereals business. She plans to use your money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets, where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred plus profit.

Lydia is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hardworking and financially disciplined. Returns from the investment will change her life, as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her children's education.

To do this she is counting on the lenders on the Kiva website.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Buenaventura Del Carmen

texts.es:
Buenaventura, vive con dos hijos, actualmente es soltera, su negocio es la venta de pupusas y es propietaria de una tienda de producto de primera necesidad, calzado y otros articulos varios, abre su negocio a las ocho de la mañana y lo cierra a las ocho de la noche, aprendió el negocio sola, su negocio ha ido mejorando conforme ha pasado el tiempo, su ventaja es la buena ubicación.
Está necesitando de un crédito para comprar granos básicos, bebidas, pan, huevos, aceite, etc., para surtir la tienda, también invertirá en harina, quesillo, entre otros materiales para la venta de pupusas, podrá atender las demandas que hacen sus clientes y mejorar sus utilidades.
Sus sueños son dar a sus clientes mejor calidad en sus productos y abrir otro punto de atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Buenaventura lives with two children. Currently she is single. Her business is selling pupusas and she is the owner of a store selling basic goods, footwear, and other various items. She opens her business at eight in the morning and closes it at eight at night. She learned business on her own, her business has been improving as time has passed. Her advantage is the good location [of the store.]

She is in need of a loan to buy basic grains, beverages, bread, eggs, oil, etc. to stock the store, as well as to invest in flour, cheese, and other materials for the sale of pupusas. She will be able to attend to the demands her customers make and improve her profits.

Her dreams are to give her customers a better quality in her products and to open another point of attention to her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, beverages, bread, eggs, oil, etc. to stock the store, as well as to invest in flour, cheese, and other materials for the sale of pupusas.

loans.name: Jasur

texts.ru: Часур, молодой спортивный мужчина в возрасте  25 лет. Он женат и имеет двое замечательных детей. Он работает в   водителем маршрутки.Он хорошо зарабатывает на свою семью. Хотя они не живут в роскоши но у них нормальная, обычная жизнь. Его жена  не жалуется, а наоборот  поддерживает его во всем. Часур очень внимательный и заботливый отец. Он каждый день после работы занимается со своими детьми.  Он очень хочет чтобы его дети выросли образованными людьми. Он всегда мечтал быть образованным и работать где то в  престижном офисе, но он не доучился, поэтому хочет чтобы его дети были образованными.  Сейчас у него сломалась машина и его надо ремонтировать. Ведь это единственный источник дохода в его семье.  Для этого ему нужны деньги поэтому он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Заранее благодарен Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Jasur is a young, active, 25 year old man. He is married, with two wonderful children. He works as a bus driver, and although they don't live in luxury, he earns a good income for his family, and they lead a normal life. His wife doesn't complain - the opposite; she supports him with everything. Jasur is a very attentive and caring father. Every day after work, he plays with his children. He wants very much for his children to grow up to be educated people. He always dreamt of being educated himself, and of working in a prestigious office somewhere, but he did not finish his studies, therefore he wants his children to be educated.
Now his car has broken and needs repairing. It's really the only source of income for his family. To do this, he needs money, and turned to Arvand for a loan. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support!

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Al Faras Group

texts.en:
Kamela is the featured borrower of Al Faras Group. She joined with her other group members to take out this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living standards at the same time.

Kamela is a 27-year-old single lady, who has been employed in a company for seven years and working hard to support her parents and develop their living.
She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to start her own clothes and cosmetics selling business from her house, as an additional income business.
Kamela is working hard that in the future she will develop and expand her business through opening a separate private shop.

Kamela is the lady at the far left side of the picture, Sobhiya is at the center, while Zainab is at the far right side.

loans.use: to start her own clothes and cosmetics selling business from her house, as an additional income business.

loans.name: We Believe - N09Tsơn1Psơn Group

texts.en:
Ms Đào is 53 years old and she is a widow with 2 children. She has been operating a food stall selling sticky rice for more than 10 years.
Đào lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to cover the life cost and take care for her family.

The main hardship that Đào faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for cooking and selling sticky rice.

In 2012, Đào joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Đào has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of "We believe - N09TSơn1PSơn", which consists of 3 members.
In the future, Đào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cooking and selling sticky rice.

loans.name: Premetiva

texts.en:
61-year-old Premetiva is a Sari-sari store owner from the community of Ormoc City, in Leyte. She is married and her husband is a farmer.

Premetiva has been selling basic items to the community for five years now. She displays on her shelves, candies, biscuits, bubble gums, cooking oil, chips, spices, detergent and shampoo. She is asking a loan to increase her inventory and to attract more customers. She will use it to buy biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, vinegar, chips, soft drinks, shampoo and bath soap. Premetiva knows how a store that looks full attract more buyers than the ones that lack displays. She plans to make her store bigger for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, vinegar, chips, soft drinks, shampoo and bath soap

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 64 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell tobacco in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of tobacco to sell.

Maura has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell tobacco for 14 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and general store.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухарам женщина 37 лет. Она  замужем и имеет 3  детей.  Она с раннего возраста была приучена к труду. Она работает швеёй. Она шьёт национальные платья и у неё много клиентов. Её муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Он работает строителем. Она всегда мечтала дать своим детям достойное образование и старается делать всё возможное чтобы её дети этого достигли и стали образованными людьми. В этом году её её сын поступил в университет. Для оплаты договора обучение у неё не хватает нужной суммы. Сейчас сын Мухарам поступил в университет, и они должны оплатить обучение за первый год его обучения там. Но у Мухарам на сегодня не имеется такой большой суммы, чтобы сразу заплатить. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд, где узнала что есть возможность получить кредит на образование. Мухарам желает получить кредит для оплаты обучения своего сына. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Muharam is a 37 year old woman. She is married with 3 children. She has worked hard ever since she was little. She works as a seamstress; she sews the national dress and has many clients.
Her husband emigrated to work in Russia, and works as a builder.
She always dreamt of giving her children a great education and tries to do everything possible in order that her children achieve this, and become educated people. This year, her son began studying at university, but she doesn't have enough money to pay the fees. They have to pay for his first year of study there, but she does not have enough money to pay the full amount straight away. She therefore turned to Arvand, where she found out it was possible to get a loan for education. She hopes very much for a positive outcome, and thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina  is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina  is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Gina  has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. Gina  requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers.

Gina  has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Gina  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sara Ruth

texts.es:
Sara vive con su esposo y dos nietos de 12 y 18 años de edad, ellos son dependientes y tiene ayuda económica de parientes, cuando se encontraba soltera y vivía con su familia ella aprendió a elaborar tortillas, en la actualidad es una forma de obtener ingresos para colaborar en los gastos de su propia familia, con su experiencia hace dos años inicio a vender tortillas en un horario de cinco de la mañana a doce del mediodía.
Invertirá en maíz al mayoreo para ahorrar en la compra y tener margen de ganancias superior, tendrá materia prima para que la producción de tortillas sea suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
Sara sueña con mantener su negocio con actividad para que sus nietos pueden culminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Sara lives with her husband and two grandchildren who are aged 12 and 18. They are dependent on her and she gets financial support from relatives. When she was single and living with her family she learned to make tortillas. With her experience she started selling tortillas two years ago from 5am to 12:00 noon and now it is a way to earn income and help out with her own family expenses.

She will buy wholesale corn in order to save on costs and have higher profit margins. By having the raw material for the production of tortillas she will be able to produce enough tortillas to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Sara dreams of maintaining a prosperous business in order that her grandchildren can finish university.

loans.use: buy wholesale corn in order to save on costs and have higher profit margins.

loans.name: Norma Lila

texts.es: Doña Norma, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro con dos hijas y su ex suegra. Ella se dedica a la producción de grano de arroz desde hace 13 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida para obtener ingresos y darles manutención a sus hijos. Ya ha solicitado varios préstamos a la institución para invertirlos en sus actividades que le han generado ingresos. Actualmente está solicitando otro préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de abonos, insecticidas, fungicidas y urea para aplicar a su cultivo de arroz. Su préstamo le ayudará para prevenir cualquier ataque de plagas a su cultivo, y para que su cosecha sea mejor al fertilizar. Tiene como metas, mejorar los ingresos para la familia y que su negocio siga activo por varias temporadas.
texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old, a single mother of 3 children, and lives in the municipality of Negrito. She lives with her two daughters and ex mother-in-law. She has made a living producing rice for 13 years. Before that, she sold food to obtain income and support her children.

She has requested various loans to invest in her activities that have generated income. Currently she is requesting another loan for the quantity of 5,000 lempiras which she plans to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, insecticides, fungicides, and urea to apply to her cultivation of rice. Her loan will help to prevent attacks from pests to her cultivation and fertilizer will help improve her harvest.

Her goals are to improve her family income and that her business stays active for many seasons.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, fungicide, and urea to apply in her cultivation of rice.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
Шоира доброжелательная и молодая женщина, ей 42 года. Она замужем, у неё 3 детей.   
Шоира живет вместе со своей семьёй  в городе Душанбе, она  работает в детском садике. Весь её заработок расходуется на содержание семьи. У неё нет возможности накопить денег и заплатить за обучение сына сразу за год, но Шоира должна оплачивать за учебу сына, для этого она  обратился в ООО МДО Арванд за получением кредита с целью оплаты за учебу. Она очень благодарна ООО МДО "Арванд" за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Shoira is a young and benevolent woman. She is 42, and married with 3 children.

Shoira lives with her family in the city of Dushanbe, and works in a kindergarten. All of her earnings are spent supporting her family. She doesn't have the opportunity to save money, and pays for her son's studies once a year. As Shoira must pay for her son's studies, she turned to OOO MDO Arvand for a loan, in order to cover the costs. She is very grateful to OOO MDO Arvand for their support and confidence.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married and has 10 children. She is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, poultry and crop farming to provide for her family. She enjoys what she does, and it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

In the Kitale area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge, however, is the huge lack of access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo, though, has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya so that farmers in Kitale can now buy vital inputs for use on their farms.

Gladys is seeking a 40,000 KES loan to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity. This will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, give her income to repay her loan and elevate her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
As a farmer, Sophy, who is 29 years old woman with one child, can only make USD10 per day to support her family. Sophy is residing in a rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been a farmer for 9 years.

Sophy would like to get a low interest loan from Kiva now in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan since it will promote her health, environment and living standard. Sophy would like to thank all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cyclone sheets, poles, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es: Vilma es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y niños, actividad que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo. Vilma es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de 4 años de edad y su madre que es una persona que mayor a la que apoya en su vejez. Vilma desea construir un muro en la entrada principal de su vivienda, ya que desea brindar mayor seguridad a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared frente a su vivienda, de esta manera cuidar la seguridad de su familia y su hogar.
texts.en: Vilma is a hardworking woman who sells women's and children's clothing, which she has been doing for a long time.  Vilma is a single mother and lives with her 4-year-old son and her mother is a senior whom she is caring for in her old age.  Vilma wants to build a wall at the main entrance to her home because she wants to provide her family with more security, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and rebar to build a wall in front of her home that will ensure the safety of her family and home.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and rebar to build a wall in front of her home.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
As a farmer, Khom, who is 40 years old woman, can only make USD7 per day to support her family. Khom is residing in a rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has three children, of whom one of them is married. She has been a farmer for 20 years.

Khom would like to get a low interest loan from Kiva, now in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will increase her health, environment and living standard. Khom would like to thank all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia es una microempresaria Barranquillera de 51 años de edad, madre de 6 hijos y dedicada a la venta por catálogos. Ella trabajó durante 20 años como empleada del servicio doméstico, pero por la necesidad de dedicar más tiempo a su familia, decidió hace 5 años trabajar de manera independiente y escogió la opción de venta por catálogo. Ella vende a vecinos, familiares y amigos, cosméticos, perfumes y productos para el hogar, los cuales promociona a través de visitas a sus clientes. Dionicia está gestionado con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo su primer credikiva el cual proyecta invertir en un mayor surtido de cosméticos, perfumes y productos para el hogar que le ayuden a incrementar sus ventas. Su visión para el futuro es que con  buena disposición e interés su negocio continuará creciendo y le generará unas utilidades con las cuales pueda a largo plazo adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Dionicia is a small businesswoman from Baranquilla. She is 51 years old and has six children. Dionicia makes a living from catalogue sales.

Dionicia worked for 20 years as a domestic worker, but five years ago, in order to dedicate more time to her family, she decided to turn to independent work and chose catalogue sales. Dionicia sells to her neighbours, family members and friends: cosmetics, perfume and household products, which she promotes by visiting her customers.

Dionicia has joined the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her first Kiva loan, which she plans to use to purchase a wider array of cosmetics, perfumes and household products, which will help her to increase her sales.

Dionicia's vision for the future is that through her motivation and hard work her business will continue to grow and generate enough money so that over time it will be possible for Dionicia to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase a wider array of cosmetics, perfumes and household products

loans.name: Alta Vista Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Alta Vista está en su 1° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y es por ello que se unieron, además trabajan dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza,  luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Cada una de las integrantes de este grupo se esfuerza para poder crecer y mejorar, pero entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Mirian, quien se dedica a vender prendas variadas, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y darles una vida digna. Ella comenta que ya es conocida y que tiene muy buena clientela, hace sus ventas ambulantes y sueña con poder tener algún día su propio local.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas variadas, como ser: remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo sus ventas y cumplir con sus clientes y con sus pedidos. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar y crecer.
texts.en:
This is the Alta Vista Group and it is in its first loan cycle with the women's communal bank program. They are very selfless women who want to improve their living conditions, which is why they got together. They are also working within the poverty eradication program, fighting to improve their living conditions.

Each of the members of this group is making an effort to grow and improve, but Mirian stands out among them. She sells various articles of clothing and her sales provide her with the means to help her loved ones and give them a respectable life. She tells us that she is already known and that she has a good clientele. She does her selling on foot and she dreams of one day having her own shop.

She is requesting this loan to buy different kinds of clothing, such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, and more, which will allow her to keep making her sales and fulfilling her customers' orders and demands. They are thankful for the opportunity they have received to improve and grow.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, and more.

loans.name: Anis

texts.en:
Mrs Anis is the mother of 3 child and lives in Krembung Sidoarjo Regency on Java Island in Indonesia one of the most populous places in the world.

In Indonesia, like in many other developing nations, you need to treat water before you can drink it. For that reason, most inhabitants of Indonesians boil the water before they drink it. Or, if they have they money, they buy bottled water. At a community gathering, where the outreach team from Nazava was invited, Mrs Anis learnt about an easier and better way of getting safe drinking water. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs Anis, who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This is the second time Mrs Anis applies for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.
This loan will allow Mrs Anis to buy 50 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 250 people.

loans.use: to purchase 50 water purifiers to sell to her community members providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Esther, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 36-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of her family, with a husband and one child, she farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Thika, in the central region of Kenya. For the past five years, she has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop selling. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming.

Esther passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and another quality breed of dairy cow. The dairy unit will assist Esther in managing her cows well and also protecting them from the harsh weather conditions. Esther also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 Kenya shillings per liter and through this loan she will be making more money.

Before Esther joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, she considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, Esther now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the “millionaires club”. With the loan, Esther will increase her income from milk selling and her cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Esther will achieve this.

An increase in income will allow Esther to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Esther fears that her dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide their reliable market channel, credit facility and services that she requires to grow her dairy enterprise.

You can help Esther to be closer to her goals, and a loan will do that.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit and buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy different kinds of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Manare

texts.en: Manare is a 29-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her only child still studying. She is a housewife and her husband represents the main income source to be able to enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help him continue his education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Gülbahar

texts.en:
Gülbahar is married and a mother of two. She is making Mantı (Turkish ravioli) pasta and Börek (pastry filled with thin layers of food) at home and then sells them from home. With the help of the loan from MAYA, she is planning to buy flour, eggs and meat in bulk, to make more money and improve her business.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Gülbahar hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Mantı, makarna ve börek yapıyor. Yaptığı ürünleri evden sipariş alarak satıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile mantı ve makarna malzemesi olan un, yumurta ve et toptan alarak üreterek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor,

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and meat for preparation of Manti, a traditional Turkish ravioli.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Roselyn works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Roselyn is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gricelda Magdalena

texts.es:
Gricelda, de 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido a la falta de recursos económicos que tenía su familia, está acompañada y tiene tres hijos.

Gricelda, se dedica al los oficios domésticos y junto a su pareja cultivan 7,00 metros cuadrados de maíz y 14,000 metros cuadrados de frijoles; desde muy pequeña aprendió los trabajos de la agricultura, porque ayudaba a su padre en los trabajos agrícolas.

El crédito será invertido para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos sembrados, con esto espera obtener más redimiendo en sus cosechas y tener mejores ingresos.

Gricelda, sueña con seguir trabajando junto a su pareja y a futuro construir un horno para hacer pan y comercializarlo en su comunidad para tener ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Gricelda, who is 46 years old, did not have the opportunity to go to school due to her family's lack of financial resources. She has a partner and three children.

Gricelda takes care of the household chores and together with her partner, they cultivate 700 square meters of corn and 14,000 square meters of beans. She learned about farming at a very young age because she used to help her father with the agricultural work.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of manure and fertilizer for their cultivated fields. With this, they expect to improve their agricultural yield as well as their income.

Gricelda dreams of continuing to work with her partner and in the future, building an oven where they can bake bread and sell it in their community to obtain additional income.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers for her cultivated fields.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona alejada de la capital del país, de difícil acceso, y con escaso acceso a ciertos servicios. Las integrantes se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y también la de sus familias.
La Señora Liboria,  es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para poder crecer en lo que hace y para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de ese trabajo. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes que todos los días van a su negocio, y que gracias a ello le está yendo muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo, quiere comprar frutas, verduras, lácteos, panificados, embutidos y otros, y de esa forma poner tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the city of Curuguaty, an area far removed from the country’s capital which is difficult to access and has limited access to certain services. The members came together in order to be able to improve the living conditions of themselves and of their families.

Mrs. Liboria is one of the members of this group. She has a small grocery store in which she works every day from the early hours of the day to very late at night. She is a very hardworking woman who through this work strives to grow what she has and be able to help her loved ones. She says that she has a lot of customers every day coming to her business, and thanks to them it’s going very well.

She requests this loan to be able to buy goods for her store, that way she can continue working. She wants to buy fruit, vegetables, dairy products, bread products, sausage, and other things so that she can have a good variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, dairy products, bread products, sausage, and other items to sell in a grocery store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old and married with four children. With two of her children currently in school, Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Rosemarie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, soft drinks, cereals, detergent soap, etc.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yonis

texts.es:
Yonis, está solicitando un nuevo crédito por los resultados positivos que estos le dan, en esta oportunidad lo utilizara para comprar más variedad de pan para salir a vender y reparara la bicicleta en la que realiza sus recorridos, espera contar con todo lo necesario para seguir trabajando y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
La ayuda del crédito anterior le ha permitido tener mejores cosechas, mayores ventas e ingresos, sus clientes están satisfechos, su grupo familiar ha crecido y hoy ya tiene otro rubro que es la venta de pan para tener nuevos ingresos, no tiene limitantes para realizar los trabajos de agricultura y la venta de pan.
texts.en:
Yonis is requesting a new loan because of the positive results that these loans give him. This time he will use the loan to buy a greater variety of bread to go out and sell so that he can repair the bicycle with which he makes his rounds. He hopes to have everything he needs to keep working and meet his customers' needs.

The support from the previous loan has allowed him to have better harvests, greater sales and income and satisfied customers. His family has grown and he now has another job which is selling bread for additional income. He does not have any limiting factors that will keep him from doing both his agricultural work and the sale of bread.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of bread.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Always there is a reason to smile, but today Millicent (pictured above with two of her children) has a big reason, and it is that she is only one step away from being able to start her own cereal selling business, thanks to Juhudi Kilimo and the Kiva lenders.

Millicent is an amazing woman who is a smallholder farmer based in Simteret village in the Nandi Hills, Kenya. She is married to her handsome hubby, Emmanuel, with whom she has been together for almost a decade. She has three children who commute to school from home every school day. Millicent has been practicing livestock farming for ten years to help her husband cover family expenses. She has managed to raise cows and poultry on the farm.

Millicent is seeking a loan to stock her cereals business. She plans to use the money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets, where she will sell at prices high enough to cater for all the expenses incurred plus profit. Millicent is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hardworking and financially disciplined.

Returns from the investment will change her life, as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Erwin Alexis

texts.es:
Erwin es un hombre de treinta y siete años de edad, que día a día se entrega a sus plantaciones de café. Junto a su esposa, trabajan duro para sacar adelante las cosechas, gracias a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, logro sacar adelante su última cosecha y venderla a un buen precio, con las ganancias que obtuvo pudo mejorar la infraestructura de su casa de habitación. 
Él está muy agradecido y confía plenamente en ambas organizaciones, es por esta razon que solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar abono, pesticidas y otros insumos que necesita antes de cortar el café de las plantas. En un futuro desea poner una tienda donde venda café en semilla y molido, el se esfuerza en sacar su negocio adelante para poder mejorar la calidad de vida a sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Erwin is a 37-year-old man, who day after day devotes himself to his coffee crops. He and his wife work hard to go forward with their crops. Thanks to a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito, he succeeded in going forward with his last crop and sold it at a good price. With the earnings that he got, he was able to improve the infrastructure of his home.

He is very thankful and trusts completely in both organizations. For this reason, he requests a loan that will allow him to buy manure, pesticides, and other supplies that he needs before cutting the coffee from his plants.

In the future, he wants to start a store where he sells coffee beans and ground coffee. He makes an effort in taking his business forward so that he can improve the quality of life for his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Emerito

texts.es:
El Sr. Emérito tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, comenta que desde los 17 años empezó a trabajar como guarda en un transporte de pasajeros. Luego de mucho tiempo logró juntar una buena cantidad de dinero y con la ayuda de un amigo logró comprarse para su propio transporte de pasajero, que hoy en día ya trabaja por su cuenta. 
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la reparación de su transporte de pasajeros, y de esa forma poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mr. Emérito is 35 years old, is single, and lives in the city of Carapeguá. He says that 17 years ago, he started to work as a guard on a passenger bus. After a long time, he succeeded in putting together a good amount of money and, with the help of a friend, succeeded in buying his own bus. Today, he still works for himself.

Now, he asks for this loan so that he can invest in repairing his bus. In this way, he will be able to offer good service to his clients. He is thankful for the opportunity that he receives to continue working.

loans.use: repair his bus.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José de 45 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 18 años de edad a los que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante. José desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida prestando sus servicios de carpintero, lo cual le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, por lo que se siente muy feliz. La vivienda en la que vive José no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en: alambre eléctrico, toma corriente, caja térmica, entre otros productos necesarios para la instalación de energía eléctrica.
texts.en: José is 45 years old and lives in his own home along with his life partner and his two children who are 16 and 18 years old. He is always looking for ways to support them. From a young age, José learned to make a living as a carpenter which allows him to economically support his home--this makes him very happy. The house in which José lives in does not have electricity which is why he is requesting a loan with FUSAI which will allow him to invest in electrical wire, outlets, a fuse box and other products necessary to install electricity.

loans.use: to buy electrical wire, outlets, a fuse box and other products needed to install electricity.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Antonia has been in this business for 31 years. Antonia earns more income from raising pigs.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 56 years old and widowed with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Melva has a buy and sell of oysters business in the Philippines. Melva requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy oysters to sell.

Melva has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Melva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy oysters to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Teodora requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Teodora has been in this business for four years now.

Teodora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucia is 55 years old and one of her children is in school.

Lucia has a buy and sell of firewood business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Lenegene

texts.en:
Lenegene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lenegene is 38 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Lenegene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

Lenegene has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like manure, fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Divina is 46 years old now.

Divina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Divina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Divina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rosela requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rosela has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Rosela would like to save money for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.en:
Maria Delia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria Delia dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mardonia

texts.en:
Mardonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mardonia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Mardonia has been in this business for three years now.

Mardonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jairo Del Cristo

texts.es: Jairo de 52 años es habitante de Barranquilla un municipio del departamento del Atlántico reconocido por la calidez de su gente y su riqueza cultural.  Jairo encontró en el negocio de los alimentos la opción para desarrollar su capacidad emprendedora y con su experiencia de 15 años como empleado de restaurantes y pizzerías, decidió hace un año invertir sus ahorros en adquirir los equipos que requería para organizar un punto de venta de comidas rápidas en donde ofrece a vecinos y transeúntes, perros calientes, hamburguesas, pollo asado, salchipapas, pizzas y demás. Jairo está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que proyecta invertir en la compra de carnes, pollos y víveres al por mayor, con el fin de incrementar su oferta y mejorar sus ventas y sus utilidades. Su visión para su negocio es la de crecer gradualmente y llegar a formalizar su restaurante, tener su local propio, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y adquirir casa propia.
texts.en:
Jairo is 52 years old and lives in Barranquilla, a municipality in the department of Atlántico which is known for the warmth of its people and its cultural riches. Jairo found in the food business the option to develop his entrepreneurial skills. With his 15 years of experience as an employee of restaurants and pizzerias, a year ago he decided to invest his savings in buying the necessary equipment to open a fast food place where he offers neighbors and passersby hot dogs, hamburgers, grilled chicken, salchipapas (potato and sausage dish), pizzas and other items.

Jairo is requesting his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which he plans to invest in buying meats, chickens and supplies wholesale with the goal of increasing his offerings and improving his sales and profits. His vision for his business is that it will grow gradually and he will be able to formalize his restaurant, have his own premises, improve his family's quality of life and buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy meats, chickens and supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 53 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like biscuits, candies, juice, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Marina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, juice, soft drinks, etc.

In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like biscuits, candies, juice, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joy is 36 years old now.

Joy has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

Joy has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Joy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, vegetables, and spices

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 49 years old and married with two children. For the past three years she has been raising and selling pigs to earn an income in the Philippines.

Antonieta has taken out and successfully repaid five previous loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working so as to provide her family with a stable future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Asociacion De Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Asociacion de Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 2, es un grupo que está empezando con las capacitaciones y el trabajo en grupo, ellas quieren mejorar sus vidas y es por ello que se unieron a este grupo, ya que quieren mejorar cada día.
La señora Silvana es una de las que integra este grupo, ella ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con una peluquería que tiene en su casa. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, que está luchando y se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Silvana pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser gel, shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su buen servicio para sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Asociacion de Mujeres Emprendedoras ("Association of Female Entrepreneurs") is in its second loan cycle. It is a group that is starting with the training and work of the group. The women want to improve their lives, and for this reason, they came together to form the group, since they want to improve everyday.

Mrs. Silvana is one of the members of this group. She helps with the sustenance of her family with a hair salon that she has in her house. She is a very enterprising woman, who is fighting and makes an effort to go forward and improve the conditions of her life and that of her loved ones.

Silvana asks for this loan to be able to buy supplies for her hair salon, such as gel, shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams, and other things. In this way, she will be able to continue offering good service to her clients. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to improve her service for her clients.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a hair salon, such as gel, shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams, and other things.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 27 years old and single. For the past five years she has fished to earn an income in the Philippines.

Chona has applied for a 18,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She works hard and is saving up money to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia, 53, is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. For the past twenty years she has been a fish vendor in the Philippines.

Olivia has applied for a 8000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. She continues to work hard so as to insure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Medoline

texts.en:
Medoline is a woman with a lot of honesty and wisdom who is a go getter. She is very industrious and resides in the Chuka area of Kenya. Medoline has been farming for the past five years. Through these years, she has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Medoline is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Chuka area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Medoline could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Medoline, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Medoline believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Medoline to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Don Julián, tiene 63 años de edad, está casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside en un sector del municipio de Choloma, Cortes junto a su esposo y tres de sus hijos. El siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender leña y hace 6 años comenzó con la compra y venta de Chatarra (material reciclable), compra aparatos electrónicos en mal estado, material en hierro, aluminio, materiales en acero, bronce etc. estos materiales y artículos los vende como chatarra en las empresas de reciclaje. Lleva 4 ciclos de préstamos en la institución con el prestamo que está solicitando actualmente y es por 21,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar un lote de artículos para chatarra y con una parte va complementar la compra de un pequeño terreno. Su objetivo es formar un patrimonio para sus hijos y poder comprar una casa más cerca a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Julián is 63 years old and is married. He has four children and he lives in an area of the municipality of Choloma, Cortes along with his wife and three of his children. He has always worked in trade. Previously, he worked selling firewood and six years ago he started buying and selling scrap (recycled material). He buys electronics in disrepair, iron materials, aluminum, steel materials, bronze and other items. He sells these materials and articles as scrap to recycling companies.

Julián has had four loans with this institution. The current loan he is requesting is for 21,000 HNL which he will use to buy a batch of scrap and part will supplement the purchase of a small piece of land. His goals are to have some assets for his children and to be able to buy a home closer to the city.

loans.use: to buy a batch of scrap items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more land for farming

loans.name: Virginia Jeannette

texts.es:
Virginia tiene como negocio la venta de tortillas, oficio que aprendió y desarrolla desde hace cinco años, nace por la necesidad de ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos, pues ella no tiene otro tipo de ingresos, es viuda, actualmente vive con dos hijos y una hermana.
Solicita un crédito para comprar maíz y leña para tener un inventario fortalecido para continuar preparando la venta de tortillas, espera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y que tanto sus ventas como ingresos sean mayores.
Sus aspiraciones son pagar su deuda y ayudar siempre al sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Virginia runs a business selling tortillas, an occupation which she learned and developed over the past five years due to the necessity to earn income to cover her expenses. She does not have any other forms of income, is a widow and currently lives with two children and her sister.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood in order to strengthen her inventory and continue to prepare and sell tortillas. She hopes to keep her customers satisfied and to grow her sales and income. Her aspirations are to pay back her debt and always help in maintaining her household.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood in order to strengthen her inventory and continue to prepare and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Emmilliana

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Emmilliana, a practical woman. She has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Kapcherop in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Emmilliana is happily married and the proud mother of two children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk, and some side hustle business that she does to make ends meet. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Emmilliana to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

Lenders! If there is someone that you should invest in, then that person is Emmilliana. She will not let you down.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra, de 33  años, tiene un carisma e ímpetu envidiable  y afirma que nunca se deja vencer por  las circunstancias  y que  su hijo es su  motivación para seguir. Ella vende carnes frías ropa calzado y artículos para el hogar y ofrece el servicio de llamadas telefónicas negocios que  le ha permitido generar los ingresos que requiere para su sostenimiento y el de su hijo porque siendo madre soltera no cuenta con una pareja que le apoye con los gastos. Hace dos años que inició con la venta de carnes frías con un pequeño capital y con recursos de crédito provenientes de agiotistas que le cobraban un alto porcentaje de interés, sin embargo poco a poco logró fidelizar una buena clientela e incorporó la venta de ropa y artículos para el hogar por encargo de su clientela conformada por los habitantes del barrio donde reside. Sandra proyecta aprovechar la temporada de fin de año ofreciendo un mayor surtido de productos, por lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en la compra de ropa, calzado, juguetes y demás productos demandados por su clientela. Su sueño de prosperidad es ver crecer su negocio, generar mayores ingresos día a día y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra, 33 years old, has enviable charisma and energy and states that she will never allow herself to give up. Her son is her inspiration to keep going.

She sells cold meat, clothing, footwear, and household items, and she provides phone service for businesses. This has allowed her to generate the income that she needs to provide for herself and her son, because, as a single mother, she doesn't have a partner to help her with expenses.

Two years ago she began selling cold meats with a small capital and by borrowing money from usurers, who charge a very high interest rate. Nonetheless, bit by bit she was able generate a good clientele. She began selling clothing and household items for her customers, who are residents of the neighborhood she lives in.

Sandra plans to take advantage of the end of the year seasons by providing a wide range of products, which is why she is applying for her first CrediKiva loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use the loan to buy clothing, footwear, toys, and other products that are in high demand by her customers.

Her dream is to see her business grow, generate a higher income day by day and provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, toys, etc.

loans.name: Aleyda Del Carmen

texts.es: Aleyda es una mujer luchadora quien gracias a sus esfuerzos ha logrado mantener y sacar adelante su negocio, ella tiene la edad de 46 años, acompañada y madre de un hijo de diez años. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapato desde hace diez años. Solicita por tercer ciclo  el financiamiento de la institución para desarrollar su negocio con la compra de blusas, camisetas, pantalones, faldas y chores. Uno de sus proyectos futuros es tener su tienda. Con el crédito anterior logro comprar un televisor.
texts.en:
Aleyda is a hardworking woman who, thanks to her efforts, has managed to maintain and get ahead in her business. She is forty-six years old, has a partner, and is mother to a two year old child. She has worked selling clothing and shoes for ten years.

For her third cycle (of loans), she requests funding from the institution to grow her business with the purchase of blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, and shorts. One of her future projects is to have her own store. With her previous loan she was able to buy a TV.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, and shorts.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 54 years old and the mother of five children whom she adores and cherishes. For the last five years, she has earned a living largely by mixed farming. She is very experienced at growing maize and raising dairy cows, which she enjoys doing. Although Margaret has been making profits, life is not easy for this humble and industrious mother. Her farm has not been producing as large a harvest as it could because of a lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and seeds so she can expand her farm. She believes that this loan will ensure a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. It will also allow her to expand her horticulture business and take care of her family

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Aida Sofia

texts.es: Aida de 53 años  es una ama de casa ejemplar y una amante de la cocina por lo que no dudó en aprovechar la oportunidad de emprendimiento que le plantearon los empleados de un taller automotriz ubicado frente a su casa: ellos necesitaban que les suministraran meriendas y refrescos. Inició vendiendo chichas, bebida derivada principalmente de la fermentación no destilada del maíz y otros cereales originarios de América y adicionalmente les ofrecía el servicio de llamadas telefónicas; posteriormente incorporó la elaboración y venta de sopas, hayacas, pasteles y picadas o bocaditos típicos de la región. Su negocio ha crecido poco a poco y actualmente cuenta con una buena clientela entre sus vecinos, transeúntes, empleados y clientes del taller automotriz. Aida está solicitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que proyecta comprar una vitrina calentadora más grande, una estufa y materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos. Con esta inversión ella afirma que diversificará su gama de productos y generará mejores ingresos. Su meta es que su negocio siga creciendo y seguir ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aida, 53 years old, is an exemplary housewife who loves the kitchen. And she didn't hesitate to take advantage of the opportunity suggested by the employees of an automobile workshop located in front of her house. The workers needed someone to offer them lunches and drinks.

Aida began selling "chichas," drinks derived principally from the un-distilled fermentation of corn and other cereals originating in America. In addition, she offered telephone call service. Later, she began making and selling soups, local tamales, pastries, and snacks typical of the region. Her business has grown little by little and, at present, can count on a good clientele consisting of neighbors, people passing by, employees, and customers from the auto repair shop.

Aida is requesting her first Kiva loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With this, she plans to buy a larger glass-case heater, a stove, and primary materials needed for preparing her products. She affirms that this will permit her to diversify her range of products and generate better income.

Aida's goal is for her business to continue growing and to be able to continue helping her children.

loans.use: purchase a larger glass-case warmer, a New stove, and primary materials required for preparing the products she sells.

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en: Jojie is 41 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan from NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her animals. Jojie has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Her goal for the future is to expand her pig farm.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Beatrice, one of the most hardworking women on planet earth. She is 43 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Metkei, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Beatrice has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past ten years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business (sewing business).

Beatrice is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her four children. She is contented with the farming way of life. Beatrice is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal.

The Eldoret area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being an older woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Beatrice feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Beatrice is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in college. Please help Beatrice so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Karina Celeste

texts.es: Karina es una joven laboriosa de 24 años, soltera y madre de dos niños de 2 y 5 años por quienes trabaja duro para sacarlos adelante, desde hace cuatro años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, es el primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento de los socios de Kiva porque desea agrandar su negocio al ofertar más mercadería, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de camisas, pantalones, vestidos y chores. Una de sus metas es desarrollar su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina is a hard-working 24 year old single mother with two children, aged 2 and 5. She works hard to bring them up and for the last four years she has earned a living selling clothes and cosmetics.

It is the first time she has requested financing from Kiva partners and she is doing this because she wants grow her business so she can offer more merchandise. She is applying for a loan in order to buy shirts, pants, dresses and shorts. One of her goals is to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, dresses and shorts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old and widowed with five children. With two children in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Nancy has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Beneditor

texts.en:
Speaking with Beneditor, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with a handsome husband and their angelic looking child. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

She has been doing agriculture for seven years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity. Beneditor is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards.

Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Beneditor and her family. The job that she does as a smallholder farmer is worthy of applause and makes her deserving of the help that she is asking for. Go for it, make a loan

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya does outreach sales. She works six days a week. She sells scarves, tights, socks, handkerchiefs, and children's shoes. The most popular goods are tights for women and children.

Nataliya is asking for a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase goods to sell. The loan will help her to increase the assortment of scarves, tights, socks and shoes to get additional income.

loans.use: to purchase scarves, tights, socks and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer trabajadora de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su   compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 11 años de edad a la que apoya en sus estudios, ya que desea que ella tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Ana se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de tortillas y papas fritas, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, apoyada además de su compañero de vida, además gracias a este negocio ella puede estar pendiente de su hija, ya que realiza su trabajo en su vivienda. El corredor en el que Ana atiende a sus clientes, está muy deteriorado, por lo que ella desea mejorar el techo y encementar el piso de la misma, también construir un muro que le permita proteger el corredor de la lluvia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y polines para mejorar el corredor y área del negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a very hardworking forty-one year old woman who lives with her life partner and her small eleven year old daughter. She supports her daughter in her studies since she wants her to have a better quality of life. Ana has worked for several years selling tortillas and chips, a job which allows her to support her household and also her partner. In addition, thanks to this business she can look after her daughter since she works from home.

The corridor in which Ana serves her customers is very deteriorated, which is why she wants to improve the roof and cement the floor at the same time. She also wants to build a wall to protect the corridor from the rain. That’s why she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, and beams to improve the corridor and area of her business.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, and beams to improve the corridor and area of her business.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado se llama Kuña Pora, está en su ciclo 30 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son unidas y se sacrifican para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por mejorar su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jacinta, quien es una excelente modista, es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace todo tipo de confecciones, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos. Ella se está esforzando para poder mejorar en su emprendimiento y de esa forma poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones, cierres y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar en lo que cada una está haciendo por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group named "Kuña Pora" is in its 30th cycle of the women's committee program. They are united and make sacrifices to be able to get ahead and help their loved ones. They are in the poverty elimination program, making the effort to improve their quality of life.

One of the members is Jacinta, who is an excellent dressmaker. She is a very hard working woman who makes all types of productions and through her work she has the means to be able to help her family and loved ones. She is making an effort to be able to improve her enterprise and in that way to continue serving her clients.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it purchasing fabrics, thread, elastic, buttons, fasteners, and other things and through this way to be able to continue fulfilling her clients' orders.

The group members are thankful for the opportunity they receive to be able to improve what each one is doing to better their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, buttons, fasteners, and other things to use in production.

loans.name: Oseas

texts.en:
Oseas was able to manage his farm so that he absolutely met the needs of his family. Until now, the farm was still doing well and was giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With his generated revenue, he was able to save for their future needs.

Recently, he took a new loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer to improve his farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Oseas expects an increase in the harvest so as to expand his farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coconut plantation.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Gleceria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, thread, etc. for her business.

Gleceria has been in this business for ten years now.

Gleceria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, thread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 46 years old and has five children. She is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Luisa is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Luisa has been farming corn for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Feliciana is 56 years old now.

Feliciana has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Feliciana has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es: Verónica es una mujer emprendedora de 31 años de edad, acompañada y  madre de dos hijos por los que trabaja día a día para sacarlos adelante con sus esfuerzos, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de acero desde hace dos años, Ella ha mostrado ser una mujer responsable y puntual con los pagos de créditos anteriores, esta vez solicita el financiamiento numero dieciséis de la institución porque quiere invertir en la compra cadenas, anillos, pulseras y aretes, con créditos anteriores logro comprar una refrigeradora y un ropero. Su nuevo proyecto es poner una joyería.
texts.en:
Veronica is an enterprising, 31-year old woman, in a relationship and the mother of two children. To help her children get ahead, she works hard daily. For two years, Veronica has earned a living selling steel jewelry.

She has shown herself to be a responsible woman, on time with her payments for previous loans. This time Veronica is asking for her 16th loan from the organization because she wants to invest in the purchase of necklaces, rings, bracelets and earrings.
