With previous loans, Veronica was able to buy a refrigerator and a wardrobe. Her new plan is to start a jewelry store.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, rings, bracelets and earrings.

loans.name: Liwaya

texts.en:
Liwaya is 34 years old and married with two children. With her two children currently in school, Liwaya works very hard to provide for them.

Liwaya runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Liwaya has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc.

In the future, Liwaya would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susana is 25 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Susana has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Susana has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 43 years old and has five children. She is widowed, and four of her children are in school.

Lorna is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lorna has been in this business for 22 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy peanuts, achiote, mustard, black sauce and other spices.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nena works hard to support her family.

She has a trucking service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and a general store. Nena is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance for her trucking service business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her truck.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 43 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are enrolled in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Estela has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more clothing to sell.

Estela has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Flucy

texts.en:
Flucy is 53 years old and has six children. She is married and two 0f her children are still in school.

Flucy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Flucy has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flucy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 52-year-old married rice farmer with two children who resides in a village in the province of Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 1989. Her husband is 52 years old and earns some income from selling recycled things. One of her two children attends school and the other is a motorcycle mechanic. Together, they can make approximately $12 per day.

Sokha is requesting a loan because she wants to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan, she will be able to improve the family’s finances.

For her future plans, Sokha wants to expand her business, renovate a proper house and help her youngest child to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou is 29 years old and single.

Malou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Malou has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent soap, milk, sanitary pads, cereals, etc.

In the future, Malou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

Flora has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling feeds.

Flora dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María es una joven de veinte y seis años de edad, muy carismática y de sonrisa sincera, ella está saliendo de la carrera de Ingeniería en sistemas y computación, actualmente labora como docente universitaria en la misma universidad donde estudio, su madre quien tiene un negocio de pulpería ha hecho de ella una mujer muy estudiosa y trabajadora. 
Ella ha descubierto en un financiamiento de Kiva junto a MiCrédito una buena oportunidad para pagar su curso de titulación y por fin recibir su título, lo que le garantizaría un mejor salario y en el futuro optar a una maestría. Ella logra hacer un buen trabajo porque le apasiona todo lo que tenga que ver con la electrónica.
texts.en:
María is a 26-year-old young woman, who is very charismatic and has a sincere smile. She is finishing a degree in systems and computer engineering. She currently works as a teaching assistant at the same college where she studied. Her mother, who has a corner grocery business, has made her a very studious and hard-working young woman.

In the loan through Kiva and MiCrédito, she has found a good opportunity to pay for her final course and finally receive her official diploma. This will guarantee her a better salary and the option to attain a Master's in the future.

She successfully does good work because she is passionate about everything that has to do with electronics.

loans.use: to pay for final fees to officialize her degree

loans.name: Renelen

texts.en:
Renelen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell bananas business in the Philippines. Renelen has been in this business for 2 years now.

Renelen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Renelen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Los Centenos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Centenos está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras de éxito y un microempresario laborioso, es coordinado por Johana de 38 años de edad, acompañada, madre de cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas y ropa usada desde hace doce años donde oferta una amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes, cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas quien le ayuda a vender. Solicita  por segundo ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de cadenas, pulseras, anillos y aretes con créditos anteriores logro comprar unas sillas y una de sus metas es mantener el negocio, la segunda socia es Jaqueline de 22 años quien se dedica a la venta de pan, el tercer socio es Fernando de 37 años quien se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y la cuarta socia es Raquel de 24 años, se dedica a la venta de leña.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Los Centenos is made up of three entrepreneurial, successful women and a hardworking micro-entrepreneur. It is coordinated by Johana, who is 38 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has made a living in the sale of used and new clothing for the past twelve years, where she offers a wide variety of products to her customers. She works with the help of one of her daughters, who helps her make sales. She is applying for her second cycle of financing with the institution in order to buy necklaces, bracelets, rings and earrings. With her previous loan she was able to buy some chairs. One of her goals is to maintain her business.

The second member is Jacqueline. She is 22 years old and works selling bread. The third member is Fernando, who is 37 years old and works selling nacatamales (a dish of maize, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf). The fourth member is Raquel, who is 24 years old and works selling firewood.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, bracelets, rings and earrings.

loans.name: Vandy

texts.en:
Being a farmer, Vandy, who is a 47-year-old man, can only make $5 USD per day to support his family. Vandy resides in a rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He has three children and one of them is married. He has been a farmer for 10 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Vandy would like to get a low-interest loan from Kiva in order to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan since it will promote his health, environment, and living standards. He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like him.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa has been in the business of raising hogs and farming for the last six years. She is dependent on this livelihood to earn a living. She provides for five children ages 8-18. She is in need of capital because these businesses need four months to see an income. Marissa is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed, fertilizer and pesticides. This will ensure that her hogs have a sufficient supply of feed and she has farm inputs that will assure a better harvest in four months. Her profit will be for school fees for her children and food for her family. She is 43 years old from Ormoc, Leyte.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 28 years old and has six children. Analyn is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Analyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Analyn has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money for her children to go to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Rosalina successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as milk, coffee, cooking oil, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as milk, coffee, cooking oil, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma, 36 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past six years, Vilma has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, 56 years old, is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Catalina has run a general store in the Philippines for 23 years and also earns an income from food vending. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, milk, eggs, etc. to sell.

Catalina has previously borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, milk, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old and married with one child in school. Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Maribel has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 62 years old and married with five children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice. Merlinda has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 48 years old and has four children. Elvira is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Elvira is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elvira has been pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children.

He earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. He supplements this income with earnings from raising pigs. He is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cesar dreams that one day he will be able to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 59 years old and married with a dependant daughter aged 18.

Rufina raises hogs for an income so she can help with the needs of her family. This has been her business since the year 2000. She plans to use her loan to buy additional piglets to raise and hog feed to fatten her hogs. Rufina hopes that she will be able to produce healthy hogs that will attract buyers from the wet market at a good price.

She plans to improve her business and increase the hogs that she is raising in the future so her business will be more stable.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 44 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Noralyn is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Noralyn has been farming sugarcane for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 44 years old and has three children. Melanie is a married woman.

Melanie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Melanie requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Melanie has been in this business for 21 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with two children. Vilma is 35 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vilma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living through running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Anecita is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Anecita has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling peanut butter.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, 31 years old, is married and has six children, five of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past three years, Gina has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a tailoring business in the Philippines for eight years. She earns additional income from buying and selling purified drinking water.

Angelina successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie, 36 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Annalie has run a general store in the Philippines for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Annalie has previously borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and a general store. Marietta is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 51 years old, is married and has nine children, four of them in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them. For the past twenty years, Elena has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell. In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elisilda

texts.en:
Elisilda, 52 years old, is married and has three children, one still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past five years, Elisilda has operated a general store business in the Philippines.

Elisilda successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as coffee, cereals, juice, canned goods, detergent, soap, etc. to sell. Elisilda would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as coffee, cereals, juice, canned goods, detergent, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Jacquelyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Jacquelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 54 years old and has six children. Luciana is married and has one child who is still in school.

Luciana is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Luciana requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds, etc. for her business.

Luciana has been involved in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds, etc. for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Erlinda is borrowing 40,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Blas está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comités, ellas son 18 mujeres unidas y trabajadoras de la ciudad de Caacupé, son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que se unieron a este grupo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo unido y de las capacitaciones que ofrece la fundación paraguaya a través de su programa.
La señora Blasida es una de las mujeres que integra este grupo, es muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con una peluquería que tiene en su casa y que con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar. Todos los días trabaja arduamente y se esfuerza para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y de esa forma poder evitar que pasen por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que atravesar.
Blasida se esfuerza mucho para poder crecer y salir adelante, pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, gomas, y otros insumos que ella necesita para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y también poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group, called San Blas, is in its fifth cycle with the program. The group is made up of 18 united, hardworking women in the city of Caacupé. They are friends and neighbors who live in this city, who joined together in this group to be able to improve their living conditions through the joint work and trainings offered by the Paraguayan foundation through the program.

Blasida is one of the women who joined this group. She is very hardworking and selfless, helping to support her family with a hair salon that she has in her house which she was able to put together through great effort. Everyday she works arduously and makes an effort to provide her family with all she could not have, so that they may avoid going without necessities as she had to.

Blasida makes great effort to grow and advance. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, hairbands, and other supplies that she needs in order to be able to continue growing her business and also to help her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her hair salon, such as: dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, hairbands, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hermanita

texts.en:
Hermanita is 66 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for twenty-nine years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Hermanita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sulhiy

texts.ru: Сулхия доброжелательная женщина. Её 41 лет. Она замужем и имеет двое детей. Она с раннего возраста была приучена к труду. Окончив 9 классов школы, Сулхия устроилась на работу на ферму, чтобы помогать родителям. Сулхия трудолюбивая женщина.  Она никогда не жаловалась на свою работу. Она занимается животноводством. У неё в стаде 5 коров и 10 баранов. Её муж работает  строителем. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Сулхия с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Сулхия заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Sulhiy is a good-natured woman. She is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children. From an early age, she has been accustomed to labor. When she finished 8th grade, Sulhiy began doing farm work so that she could help her parents. Sulhiy is a hard-working woman. She has never complained about her work.

Sulhiy raises animals. In her herd, she has 5 cows and 10 sheep. Her husband works as a builder. Their combined incomes are enough for an average dwelling. However, they do not have enough funds to cover all the necessities.

At the moment, Sulhiy and her husband want to buy a few more head of livestock to fatten up. Therefore, she has applied to MDO Arvand to take out a loan to buy livestock. Sulhiy is thankful in advance to MDO Arvand for the support, which will improve the quality of life of Sulhiy's family.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.ru:
Максуда жизнерадостная и доброжелательная женщина в возрасте 29 лет. Она замужем и имеет четверо детей. Максуда очень любит свою семью, в особенности своих детей. Она старается со своим мужем трудиться, чтобы зарабатывать деньги на удовлетворение всех имеющихся нужд семьи. Она хочет, чтобы её дети получили хорошее образование и стали образованными людьми. 
Сама Максуда работает в швейном цехе, она сама швея. Этой профессии она выучилась в юности и знает все тонкости данной работы. Муж Максуды хочет уехать  на заработки за пределами страны. Так как то что он зарабатывает хдесь не хватает на жизнь.  Ему нужно купить билет и всё необходимое для поездки. Поэтому Максуда обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку билета для своего мужа. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Maksuda is a joyful and good-natured woman of 29 years. She is married and has 4 children. Maksuda loves her family a lot, particularly her children. She is trying to work with her husband to earn money for all of her family's necessities. She wants her children to receive good educations and become educated people.

Maksuda works in a sewing shop, and she is a seamstress. She learned this profession in her youth and knows all the subtleties of the work. Maksuda's husband wants to leave to find work abroad, because what he earns here is not enough to live. He needs to buy a ticket and all the necessities for his trip.

Therefore, Maksuda has applied to MDO Arvand to receive a loan for the purchase of her husband's ticket. She is very hopeful for a good outcome, and thanks MDO Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to buy a ticket and other travel expenses for her husband.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru:
Музафар жительница кишлака Газантарак , ей 58 лет. Она замужем  и имеет 4 детей.  Она работает  лаборанткой в центральной больнице.        
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Музафар вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Музафар выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Музафар получает хороший доход. Муж Музафар также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Музафар с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Музафар заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Muzafar is a resident of the village of Gazantarak, and she is 58 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She works as a lab assistant in the local hospital.

In order to have a steady income to support themselves, Muzafar and her husband began their own business. They practice animal husbandry. Muzafar raises livestock, and afterward sells the meat and milk that they get from the animals. Muzafar makes a good income from this business.

Muzafar's husband also works at the local workshop, and his work brings in additional income for the family. Their combined income is enough for an average living. However, they do not have the funds for all the necessities.

At the moment, Muzafar and her husband want to buy a few more head of livestock to fatten up. Therefore, Muzafar has applied to MDO Arvand to take out a loan to buy livestock. Muzafar is thankful in advance to MDO Arvand for their support, which will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Marison

texts.en:
Richarmae is 16 years old and is the first of five children in the family. Her mother Marison, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her shoe repair business in the Philippines.

Richarmae is studying to get her Bachelor of Science in Education and is currently on her first of this four year course.

Marison is borrowing 6000 PHP to pay tuition fees for her daughter Richarmae for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

Richarmae plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruits. Gloria is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 17 000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her manicure/pedicure service business.

Victoria has been in this business for 25 years. Victoria earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis es un joven microempresario de 29 años residenciado en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla que por la falta de oportunidades laborales  decidió apostarle al negocio familiar, en el que recibió la propuesta de su cónyuge con quien contrajo una sociedad.  Ellos comercializan electrodomésticos menores, sillas y mesas plásticas, utensilios para la cocina y demás artículos para el hogar, desde entonces Luis asumió el rol de comercialización puerta a puerta, actividad que ejecuta diariamente de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m.. Actualmente proyecta abrir un nuevo mercado para lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en la compra de  mesas y sillas plásticas, utensilios de cocina y electrodomésticos menores. Con esta inversión Luis espera duplicar sus ventas en los próximos 6 meses, fidelizar su clientela con buenos precios, calidad en los productos y buenos servicios y generar ingresos que le permitan a largo plazo reunir los recursos necesarios para comprar su vivienda propia.
texts.en: Luis is a young micro-entrepreneur who is 29 years old and a resident of a neighborhood of the municipality of Barranquilla. Due to a lack of job opportunities he decided to bet on his own family business, at the suggestion of his wife. They sell small home appliances, plastic chairs and tables, kitchen utensils and other products for the home. Since then Luis assumed the role of door-to-door salesman, an activity which he does daily from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Currently he plans to reach a new market for which he is applying for his first Kiva loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will invest the resources in the purchase of plastic tables and chairs, kitchen utensils and small home appliances. With this investment Luis hopes to double his sales in the next 6 months; solidify his customer base with good prices, quality products and good services; and earn income that will allow them in the long-run to jointly gather the resources necessary to buy their own home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of plastic tables and chairs, kitchen utensils and small home appliances.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es un joven es un joven muy esforzado que se dedica a la actividad de pesca. Solicita un préstamo de mil dólares ( $1,000), para la compra de materiales necesarios para acondicionar una embarcación de forma más segura que le permita generar mayor producción pesquera y de esta manera incrementar los ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Abel is a very hardworking young man who makes a living in fishery. He is applying for a loan of one thousand dollars ($1,000) in order to purchase materials necessary to fix a boat to be more secure, to allow him to generate greater fish production and in this way increase his earnings from this activity.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make improvements to a boat for catching fish.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny, 49, who is a lovely mother of three children, one married, lives in Santuk District, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. So far, it is more than 5 years that she has been involved in a small business which can earn a net profit of USD 4 per day. During this time, Ny has been facing a financial issue in her family. She decided to apply for a KIVA loan through HKL to buy more spice to expand her business and earn more income. She would thank to all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy more spice to expand her business

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 53 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Luzminda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

Luzminda is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Nita

texts.en:
Ma. Nita is 48 years old, married with six children. Four of her children are enrolled in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Nita has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned good, noodles, school supplies and other groceries to sell.

Ma. Nita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned good, noodles, school supplies and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the marketplace her business.

Lydia has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chicken. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her buy and sell rice business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and single. She helps her parents earn a living.

She runs a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock such as shirts, shorts, blouses, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Irene dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as shirts, shorts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon works hard to support her family. Sharon is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Sharon requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase an additional variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Sharon has been in this business for two years now.

Sharon would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Benilda es una mujer que deseaba emprender un proyecto para generar ingresos  y decidió incursionar en el negocio de los alimentos. Ella tenía experiencia en la elaboración y venta de fritos o pasabocas típicos de la Costa Caribe colombiana y hace 5 años  le ofrecieron la oportunidad de organizar su restaurante, reto que emprendió con resultados positivos hasta la fecha.  Benilda atiende su negocio de lunes a domingo en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m  en donde ofrece a vecinos y transeúnte, comidas típicas y especiales. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en la compra de víveres y alimentos al por mayor, pues se obtiene descuentos por volumen de compra. Benilda planea fidelizar su clientela con buenos precios y buena calidad de productos y servicios con lo que busca incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades las reinvertirá para el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Benilda is a woman who desired to start a business to generate income, and decided to venture into the sale of food. She had experience in making and selling fried snacks or "pasabocas," typical in Colombian cuisine of the Caribbean coast. Five years ago she was offered the opportunity to start her own restaurant, a challenge that she undertook with positive results up until the present. Benilda works at her business from Monday to Friday, from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., offering neighbors and passersby typical and special dishes.

Currently she seeks her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use the funds to purchase supplies and foods wholesale, as she obtains discounts by buying in bulk. Benilda plans to make her customers loyal with good prices and good quality products and services. In this way she seeks to increase her sales and profitability, which she will reinvest for the growth of her business.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies and foods wholesale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Catherine works hard to support her family.

She has a business, selling school and office supplies in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Catherine is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of school supplies to sell.

Catherine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of school supplies to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jane is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell for her butcher shop business.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is 47 years old and married. She has four children, who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. Joylyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Joylyn has been raising pig for 17 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joylyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru: Хусан жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он женат и имеет шестеро детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Хусан получает дополнительный доход от дехканства. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Хусана является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Хусану хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Хусан обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Хусан заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Husan is an optimistic 42-year old man. He is married and has six children. He has a close-knit family. They live in a rural area. In order to make a living, all family members try to earn money in some way, doing whatever they can. Husan  earns an extra income from working on a farm. His main stable source of income is raising livestock. He raises  cattle  for sale. His wife helps him in his business, taking care of the animals and also selling milk.  His cattle business brings a decent and stable income, which is why Husan would like to expand it. 

He would like to buy several heads of cattle for fattening and later resale. This is why Husan has applied to Arvand for a loan to buy livestock. He hopes that his business will grow successfully and result in greater profits, in order to ensure a good quality of life for the family. Husan thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ella tiene una pequeña despensa, en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana, hasta tarde en la noche. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo.
Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que pese a los problemas de la vida sigue luchando y esforzándose. Pide este préstamo para poder refaccionar su despensa, ya que quiere dar una mejor comodidad a sus clientes y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
Máxima is from the city of San Ignacio. She has a small store in which she works every day, from very early in the morning until late at night. She is very hardworking woman who helps her family through her work and effort. She is very self-sacrificing woman, who keeps on fighting and striving, despite the problems of life.

She seeks this loan to be able to refurbish her store, as she wants to provide more convenience to her customers. She is thankful for the opportunity to grow and improve that she is receiving.

loans.use: to refurbish her grocery store.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a widow who lives in Toril, Davao City near her grownup children. Although she can practically rely on her children to support her, she chooses to continue her business of hog raising to sustain her daily household needs. She knows that she’s still strong to earn a living and she feels a sense of productivity from it. She also strives to save enough in case of an emergency. 

Petronila wants to prepare for the rainy days when common illnesses of hogs occur. She will buy medicines, vitamins, and additional feed for the hogs. She appeals for 16,000 PHP in supplementary capital to procure all of these items. This financial assistance would be very helpful as she aims to distribute a larger volume of affordable pork within the community.
 
At her age, Petronila aspires not for big monetary returns but for good health and unity among her family members. She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their lives and businesses as well as to draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy medicines, vitamins, and additional feed for the hogs

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell housewares business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of housewares for her buy and sell housewares business.

Juanita has been in this business for 18 years. Juanita earns more income from buy and sell ready to wear.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of housewares

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
REHANA is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and is equally responsible for all of them. 

She belongs to an ultra-poor family, which is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of all of her children. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his activities. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he manufactures iron accessories such as doors, windows, tables, etc. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to increase in iron prices he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise efficiently he needs some capital to buy welding material. REHANA requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. so that he would be able to buy iron rods to carry on his business. 

REHANA is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. for her husband's blacksmith shop

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Lilibeth is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market for her fish vending business.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Lynde Mae

texts.en:
Lynde Mae is a hardworking female entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, coffee, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fish vending.

Lynde Mae dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, coffee, etc

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim, 52, who is a lovely mother of six children, five of whom are married, lives in Santuk District, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. 

So far, it is more than 10 years that she has been involved in a small business which can earn a net profit of USD 15 per day. During this time, Khim has been faced with a financial issue in her family which she still can’t afford. 

She decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy more spice to expand her business to get more income. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy more spice to expand her business

loans.name: Sophol

texts.en:
Sophol is a 49-year-old married motor taxi driver with one adult child in his care, and he lives in a village in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. For more than 15 years, he runs a motor taxi driver. 

His wife is a 48-year-old rice farmer and make up service and his child is a staff of Sovanna Super Market. Together, they can earn approximately $16 per day. 

Sophol is requesting a loan because he wants to purchase a motorcycle for his child to commute to work. This loan will help him have enough finances to buy a motorcycle, so his child will be able to have better traveling conditions. 

In the future, Sophol hopes to have enough money to build a proper house with fences around it.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his child to commute to work

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 65 years old, single, and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Nelly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Neri

texts.en:
Neri is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market for her fish vending business.

Neri has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 46 years old and has five children. Judelyn is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Judelyn is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Judelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Judelyn has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Judelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Caficultores Las Delicias Group

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Victoria, Yoro. Carlos siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijol para sostener  a su familia. Hace 5 años decidió cultivar café el cual le brinda mejores ingresos, este café lo vende en grano a intermediarios de la misma zona. Ha formado un grupo de cinco personas para solicitar un prestamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes y limpiar la finca de café y mejorar la cosecha. Sus metas son mantener la finca, hacerla crecer y darle calidad de vida a su familia. El grupo se llama Caficultores las Delicias, formado por 5 miembros que también se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos y café. El prestamo grupal suma 90,000 Lempiras para fertilizar y limpiar sus fincas de café. En la foto están. a la izquierda esta Carlos, Paulino, Jose, Noé y Marlon a la derecha.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old. He lives in free union with his partner, with whom he has two children. He lives in a village in the township of Victoria, Yoro. Carlos has always raised corn and beans to sustain his family. Five years ago he decided to grow coffee, which offers him better income. He sells his coffee beans to intermediaries in the same zone. 

He has formed a group of five people to apply for a loan to buy compost and fertilizers, clean the coffee planting, and improve the harvest. His goals are to maintain the farm, make it grow, and give quality of life to his family.

The group is called Caficultores las Delicias, formed by five members who also work in raising basic grains and coffee. The group loan adds up to 90,000 lempiras to fertilize and clean their coffee plantings. In the photo they are, from the left, Carlos, Pauino, José, Noé, and Marion on the right.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers, and clean the coffee planting

loans.name: Ma. Line

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Line works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines and also earns income from rice retailing. 

Ma. Line is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients and utensils for her bakery business.

Ma. Line has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her bakery business.

loans.name: Maa Maulishg-A Group

texts.en:
Gitanjali is the featured borrower of Maa Maulishg-A. She is the one standing on the extreme left in the photograph. She is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of infection and falls ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month.

Gitanjali, along with her other group members, is asking for a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic and well-equipped toilet. Access to the toilet will help her to protect her privacy and increase her convenience. In this way, she will be able to promote cleanliness in her community.

loans.use: to build a hygienic and well equipped toilet

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg A-3 Group

texts.en:
Sabitri, 46, is standing on the left hand side of the photograph. She is a widow who lives with her two children who are 18 years and 22 years old. She has taken care of and brought up her children with great effort and love. Once they were older, she had more free time so she began to teach herself different crafts such as sewing, decorating terracotta statues of Lord Jagannath, and other handicrafts. Little by little she created her products and began to sell them to her neighbours and friends. She added in clothing, which added to her income. This has generated an income that supports her household finances.

Sabitri, along with her group member, is asking for a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of supplies and merchandise at wholesale, such as Samuka (used for decoration) items, wood, fabric, thread, paint, etc. This will allow her to continue to work and offer more variety to her customers. It will allow her to fill the orders on time and increase her sales and income. The financial support will help her to strengthen and grow her business even more with the aim of generating job opportunities for some family members who need a job and thereby improve the quality of life for her whole family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies and merchandise at wholesale such as Samuka (used for decoration) items, wood, fabric, thread, and paint

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
From Fatima, General Santos City, here is Imelda, 39 years old, who is busy with her two enterprises: a “sari-sari” or variety store that sells common consumables and a coin-operated internet café called Piso Net that provides affordable internet for short-time users.

She doesn’t stop thinking about the possible ways to enhance her businesses. She aspires that in due time her variety store will grow into a big grocery that will also sell school supplies, while her Piso Net will flourish into a big internet café. 

For now she slowly works towards that goal. She plans to buy an additional computer unit and to stock up on grocery items and beverages to sell in her store. She applied for PHP 30,000 supplementary capital to meet this purpose.

Additional income that will be derived from this loan will augment their ability to pay for their daily expenditures and tuition fees of her two children who are studying in college. She and her husband, Julieto, a construction lead man, exert their best efforts to achieve their dream of completing their children’s education. They also plan to renovate their house soon. 

Imelda is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 29 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband owns a small firm in which he has a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories. He employs laborers for his molding machines on daily wages.

For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories, he needs different categories and qualities of raw material. Now he has taken a huge contract, larger than before, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy additional crushed raw material to continue his manufacturing. 

Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy crushed plastic raw material for his molding machine. She has to look after a huge family, taking care of each of her children, including their school fees, diet and health. For these purposes she needs a large income and her husband is the only person who is responsible for bearing the household expenses. 

Abida is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crushed plastic raw material for her husband's plastic accessories manufacturing business.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi, a 44-year-old rural woman, is a resident of Ramthenga village in Falakata, West Bengal. She hails from a poor family and resides with her daughter, son and her husband in a small house. Laxmi, in her young age, was deprived of an education due to her family's financial issues, so she is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her son works as a fitter and her daughter is a student in grade nine in the village school.

Laxmi is a housewife. The main source of income for her family is vegetable cultivation. Laxmi helps her husband in the field after she is relieved of her household activities. They possess a plot of land where they cultivate vegetables like eggplant, cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, etc. and sell the products in the daily market of the nearest town. The income from this business is insufficient to meet the daily household expenses, the farming expenses and also the educational expenses of her daughter. Due to this financial shortage, Laxmi wants to start paddy cultivation for additional income. Being the staple in the region, paddy is in great demand in her local area. For this reason, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.

With this loan amount, she wants to purchase good quality fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for paddy farming. She expects a good return by expanding her cultivation. Laxmi now feels that she can strengthen her family's economy.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Ester Abigail

texts.es: Ester tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 13, 11, 5 y 2 años de edad. Ester es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace varios años, por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia y la confianza de las personas que prestan sus servicios. Ester desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda, ya que ella ha iniciado con la construcción de su vivienda poco a poco, como se observa en la fotografía, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un cuarto y cumplir su sueño de terminar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ester is 29. She lives in her own house along with her life partner and four children, ages 13, 11, 5 and 2. Ester is a hardworking woman who has been working as a housekeeper for several years, so she has a lot of experience and her customers trust her.

Ester wants to add a room to her house, which she has been building little by little, as seen in the photograph. She is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a room and fulfill her dream of completing her house.

loans.use: to invest in: bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a room and fulfill her dream of completing her house.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 25-year-old, married woman from the small village of Raychenga in Falakata in the district of Alipurduar. She is raising three children (two sons and one daughter) with her husband. Her children are all students in the village school. Her husband Manindra is a greengrocer. The meager income that her husband earns is quite insufficient for the family, so Anita strives hard to give the family financial sustenance.

She is a housewife who has been running a livestock business for five years. She is a very tenacious and hardworking woman. She raises cows and sells milk in the local market and also supplies milk in her locality. She also sells cow dung, which is widely used as farm manure. With an aim to develop her business, Anita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will buy a dairy cow with the loan to expand the business of milk supply. She expects a huge profit from the business, as milk is in great demand in her locality.

Anita plans to re-invest the income in her business. She also plans to save money for the further education of her children.

Anita gives her hearty thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman with three children. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables and other crops. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy seeds. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a married man with five children. He operates a retail business where he makes jaggery (sugar) to sell. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy equipment for making jaggery. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy equipment for making jaggery (sugar).

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita, 42, wakes up very early in the morning and sleeps late at night because she has to look after her sari-sari (variety) store located in Fatima, General Santos City, South Cotabato. Some customers buy as early as 4:30 a.m. or as late as 10:30 p.m., and she has to meet their needs or else her business will fail due to competition within the area. Her husband, Lando, who works during the day, takes a turn in watching over her store after his work ends.

Crestita also rents out a passenger jeepney for additional income. She has to maximize all their resources because she has three children who are studying in college, high school and elementary levels. It’s not a joke to support the educational expenses in the Philippines, because it’s really pocket-draining. Hence, Crestita aspires to obtain an additional loan of PHP 20,000 which she can use to buy more dry goods, grocery items, soft drinks, and sacks of rice to enhance her inventory. Hopefully this will ease her family’s financial burden with the expected increase in her sales and profit.

Crestita is a faithful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods, grocery items, softvdrinks, and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of clothes to sell for her clothing retail business.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mayana

texts.en:
Mayana hails from Falakata. She is 41 years old, married, and a housewife. She is a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her daughter got married after completing her college education and her son is a small service holder. They live in a small village, Borodoba, in Falakata, Alipurduar district.

Dynamic and hardworking, Mayana's husband is running a business of growing seasonal vegetables. Though a housewife, Mayana helps her husband in every way, especially at the time of harvesting and selling their products to the local markets. Due to the seasonal demand, his income is unsteady and insufficient for the family's household. With the addition of the cultivation of paddy, he will not only be able to increase his monthly income, but also add to its consistency because paddy is an all-season crop, a staple food of most of the rural areas and is in high demand in the local market. So they want to cultivate paddy on their farm land but money is the main hindrance.

In order to help her husband, Mayana has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to start paddy cultivation. She wants to use the loan to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to start cultivation. The loan will help Mayana keep her family afloat with a stable monetary condition. She dreams of expanding their agribusiness with the outcome profit.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds, pesticides and other farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Josil

texts.en:
Josil is 38 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Josil has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Josil requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchenwares for her restaurant.

Josil has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Josil would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenwares for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Maa Maulishg-B Group

texts.en:
Nrupa, 38, standing on the extreme left is the featured borrower of Maa Maulishg-B and hails from a small village of Titilagarh, Odisha.

Nrupa and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private. She and her family are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Nrupa understands the importance of having a toilet at home. She leads a group of two women who have come together to apply for a loan of 45,000 INR. They need the loan to build toilets in their respective homes. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This hardworking entrepreneur is Thelma, 42 years old, from Fatima, General Santos City. She operates a variety store combined with a coin-operated internet café called Piso Net. She has 15 computers, but during peak hours of internet surfing, customers still line up waiting for their turn. This usually happens during weekends, holidays and vacations. During school break time, students also do research on their projects and assignments. These internet users are also buyers from her store.

Sometimes Thelma runs out of stock of beverages and snack items. Therefore she applied for PHP 50,000 loan to enhance her business. She will use it mainly to buy more supplies for her store, and partly to acquire another computer. Her business is quite beneficial for her family because it adds to the income of her husband, Ricky, an operator. Both of them do their best to provide for their daily needs and the educational expenses of their children.

Thelma regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative to draw strength and inspiration from sharing of life experiences and lessons from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making jaggery (sugar).

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her family's challenge to be inadequate water supply. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will continue getting funds from SMEP microfinance to enable her to achieve her dreams. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling clothes and a frozen foods businesses.

Maricel dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: Hadijah is a 35-year-old married woman living with her three children in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in selling fresh foods as a vendor in the markets. This is her main source of income. She is very hardworking with an aim of looking after her family with all the necessary basic needs. In spite of this, she is challenged by insufficient capital and an increased rate of perishability. Her aspirations are building a permanent house and also educating her children up to University.  Hadijah has requested a loan to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall business.

Ma. Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, in which he sells artificial jewelry such as rings, earrings, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case, for the attraction of customers.

He is the family's sole source of income; he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his children, and household expenses alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Nagina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan funds so her husband can buy inexpensive jewelry, which will enable him to increase his earnings.

She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members may pass their lives comfortably. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to buy inexpensive artificial jewelry for her husband's jewelry shop.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry and goats and also grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase farm production. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
