As a married parent of six children, Sharifa works hard to support her family.

She has a pharmacy business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from videoke rentals. Sharifa is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of medicine for her pharmacy business.

Sharifa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Richel works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from soft drink retailing. Richel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Richel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es: Celedonio tiene actualmente 63 años, pero su actividad como emprendedor la inició hace 10 años cuando por la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia realizó un curso de electricista y creó un negocio minorista dedicado a la reparación de pequeños electrodomésticos, actividad que desarrolla tanto en el taller como a domicilio. El repara pequeños aparatos electrodomésticos, como planchas, batidoras, cafeteras, licuadoras, hornos, estufas entre otros; por otra parte, también vende componentes o piezas para quienes quieran intentar realizar la reparación por ellos mismos. Sus clientes son los habitantes del barrio y barrios circunvecinos que  acuden por dos motivos: algunos por cercanía y otros por recomendación de familiares, vecinos y amigos. Actualmente Celedonio planea invertir en repuestos y accesorios que le permitan tener una mayor oferta para lo cual esta solicitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Celedonio tiene como meta mejorar la imagen de su negocio, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Celedonio is 63 years old, His activity as an entrepreneur began 10 years ago, when out of the need to generate income for his family, he took an electrician course. And he created a retail business dedicated to repairing small appliances, a business he does both in his shop and at homes. He repairs small appliances like irons, beaters, coffee makers, blenders, stoves and ovens amongst others. And at the same time he also sells parts and pieces to people who are attempting their own repairs. His clients are the inhabitants of his neighborhood and the adjacent areas. They come to him for two reasons: some as he is close and others on the recommendation of family, neighbors and friends.

Celdonio is currently planning to invest in parts and accessories which will allow him to have greater offerings. So he is requesting his first loan from Kiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Celedonio has the goal of improving the image of his business, increasing his income and improving his quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in spare parts and accessories which would allow him greater offerings.

loans.name: Jesan

texts.en:
Jesan works hard to support herself. She is single and has a beauty products business in the Philippines.

Jesan requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more beauty products to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Jesan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Marlene Judith

texts.es: Marlene es una emprendedora Barranquillera de 56 años cuyo mayor orgullo es el poder aportar a la educación y éxito de sus hijos. Ella trabajó como empleada en almacenes de calzado, pero cuando tuvo sus hijos se dedicó a estudiar belleza corporal para posteriormente iniciar su proyecto de negocio brindando los servicios de masajes a domicilio y en las instalaciones que organizó en su casa  para que sus clientes puedan  someterse a los tratamientos de corporales. Marlene cuenta con una nutrida clientela dispersa por los diferentes barrios de la ciudad de Barranquilla, la cual  ha fidelizado con buena atención y calidad en sus servicios. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en la compra de una nueva camilla, lámpara, sábanas y toallas, que requiere para mejorar la adecuación de sus instalaciones. Marlene sueña con tener un negocio de estética grande que le brinde prosperidad a su familia y que sus hijos logren una estabillidad económica y laboral.
texts.en:
Marlene is a 56-year-old entrepreneur from Barranquilla whose greatest pride is the ability to contribute to her children's education and success. She worked as an employee in shoe stores, but when she had her children she dedicated herself to studying spa therapy in order to subsequently begin her business project providing massage services in homes and in a facility she set up in her house so that her clients can undergo body treatments.

Marlene has a considerable clientele dispersed throughout the different neighborhoods in the city of Barranquilla. She has built their loyalty with good attention and the quality of her services. She is currently negotiating her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to invest the resources in purchasing a new massage table, lamp, sheets, and towels, which she needs to improve her facility's accommodations.

Marlene dreams of having a large beauty parlor that provides prosperity to her family and that her children may achieve economic and job stability.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing a new massage table, lamp, sheets, and towels, which she needs to improve her facility's accommodations.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 38 years old and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a weaver and knot blankets at home. Wool is used in making knotting blankets. There is no better kind of blankets than blankets made by hand; though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones.

Her husband is very expert and knots very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time-consuming procedure; he knots blankets over nights. This is why her husband sells them for a high price, but the problem is the customers do not agree upon the demanded cost. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing from time to time. However, her husband wants to buy more raw materials for knotting blankets but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible.

Therefore, Shazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy wool for knotting blankets and it could become the cause of an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy wool for knotting blankets for her husband's business sellling blankets.

loans.name: Volonika

texts.en:
Volonika is a mother of four children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is in the most lucrative business of buying and selling cocoa which she has operated for 10 years now. To supplement her income she sells food stuffs like maize and cassava flour. Volonika faces the challenge of seasonality of the cocoa that causes price changes and reduced profits during the cocoa off peak. 

She is a hard working and determined lady hoping that through her hard work she will be able to expand her business by buying from more cocoa plantations. Volonika wants to use the loan to buy more cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to resell
